Reviews.Title: “Great base for family trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: 26CumbriaGill
Reviews.Content: Fab base for a family trip to NYC. Two adults & teenagers stayed in 2 bed suite on April 2012- clean, comfortable & convenient. We had everything we needed. Made the week very easy. Would def stay again. Great value for money & great location. Neighbourhood quiet but within 5 mins of attractions. Views from 21st floor amazing. Couldn't have asked for more. Concierge got us reservations we needed too.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Recovery”
Reviews.Author: screenwriter2006
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like to stay here because of its convenient location, spacious rooms, reasonable rates, and very nice staff. But we were there in February when several school groups from the US and overseas were overwhelming their chaperones and carousing the halls at night. We brought it to the attention of Negesti and her front desk colleagues and they corrected the problem -- they talked to the chaperones and moved us to the top floor where we didn't hear a peep during our remaining night there. Nice to stay in a place that empathizes with your problematic situation and seeks to correct it.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: TeeboTeebo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four days in New York. My daughter and I shared a studio suite at this hotel and we were very happy indeed. The hotel is not luxurious, but it is clean and welcoming. The bed was extremely comfortable and the air conditioned room was spacious. Windows can be opened if required, but this let the city noise in. However, air conditioning was quiet. There were plenty of clean towels and the kitchen was fully equipped - microwave, full size cooker and fridge as well as dishes, cups, cutlery and pans (washing up liquid, tea towels and cloths provided too). We made our own breakfast each morning. Food shops are close by. The hotel staff were helpful and smiling. Nothing was too much trouble. There's free access to the internet to confirm return flights and print off boarding cards and taxis to the airport can be ordered without any hassle. The hotel is ideally located for all the main attractions. Just remember to take comfortable shoes and be prepared to queue - for just about for everything!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for family living”
Reviews.Author: travel1234Spain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Chistmas as we wanted a spacious apartmentment with a separate Bedroom. Room for us all to spread out. Yes it is dated and needs improving but we had everything we needed, full kitchenette, large spacious lounge, spaciopus bedroom withon suite and a 2nd bathroom, and so much storage space, with 7 suitcases that was very welcome. We were dissapointed that the Hotel tried it on and tried to charge extra for our 16 year old son. After some debate when we stood our ground pointing out that we had booked for three adults in a suite that sleeps 4 they should not try and charge for an extra bed that was already there (and paid for)

Reviews.Title: “Eastgate tower hotel”
Reviews.Author: SallyW348
Reviews.Content: Huge suite, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 3 tellys, comfortable and clean with 3 double beds, sofa bed, sitting/dining room and small kitchen, superb accommodation for family of six (including 4 teenagers) to relax in after long days sightseeing. Clean, quiet, good location if you don't mind 10 minute walks to sights, e.g. Empire State building, and helpful, friendly staff. Lots of diners and convenience stores around the block, there is no dinning room at the hotel. Would recommend for families or group of friends looking for value for money and a comfortable base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Murray Hill Comfort”
Reviews.Author: sydneymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eastgate the end of March 2012 for 4 nights. We had a spacious 1 bedroom 2 bat suite on the 25th floor. The lobby and hallways are not much to look at but the personnel DEFINITELY make up for that. We loved being welcomed by Stefanie and Lucy. We were so taken care of by Ash, the bellman, and how can we forget Ann, the Concierge? Ann was witty, knew all the great places to eat, how to get to our destinations the quickest way possible and was a KICK to talk to. Juan, the towncar driver, was kind and efficiently got us to JFK. We LOVED our stay at the Eastgate. We walked and walked all around this marvelous city and took subways etc. The people of New York were so kind and helpful. Great place for eats near the Eastgate...DEAN'S and SARGE'S DELI. Don't forget the Chinese take out around the corner for a night in...YUM!

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: JohnBiggar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in late February - early March on this occasion, but we have stayed here before. If you want to have any sort of prolonged stay in NYC (4 days plus), we would recommend this hotel. But it is seriously "Do it yourself"! No breakfast room, and not many restaurants hereabouts. The reception staff were less than friendly - strictly business! - but the room attendants - Joyce in particular - were great. I'll be visiting NYC on my own in July, and won't stay here, but I'll be back in October with my wife, and this will be our place.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, good location, outdated furnishings”
Reviews.Author: socalers
Reviews.Content: Although we've stayed a number of times in the terrific Affinia Dumont, we were looking for something more economical this trip. We were very pleased with the roominess of our one bedroom suite and the price we paid for it. The location was excellent for our purposes. We love Manhattan but don't want to be in the middle of the madness (think Times Square Doubletree) the minute we walk out the hotel front door. The furnishings are anything but up to date and the walls are pretty bare, but if you don't mind that you'll find this place a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip for family”
Reviews.Author: Ellyn50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Oct and it was great. Spacious and what a plus to have a kitchen! Staff was very helpful and close to my daughter. We have tried many places but I think we finally found our home away from home. My daughter liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: scogirl
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault the reception staff enough, unfriendly, unhelpful and generally speaking; everything appeared to be too much trouble. I have never stayed in a hotel and had so many problems just checking in - think Little Britain.. "Computer says no!". Arrived after a long haul flight to find rooms were not ready, they did however store our luggage until later in the day when the rooms were ready - arrived at our room to find no bedding on sofa bed - however, this was quickly remedied by the housekeeping team. Positives... location is very good, our room looked out to the side and was quiet - air con was a nice addition. The hotel is very dated, but to give housekeeping their dues it was spotlessly clean - they do the best they can. Lovely big room, ours was an open plan room with a king bed, sofa bed & small dining table & kitchen. Friends stayed in a massive two bedroom room which would be ideal for families. The 'Safe' for storing valuables was in a room beside reception, which meant you had to wait until they could take you through to access your belongings - the safe boxes were very long but narrow - just fitted a wallet, so no chance of video/camera equipment. There wasn't a charge though, so I can't complain too much. Overall, a great base to see the city - but don't expect too much from the staff (with the exception of Anne at the front door - who was very friendly & in charge of tourist info/bookings/tickets etc) the general attitude and standard of customer service was poor, but sadly seemed to be pretty 'normal' in New York...

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way”
Reviews.Author: INTraveller
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here, 2 nights for a family-of-five sightseeing trip in NYC. After spending several nights in tiny chain motel rooms, our Junior Suite (2 queen beds plus sofabed) was HUGE, and this was so nice. The beds were very comfortable, and I loved the pillows. Everything was super clean, the bathroom and kitchenette were small but it gave us the sense of what it is like to live in the city. The shower pressure was good, the kitchen was clean, stocked with 4 plates, bowls, cups, cutlery, plus a few pans (we should have brought a spatula), full-size refrigerator and stove. There were plenty of places to put all our bags. So the room was excellent, especially for the money. The staff was also excellent, extremely friendly and helpful. We arrived before noon, and they were able to find us a room so that we could check in early and go out sightseeing; the day we left, they held our bags all day and we picked them up in the evening, and they were very kind to us and to the kids. The concierge was friendly and helpful about getting around New York. There was not much of a lobby, but we didn't need one, and the clientele seemed a good mix of families, teens, students, and other visitors to the city. We used their parking garage for our car; there might have been cheaper options nearby, but this was extremely convenient as it coordinated with the bellman. Finally, the location - perfect, a nice area, we walked everywhere, to the United Nations, back from the Empire State Building late at night, to Grand Central Station, it was not much walking at all (you have to expect this in the city). There were restaurants and shops nearby, although we didn't use any of them. Oh, and the website booking form was really good. One thing I recommend is booking more than 2 weeks ahead, because the rates then were fantastic, they went up closer to the time we stayed. I have already recommended this hotel to several friends, and will continue to do so!

Reviews.Title: “A BARGAIN FOR MANHATTAN”
Reviews.Author: bushbulldog
Reviews.Content: The reviews are correct about this hotel not having had an update in years. However, who cares? The front desk, housekeeping, and doorman were first class and very friendly. We were in Manhattan for the sights and Broadway shows so we were gone all day. Our concern was a clean, safe, and quiet room. Eastgate fit the bill completely. There are good restaurants and stores in the area which are within walking distance. Take a left and go down to Lexington & eat at Scotty's Diner. This is a place where the locals eat and the prices/food are great. The only drawback as to the hotel may be for those intending to use the subways who are not used to walking. Grand Central subway station is the closest one and is more than a few blocks away. But, taxis are always driving by the hotel. This is Manhattan, after all! We felt very safe even at night and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.... got an upgrade to a 1B Suite and was perfect”
Reviews.Author: prranch8250
Reviews.Content: The Eastgate was so much more than I expected for the money... got upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite that had a HUGE bedroom with 2 queen beds.. the living/dining room was huge also.. the kitchen had all the basics that you need for a vacation.. not like we were there to cook. THe entire staff was pleasant and helpful... we were within a mile of Times Square and while the people got pretty scarce the closer to the hotel you got, we never felt afraid or threatened. SInce it was just 1 woman and my 17 year old daugher, this was a little bit of a concern but turned out to be unwarranted.. The unit was cleaned daily and coffee was replenished daily also..

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation - NY”
Reviews.Author: MaudiOlwage
Reviews.Content: We travelled from South Africa and got excellent value for money. The staff were extremely professional and helpful with everything we requested - even providing postage stamps for our postcards. The room was cleaned daily and was an excellent self catering option. Lovely kitchen for morning coffee, etc. I liked that the Eastgate Tower hotel was in the Eastern part of NY as it gave us a quiet retreat to return to after the hustle and bustle of the day. Would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LizzyKav
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2011 and had a great trip. There were 5 of us travelling together and we booked a 2 bed apartment. One of the rooms had a huge double bed and the other room had 2 doubles, also big. Two good sized bathrooms and a huge living room and we definitely had all the space we needed. The apartment, while not luxurious was spotless. Great location, about a 10 minute walk from 5th ave. The staff at reception were great especially the concierge. He was so helpful, got us taxis whenever we needed them and made great recommendations. Would definitely stay here again on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Week in New York”
Reviews.Author: Lesley707
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just 4 blocks from some of the best sites in New York. The reception staff were polite and helpful with any needs, nothing was too much trouble. Check in and out was quick and painless. The facilities in the room were excellent, full kitchen, bathroom, clean comfortable beds and even a view. We wanted to be near some of the sites and transport, Grand central station was 4 blocks up the road (5min walk), as was Empire State building (10mins), Times Square (10mins) and Macy's (10mins). The 42 bus on 42st street was only three blocks away or the subway same distance. If staying for more than 3 days I'd recommend buying a metrocard to use on the bus and subway. I would definitely choose this hotel again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Average. Depends what you are looking for.”
Reviews.Author: MangaMan
Reviews.Content: This is a hard one to write. If someone had recommended this place to me, I would have wondered what they were smo***, I mean thinking. It really, really depends what you are looking for. New and fancy? NO. Clean and sparkly? NO. Cool and funky? NO. Huge room? Yes. Huge bathroom? Not even close. Good price? Yes. Decor from the 70s? Formica counters? Couch from 1965? Yes. They are friendly here. The service is very good. The elevators are scary. The carpet is in bad shape. The bathroom floor is 1" mosaic tile. The lighting is not bad. The desk is adequate. The room is HUGE for New York. The area is interesting, and safe, and fairly centrally located. The price is fair. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “No qualms recommending the hotel! Spacious and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: nettieo
Reviews.Content: Three older women on a girls trip to the Big Apple, stayed 4 nights. Older property but large and immaculately clean rooms, housekeeping is to be commended. Two beds in a large bedroom and a comfortable (at least, she didn't complain about it!) sofabed in the living room. Nice, functional kitchen. Location was within easy walking distance of Grand Central Terminal, the Chrysler Building, and New York Public Library. Little store around the corner for quick deli and snacks open in the evening and a bigger grocery store in the opposite direction. I would stay there again and hope to do so soon . Excellent bagel spot, Vic's Bagels a couple blocks away. GLUTEN FREE bagels, btw. Toasted everything bagel with cream cheese and cilantro w/onion. I was in heaven. For gluten-free dinner option try Nizza's up in the theater district. Beautiful fettucini, foccacia and socca for those of us who are wheat-free. Lovely sauces for the pastas and the desserts were great, too.

Reviews.Title: “DREAM PLACE”
Reviews.Author: Ory C
Reviews.Content: I actually stumbled in this hotel and ...it was the best things that happened to me! I am in NYC every month, so it was paramount to find a place that could be comforting, warm, welcoming after the crazy days that I normally have in the city. I fell in love with this place whic is close to everything, the staff is awesome, and I love the rooms, where I can have a cup of tea, a complete meal at any time I want.... I can work while indulging in everything that please me. Experience this, it is unique

Reviews.Title: “nice, but WI FI should be free...”
Reviews.Author: shellyship
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Nice big clean room. Staff were very nice, location was a walk away from Grand Central Station. The WIFI was $15 for 24 hours (or there abouts),which, was dissapointing as all the other same price range hotels we stayed in during our US holiday stay provided it free of charge. So we didnt use it. Saying that, I would stay here again, you get what you pay for. PS if you are looking for a cheaper alternative to a taxi to get to the international airports - just outside Grand Central Station they do hourly shuttle transfers at a fraction of the price of a taxi

Reviews.Title: “Viejo y cuidado con la terjeta de credito (Old and carefull with VISA card)”
Reviews.Author: JoseBrighton_MA_USA
Reviews.Content: Mi familia y yo hemos estado recientemente en este hotel. Las habitaciones son bastante viejas y los baños son muy, muy enanos y los armarios dentro mejor no abrirlos....lo único positivo es que la habitación estaba muy limpia. Nos quejamos de la habitación, sobre todo del baño y nos dieron otra más grande pero con el baño de similar tamaño. Lo peor fue que pagamos una estancia que incluía el parking de 24 horas. Al llegar preguntamos al personal de recepción si había algún problema por salir del parking unas horas más tarde ya que al llegar un día de fiesta podía aparcar fuera durante unas horas y así evitar estar más de 24 horas en el parking del hotel. Su respuesta fue que no nos preocupáramos por eso. Así que el coche estuvo en el parking durante 29 horas en total. Cuando nos fuimos del hotel, tras recoger las maletas en recepción, estaba la misma persona del día anterior que nos volvió a recalcar que no había problema. Mi sorpresa es que me han cargado, sin mi consentimiento, en la VISA 27$ por esas 5 horas…casi más que la estancia de 24horas. Tras intentar hablar con ellos y dejar un mensaje en el contestador y escribir correos electrónicos al Manager General (Phillip Garcia) nadie nos ha contestado. Así que cuidado con la tarjeta en ese hotel y no confiéis en el personal de recepción. My family and I have recently stayed in this hotel. The rooms are quite old and the bathrooms are very, very small (it’s better not open the cabinets) .... the only positive thing is that the room was very clean. We complain about the room, especially about the bathroom and they got a larger room but a similar bath!!. The worst issue was that we paid a stay package that included a 24-hour parking. Upon arrival we asked at the reception if there was any problem about leaving the parking a few hours later than the 24 hours. I want to point out that we arrived in a vacation day so we would could had parked in the street for a few hours and so the car wouldn't had been over 24 hours in the hotel parking. His answer was "don't worry about that". So the car was in the parking lot for 29 hours in total. Before we left the hotel, I talked to the same person that the day before. My surprise is that they have charged me $ 27 without my consent (VISA) for those 5 hours. After trying to talk to them and leave a message on voice mail and write emails to General Manager (Phillip Garcia) no one has answered. So be careful with the card at the hotel and did not trust the reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: luvvacurry
Reviews.Content: I'd really like to give this a five rating but that would then put this on a par with a top class hotel in Mauritius that I gave a five rating to two years ago. I can't really fault this hotel to be honest. Positives: *got a huge one bedroom suite on floor 24 - breathtaking view *the suite was absolutely spotlessly clean, with a triple bed which was unbelievably comfy (had a mattress topper on it), it had two bathrooms and two TVs and a large sofa bed *the staff were extremely polite and helpful - particular mention goes to the concierge (Ann I think her name was) who gave us loads of helpful advice about places to eat and how to get to Newark for a hockey game *they happily looked after our luggage when we had checked out *it's about a 10 minute walk to Grand Central Terminal - where, apart from marvelling at its beauty, you can eat in a variety of cafes/restaurants or get a subway train *it's about a 5-10 minute walk to the Newark Airport Express bus stop - really handy *you can walk to Times Square, Broadway and Empire State Building reasonably easily Other tips: *there's a McDonald's just opposite a little to the right - handy for Wifi or if you're desperate for a late night local snack *decent, reasonably priced breakfast at the Townhouse diner round the corner on 2nd Ave - friendly and attentive staff too *good breakfast at Bloom's Deli on corner of 40th Street *you can get provisions at some nearby supermarkets but I would avoid stores labelled as 'convenience stores' as I reckoned they ripped us off knowing that we were tourists (no prices on anything) *you won't need to take a hairdryer if you're a woman - they have one in the bathroom. Negatives: *erm, we had to come home! I would definitely recommend this hotel. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for (sometimes)”
Reviews.Author: MillyBrighton
Reviews.Content: Great 3 star hotel in a central location. We had a huge 2 bedroom apartment with full kitchen and 2 bathrooms. Ok so the paint was peeling in a few places and there was a bit of torn wallpaper here and there but who cares? The room was spotless, the beds comfortable and the staff very friendly. Word of warning though, if you book through the Affinia website beware of their rate guarantee, it's a scam. They guarantee that the rates on their website will be the lowest or they will match the cheaper rate, give you $50 room credit and a free upgrade. None of that turns out to be true. Shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Like A Native New Yorker”
Reviews.Author: Georgina J K
Reviews.Content: When I got "home" to my room at the Eastgate I settled in for the week. I had a beautiful view (25B is the best room of the many I've been in there) and the kitchen saved me money on meals. But the best part of my trip was housekeeping. No matter how busy I was, when I got "home" my room was beautifully clean and orderly with extra touches like folding my scarf and draping over the back of the chair. I felt completely taken care of at the Eastgate with tips on grocery stores and commuting advice. Carol was the first desk person I encountered but the rest of the staff is just as friendly. It's nice to be told hello when you come back from a hard day! It's the only hotel for me from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Space and Location”
Reviews.Author: LilTravelGirl1813
Reviews.Content: Despite it being synonymous with the Affinia Hotel group, the Eastgate Towers are no where near in comparison to the newer hotels; in fact, it is somewhat disappointing to know that both are affiliates. Nonetheless, the all-suite hotels are dated, and the rooms look as if they were stuck in the 1980's. Bad pastel paintings and stucco ceilings are paired with a small kitchenette that screams 'Cook at Your Own Risk .' The bed is comfortable and the room itself is surprisingly spacious, but there is nothing else positively memorable. Good location in the Murray Hill area, but I would only recommend this place for one of those last-minute-because-I'm-too-drunk-to-drive moments....with a group, of course, because had I not gotten the deal for the hote through Travelzoo (at $99 per night), then this place would have gone overlooked altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: alamo25
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that is incredibly great value in a nice part of town. The location is central, the only complaint is that it is about 5 or 6 city blocks to the nearest subway stop which is about a 15-20 minute walk. The room was spacious, it had a little kitchenette with fridge, microwave and stove. In-room wi-fi was expensive per day so you are better off walking to the corner and using the free wi-fi at McDonalds. Use it as a place to just sleep in at night and you'll have no problems!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Front Desk Service and More!”
Reviews.Author: LINGERIELADY1234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Easgate Towers Hotel for many years and it is a wonderful experience with a gracious helping staff. I had and existing reservation upcoming and need to arrive a day early. When I called the reservation lines where busy and my call was taken by a most wonderful person Peter. Peter worked with me to secure my added night and make sure I was taken care of with my existing reservation. A wonderful experience and a wonderful peson! Thank you Peter and eveyone at the Eastgate Tower Hotel. . .see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “This is a perfect hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: Deborahsuchecki
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location, close to everything and easy access to the entire island. The studio was perfect and the price is so just! I loved it and will be back, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suite, no amenities”
Reviews.Author: sbg18
Reviews.Content: We really loved the clean, spacious suite. 2 BR, 2 BA, full kitchen for a great price! Other than that, the hotel has nothing to recommend it. No lobby, no amenities, very expensive wi-fi, etc. More of a way-station than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, good location, value for money in NYC”
Reviews.Author: SSWY
Reviews.Content: Wanted to find a cheap place for my leisure days before my business trip in NYC. It's my first time to NYC and ppl say it's not so safe there esp. I was on my own, so dare not to stay at hostel. Based on all those gd reviews here, I gave it a try and made a reservation at this hotel. Got there by the "super shuttle" from EWR to Grand Central and walked to the hotel, it should be easy if I was not with my big luggages. The hotel is just 3 blocks from Grand Central Station. Had a late check-in as requested. The lady at the FO was so nice. After the long flight and transport, such friendly service just makes me feel soothed. Didn't get the name of the lady, but I do want to give her the credit. She was caucasian with glasses. Ok, here comes the main pt. They upgraded me to the junior suite. It was such a big room. It's more like an apt than a hotel rm. it got a whole kitchen, a dining area, a living area and a big queen bed with 2 closets. I enjoyed the room so much. Since I was only one, did not use the whole room in full. But definitely, this is a hotel that I would recommend and will be back in my next trip. Just hope the price won't go up too much after all these gd reviews. After all, price is an important factor for me. Btw, the price of my room went down a bit right before my trip, this is the only downside of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value (for NY) mins from Grand Central Station”
Reviews.Author: flyingkiwi84
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome stay at Eastgate Tower - the staff are lovely and helpful, the rooms were nice and clean and it was in a great location for exploring the city. After 2 months of eating out it was awesome to have a kitchenette too - so handy if you want to cook for yourself or eat breakfast in your room. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: FTFADIA
Reviews.Content: We needed a place in NYC with a kitchen for an extended stay while my son auditioned for MFA schools. Despite some lukewarm reviews on this site we chose the hotel because of the 2 bedroom promotion that made our stay affordable. We came in expecting mediocre but were pleasantly surprised as the experience far exceeded our expectations. It is not fancy or plush like the $300/nt plus hotels but had everything we needed and more. It was clean and comfortable...very large for anywhere let alone New York. I would like to see them upgrade the beds but the room was quiet for a city and the bedding was modern and comfortable. The staff was accessible and helpful. The location in Murray Hill made you feel like part of the city rather than a tourist. It is a short walk to Grand Central Station which made getting around in the city so easy! Everything you need is within walking distance...restaurants, groceries, even a movie theater. We will definitely recommend this hotel and it will be our first choice on a return visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: Nat0chka
Reviews.Content: Our family chose this hotel because our decision to welcome New 2012 in NY was spontaneous. We had nothing to choose for those dates. The room rates are quite affordable and democratic, the location is not so great if you are not a regular visitor to the UN office. The place is noisy. We were not disappointed at all as we had got familiar with it thanks to Google and previous reviews. We spent lovely days in NY. Nevertheless, we were satisfied with the room service, welcoming staff and the whole atmosphere in the hotel. Not luxurious but clean and spacious rooms. Multilingual staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eastgate Tower hotel December 20 - 23. We chose the hotel because of its price primarily, and location. We were definitely not disappointed. This must have been an apartment building that was converted - we had a studio room and for NYC, it was HUGE! The room was worn but very clean and the bed was comfortable. Eastgate is easy to get to - just 4 or 5 blocks off the subway. There is a nice little group of restaurants down the block. The hotel is definitely not over-the-top or luxurious, but for our purposes it was perfect. We would definitely stay there again and I would recommend the Eastgate Tower to any budget-conscious traveler looking for a spacious room in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great size, but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Jamison27
Reviews.Content: Our one bedroom jr suite was enormous: plenty of space, a sitting area, an entrance area, a kitchen, and the bedroom area. It was very clean and well-kept. The rest of the hotel is very average: cramped lobby, dim hallways, no luxuries. The location is great, about a five-block walk to the metro, and easy walking to everything else. The staff were pleasant, and our stay was nice overall. There wasn't a view from our room despite being on a top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, especially for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Gracie99
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice-clean, comfortable bed, enough pillows, and the kitchenette was good to have as well. This is probably great if you're travelling with kids. On our second night a noisy(!) family did end up down the hall from us and we could hear their kids screaming until 1 AM! For someone who does not require a lot of amenities-there's no restuarant/room service, concierge, etc. this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Huge suites; great for families.”
Reviews.Author: peasant79
Reviews.Content: Our 2 BR suite at the Eastgate Tower was enormous. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, huge living room, dining area for six, and a small kitchen with all appliances, including microwave and dishwasher. The furniture was comfortable, and each bedroom had a television, which was great for the kids. The finishes are a little tired: tear in the carpet, dingy tiles in the bathrooms, no lobby to speak of, but that is a trade-off worth making for the size of the rooms. Our upstairs neighbors had a party at 3:00 a.m., which the night staff addressed promptly and effectively. My only gripe is that the room rate I booked was not what I was charged. Although the rate on the Affinia website said the rate was good for four people, they charged us $40 per day extra for one child over 12. I called the central office to complain, and got nowhere because the rate had expired and they allegedly couldn't retrieve the terms and conditions. But even with the extra charge, it was still an amazing deal at $249/night. We would stay again, but would be sure to get confirmation of the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a New York hotel. Great for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Amys_husband
Reviews.Content: There are quite a few hotels in Manhattan that used to be apartment buildings. Eastgate is fairly standard for the amenities that a converted apartment building offers. The rooms range from studios to multi room suites. They all have small, fully equiped kitchens, a decent amount of closet space aqnd plenty of space in the room itself. I stayed in a studio on the ninth floor. It was comfortable, clean, fairly quiet and a bit sparce in furnishings. There was a queen sized bed with a table, a nightstand with an alarm clock, a TV on a stand in the corner, a seperate chair and a dresser. I guess the large size of the room made it seem a little empty. This is probably a good thing if you have a lot of belongings with you and you need to spread out. I checked in around 1:30 am after a long day at work. The hotel clerk was very pleasant as was the doorman. I had forgotten a razor and shaving cream and was provided with both after asking if any was available. I was also offered ther toiletries which I declined. The bed was comfortable and everything looked to be clean. The room was a bit warm even though the heat was set low. Again, this was probably good given the outside air was below freezing. With the AAA discount I paid $85 before taxes and $103 after they were added in. Thie is excellent for a New York hotel with large rooms. The location is pretty good. The UN and Grand Central terminal are about 5 minute walks in opposite directions. Grand Central offers entry into many subway lines and you can get anywhere fairly quickly. There are a few decent restaurants and bars within a 2 block walk. All in all, I would consider this a good experience and wouldn't hesitate to book at Eastgate again.

Reviews.Title: “Eastgate Tower good value great location”
Reviews.Author: EmsCardiff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in September. We found trying to choose a hotel in NYC very difficult there is so much choice and if you've never been before it is very difficult to know which location is best. The Eastgate Tower was very reasonably prices and in a good location there was bars and restaurants on your door step or it was walking distance to the Empire State, Grand Central, and Central park. Although the lobby area of the hotel is slightly dated the hotel and room were clean. We choose a suite which had a small kitchen which was ideal for our stay. When i return to NYC i would seriously consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Eastgate Towers provided a great stay”
Reviews.Author: JCskiier
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a long weekend in NYC. This is my 3rd Affinia hotel in the city - and the Eastgate Towers was a wonderful place to stay. The room was huge (we had 3 closets), dining table/desk & kitchen in addition to pull-out sleeper sofa and queen sized bed. Everything was clean and tidy. Like the other reviews stated, it's not the Ritz - but for a great place to stay, in a nice, accessible neighborhood, with excellent, friendly service, the Eastgate Towers did not disappoint. When Affinia decides to remodel this place, it will be beyond awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Fab place to stay with family!”
Reviews.Author: kdbooklady22
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with son/daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in early December, 2011 - great stay; close to mid-town events and walkable to Times Square/5th Avenue, Rock Center and many other places; good neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: mesagrunt
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic! For the price of a hotel in Manhattan you will not find a better deal than this! Those of you not pleased with the "dated" interior or any of the other negative reviews I read about this motel....open your eyes! I am really glad I didn't listen to them! This was a "diamond in the rough!" Location, location, location....three..count them only three blocks from Grand Central Station! We had a full kitchen with plates, glasses, wine glasses, pots, pans and silverware! We cooked breakfast every morning and saved a ton of money plus the cost of our stay here was incredible! The room was large and spacious. It was clean and comfortable..what more does one need in Manhattan? The shower worked great with hot water every day...the noice was minimal from the street..(you're in New York...what do you expect?)...the neighborhood was very safe at night especially....the staff was "uberfriendly"...they even went as far as to send us up a bottle of wine and chocolates when they learned we were on our honeymoon! The cleaning lady on the 19th floor was one of the sweetest ladies I had the pleasure of meeting! We will continue to stay here anytime we are in the city and I will recommend it to anyone who goes to New York! My new husband was so impressed with the choice I made for our honeymoon he even offered to do the laundry when we returned home!! Stay here...you won't be sorry!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value - Would Recommend and Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Ivan K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eastgate Tower for 3 nights, and found it to be an incredible value, in a great location, and within walking distance of major attractions and transportation. I found the staff to be courteous and helpful in all respects. I stayed in a junior suite, and a friend stayed in a studio apartment in the hotel as well. Both of the rooms were very clean, with a kitchen and ample room. If you are looking for luxury and a modern feel, this is probably not the place for you: the rooms and furniture are a bit dated (although very clean and comfortable). I found the hotel to be outstanding, and will not stay anywhere else in NY...and I used to live in the city a few years ago. Best value for the money, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, I will be back”
Reviews.Author: Wanderingjen
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed in 5 hotels in NYC and I can say without hesitation if I am paying - this is the one I will return to. In terms of value for money I was very impressed. The hotel is about 7-10min walk from Grand Central. It's a pleasant walk. We used the subway to get around and so this was very convenient. The food around the hotel is great. There are excellent grocery stores (D'Agostinos, Walgreens, another on 2nd Ave). There are a couple of diners, restaurants and fast food /great NY slice/bagel places nearby, all very short walking distance. Not to mention Grand Central's dining concourse. We stayed on the Westside on the 23rd floor. This was perfect. We did hear a bit of noise but nothing that bothered me much. This might be a draw back if you are a very light sleeper. There is a great little kitchen and a lot of room for NYC standards. It's unfortunate internet isn't free, but it's not too badly priced - $45 or so for the week we stayed. For someone like me, this is worthwhile. It is nice there is a printer in the lobby as you end up buying tour tickets/broadway tickets you don't want to search for a printer. It does come at a price though. Housekeeping was excellent. The rooms were so clean. I guess the table was a bit chipped on the side but honestly, I don't care. It was clean, a great location for someone who has been to NYC before (or even someone who hasn't, as long as you aren't on very limited time). It's not luxury, but it is far better than I expected. If you know it is 3 stars, you will be very content. I got a bit worried as I walked in as the lobby is tiny and the corridors look a bit dingey, but upon opening the door I breathed a sigh of relief - big rooms, clean sheets, clean bathroom and not anywhere near as dated as I expected after reading trip advisor! The staff weren't the most enthusiastic but they were fine. I had a few questions but staff were helpful in assisting. The computer downstairs with printer doesn't explicitly tell you how much you're being charged when you use the internet, so it's always a surprise on your credit card. This is a bit annoying after you've also paid for the wifi in your room. This is a great place to stay if you want to spend your money elsewhere and use an apartment as a base. It is also a fantastic neighbourhood for tourists, being somewhat central but still having a little bit of a "real NYC" feel to it. To top it off, we had a view looking out at the buildings. I could even see the very tip of the Empire State.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities for a good price - very happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: This is a nice apartment-style hotel, located a reasonable distance from lots of key attractions. We were able to walk quite quickly to a lot of places, and in New York you can always easily get the subway to the others. As some people have said, the decor is a little dated. But the prices are very reasonable, especially given the size of the rooms and the addition of cooking facilities. There was no restaurant, but we ate out all the time or made some quick sandwiches anyway. We went at New Year and it was still a good price compared to a lot of nearby hotels. You get what you pay for and I can see how snobs would look down their noses at this place. But this is New York! Its not like we spent a lot of time in the hotel anyway. It was just a base of operations. The staff were very friendly and helpful. As others have mentioned, the WiFi is not free, but I was pleased to find that I was given free WiFi and paper specifically in order to access and print my boarding pass. Which meant no frenzied search for an internet cafe before the flight home. There were no noisy bars or clubs in the area. It was located near to the exit of a motorway tunnel, but that didn't cause us any problems. We would deffinitely go to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “CAN'T IMAGINE STAYING ANYWHERE ELSE!”
Reviews.Author: tomcal
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a wonderful Christmas in NYC - it was an awesome trip! We stayed at the Eastgate Tower again. This was the fourth time we have stayed there and I simply can't imagine wanting to stay anywhere else in NYC. Travelling with two teenagers, the two-bedroom, two-bathroom suites (apartments) are just perfect. Loads of space, a huge sitting/dining room and a fully fitted kitchen where we could throw together breakfasts and snacks - essential for a family like us with two teenage sons that seem to need to eat almost constantly....... Great staff all round - reception, doorman and cleaners. OK the decor of the corridors and apartments needs freshening up and the furnishings are not plush but in my honest opinion, you get more than value for money with the spaciousness (is that even a word?) of the apartments. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people; 2nd-tier hotel”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeLulu
Reviews.Content: Eastgate Tower is unfortunately located next to an exit from the Midtown Tunnel. The neighborhood is OK (there is a very nice apartment building next door), but the traffic noise would be a distraction if on a lower floor or on the west side. We asked to have our room changed, and the folks at the front desk were very accommodating. We also had to ask for an iron and ironing board, as those had disappeared from our room, but they were provided promptly, once we reassured Housekeeping that we had in fact looked for same in the closet. We like to walk, and the hotel is well-located for that - we walked all the way across town to the High Line one day. The lobby is extremely small, and any group (even a family group) can quickly overwhelm the space. That having been said, the hotel may be good value for families who value larger rooms/suites over high-end appearance. And they really should do something about the sad appearance of the outdoor space adjacent - is it meant for the staff?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great price, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jess00aus
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults, 1 child -4yrs old) stayed in this hotel for a week back in May 2011 after getting an amazing deal of $219 pn. We had a 2 bedroom apartment which consisted of 2 bedrooms, one with a king bed, the other with 2 queen beds, both rooms had a wardrobe and a tv. We also had 2 bathrooms plus a huge living area and small kitchen with all necessary appliances. The room we had was very spacious which i understand to be rare in NYC. My 4 year old had plenty of room to play while we relaxed after spending entire days exploring the city. The furnishings were a little worn out and could do with an upgrade but we were only really there to sleep so it didnt bother us at all. Our room was cleaned daily, even my pile of magazines and papers were arranged nicely on the kitchen table. All staff that we encountered were lovely and accomodating, we always got a smile and a good morning/evening and they were all happy to help regarding directions/things to see etc. The hotel was in a great location for us. I was concerned prior to arriving after google mapping the hotel and not having been to NY before that it was a little out of the way from everything, however this wasn't the case. It was about a 10 min walk to Grand Central Terminal which we did everyday and about a 15min walk to and from Times Square. We felt 100% safe walking the streets of Manhattan day and night so had absolutely no problem walking to and from the hotel. There are many eateries and grocery stores close by to the hotel which also made things very easy for us. Overall this hotel was great. Good location, great price, large spacious rooms and lovely staff, we will definitely stay here again when we eventually make it back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Value and spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric L
Reviews.Content: Negesti Thompson at the Front desk is a perfect representative of this property. She went out of her way to assist me in downloading my boarding passes, and is always pleasant, efficient, and all around a joy to be around. Excellent location, ninth time visiting the Eastgate since summer 2008!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice place”
Reviews.Author: MelissaPgh_Pa
Reviews.Content: Staff extremely helpful, and courteous. We loved the location in Murray Hill. It's a mix of residential, commercial, retail. Close to public transportation, eateries, shops. We actually walked into mid-town, and south toward flatiron district and felt very safe. The Eastgate is a bit dated. Furniture is well used, carpets a bit worn, but everything was clean and neat. Our unit was more like an apartment rather than a typical Manhattan hotel room. Tiny, but fully equiped kitchen had everything we needed. Large living room area and attatched dining. Plenty of storage and closet space for our luggage and belongings. Doorman assisted in obtaining car service. The only negative thing is the lobby area is very small, in fact I'm not even sure it is a lobby...more like a hallway to the elevator. During check-in/Check-out times it was really congested. Will definately stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at the Eastgate”
Reviews.Author: leneanne
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at the Eastgate. The front desk employees are very service minded and helpful. Our apt. was wonderful, and was cleaned everyday including doing the dishes. It is a longer walk (20 min) to Times Square, but the area is quiet. Grocery stores and restaurants are also here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: RaffeLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great, it was an excellent location close to Grand central station so easy to get around NYC, and walking distance to sights like Times Square, the Empire State Building and Bryant park/NY Library. The rooms were massive, we just had the budget room and it was huge for a hotel and very clean. Good to have the kitchen and there was a small supermarket just around the corner to stock up on supplies. There was also a few good restaurants and bars nearby - we like the Wharf bar (good drinks prices and specials and great chicken wings) and Dukes (American diner style). They had a computer downstairs that you could use for free to do your online check in for the flight home. I think this hotel was definitely a great choice and I would stay here again anytime I am in NY.

Reviews.Title: “4th Stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsBicep
Reviews.Content: Back to the Eastgate yet again. The accommodations are clean, safe and very roomy Even the pull out sofa bed is pretty comfy and that's unusual. Having the kitchen is great. It means you don't have to eat 3 meals a day out if you want to save a few dollars. It's also nice to be able to bring home leftovers from restaurants if you like to do that. It's not the most trendy or fancy Hotel but it certainly meets my needs. If it didn't, I wouldn't return again and again. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Martyn G
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the reviews and the great room rates compared to other hotels in the area, it cetainly was a good choice. Good sized rooms with small kitchen area including a fridge and cooker, the rooms may be a little dated, and the TV cetainly is, but our room was clean and spacious, with a really comfy bed. All the staff were helpfull and friendly, easy check in and check out, when we asked for a taxi after checking out, it was a matter of no more than 2 mins. before a taxi was outside for us. The location was ideal for the many restaurants, diners and bars along 3rd, just a few blocks from Grand Central and maybe 15 mins. from Times Square. Just a little annoying that the hotel charges for wi/fi, though I think that's probably the case in most New York hotels. There is computer access in the lobby with printer, for just a few dollars, so if it you just need the internet to check in for flights and print boarding passes, that's ideal. Overall this hotel is great value in a great location, good sized rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: G1traveller81
Reviews.Content: Special thanks to our housekeeper/Joyce :) .. Very nice caring lady who attended to all of our requests. What better location than Midtown East :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: flip654
Reviews.Content: East gate Tower is in a fantastic location and many of New York's attractions are within easy walking distance. Rooms are a little dated but overall very clean and comfortable. Hotel staff were courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Visit”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a "girls night"holiday visit to NYC! Very SPACIOUS like home accommodations. We were upgraded to a larger suite on arrival at no additional charge, just 3 of us, next time we can double our group comfortably! GREAT experience, want to bring my family in the spring:)

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in NYC”
Reviews.Author: sean-earley1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on several occasions in NYC. I love the big rooms compared with most hotels in the city. Okay so there is no fancy lobby or restaurant but lets face it we go to hotels to lay our heads. the staff are very friendly and the concierge Paddy is a fountain of knowledge. there is a gym on second floor and the rooms are well service. the hotel could do with a face lift but in saying that is clean and its location to Grand Central, 42nd Street is too good to pass. You have a small kitchenette to make tea and coffee and a fridge so you can get a few things in to make the stay a bit like home and a cooker if you get sick of eating eggs benedict. You won't get bigger or better rooms for the price in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Nice election”
Reviews.Author: Frvjorge
Reviews.Content: Location and good quality. Prices are good. Some thing to improve in the hotel: the kitchen appliances are old. The rooms have good sizes and the beds are comfortables.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal if spaciousness appeals”
Reviews.Author: Milly-Minnie
Reviews.Content: we spent 5 nights at the Eastgate Tower in October this year, and we thought it was just perfect for us. We were 3 friends travelling together and we had booked a 2 bedroom suite - as we did throughout our USA trip whenever possible. In some other places there was barely room to swing a kitten. The Eastgate had BIG rooms - and a huge living area. And a kitchen and 2 bathrooms. it was the ideal haven from the bustle and noise outside. We liked the location - 5 short blocks to Grand Central station, and near the East river. If we return to New York this is definitely where we'd like to stay. Friendly helpful staff as well.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Thanksgiving stay”
Reviews.Author: telynez
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Huge, clean rooms and I was able to cook an entire Thankgiving meal in the full kitchen, complete with oven, stove, microwave, fridge, and dishwasher. It was very convenient to grocery and drug stores, as well as restaurants. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, especially the housekeeping staff and the bellmen. The living/dining area was large and homey with amazing closet space, and the beds were huge and comfortable. It was a bit of a walk to midtown attractions and the subway, but well worth it for the quiet neighborhood and apartment-like rooms. The only problem we had was our vehicle was slightly damaged in the parking garage, something we did not notice until we stopped for gas on the way home. I would definately book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: cglynis
Reviews.Content: just returned from my second trip to nyc and we stayed at the eastgate towers which we found to be a great chioce not too far from all the main attractions but nice and quite , room was masive well it was more like a appartment with a great big lounge, with 3 piece suite table and four chairs big screen tv ,large kitchen with cooker microwave big fridge it even had a dishwasher bathroom small but it was all spottlessly clean bedroom had two queen size beds another large tv, dont know how anyone can pick fault with this place all i can say is they must be very particular great view of the empire state building from room 25d staff all very friendly and helpfull would def stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Issue with cancellation policy”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: I reserved two nights online through the hotel's website, affinia.com. I intentionally booked REFUNDABLE rooms, as they were the same price and my plans were a bit up in the air. Three days later things changed, and when I called to cancel...no luck. My reservation in their system was NONREFUNDABLE. I was unable to cancel. This may be a fine hotel (I won't know because I can't go!), but I would suggest calling to make your reservation. Or at least thoroughly read your email confirmation (which I should have done sooner) right away to avoid the bait and switch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scotrocker
Reviews.Content: I'd read some mixed reviews on this hotel before we travelled which made me slightly apprehensive - I needn't have been! I would say this is a 3 star plus hotel, I've selected 4 on the rating as 3 says average and our room was definately better than average. The hotel is in a great location, lots of restaurants, diners and bars nearby and taxis are readily available. The staff are fantastic and couldn't do enough for us. The rooms are large and spacious the decor is slightly dated and could perhaps do with a bit of an upgrade but everything is still spotlessly clean and served the purpose for us. My parents room had a slightly different layout to ours but was still clean and spacious, and both rooms also had a kitchenette, which was handy as it gave you access to a fridge. When we arrived two hours early, our room (understandably) wasn't yet ready but reception happily organised for our luggage to be stored for us, and again did this when we checked out but didn't have a flight until the evening. Check in and out process was swift and smooth! Brilliant stay at this hotel and would definately stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: LindaLosAngelesCA
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! I was so concerned about getting around NY without a car... but the taxis are always right outside the door. MacDonalds, Subway, a great Chinese restaurant are all within a block. Market too. Taxi rates are more reasonable than I thought. (My husband and I tried the subway... didn't quite work out!). Hotel older but very clean, friendly, 25 stories, great street, kitchenettes, large windows... loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy714
Reviews.Content: If you wear your walking shoes, as my daughter and I did, you can walk to Grand Central Station (about 4 blocks), the street fair on Lexington (one block), The Today Show (not sure, but we walked there), Union Square, and lots of shopping and eating venues. We even walked to Times Square (about 20 minutes), because we feel if you hop on the subway to every destination you miss so much of New York! We had a beautiful city view on the 24th floor and a room with a king bed, bathroom, lots of closet space, and a microwave, stove & fridge. We kept our wine & champagne (from the corner store) in the fridge with our leftover sushi. The employees were always very helpful. No, it is not fancy and doesn't have a flat screen or a fancy lobby, but that isn't why we went to New York. We stayed for 5 nights and paid approximately $220 each night, including taxes. We would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for NYC”
Reviews.Author: dragonlady2411
Reviews.Content: This was the third trip to NYC for my husband and me, so we didn't want to be right in the thick of the action and we also wanted to self cater. On our last visit we stayed at Radio City Apartments, but weren't able to book it this time. So we chose Eastgate Tower and couldn't have been happier with our choice. We had a studio apartment on the 17th floor and it was extremely spacious and well equipped for what we wanted. There was a huge amount of storage space - even a walkin closet, which was handy for dumping the day's shopping and storing our luggage. The bathroom also had more storage space than you needed and with lovely toiletries which were replenished daily. We had a stove, microwave, small fridge and a toaster in the kitchen area, which was more than enough for our needs. There was a supermarket one block away, as well as a number of smaller stores. The laundry in the basement was available all day long and I was able to get a washing machine and dryer both times I needed to. We had to pay for wifi, and the weekly rate was not too bad. Because I had trouble with accessing it a few times, the cost was totally refunded to me, which was not necessary but much appreciated. The area is a quieter one for NYC, but close to bus routes and not too far to the subway. NYC is a city for walking anyway, so we were happy with where the hotel was located. Perhaps first time visitors might want to be in a more vibrant area, or if you want night life this might not be the right place. But for us it was ideal. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times, from those at the front desks to the cleaners to the doormen. We booked a car to the airport through the hotel and although a little dearer, it was a much more comfortable journey than we had in a taxi at the beginning of our stay. I highly recommend Eastgate Tower as a place to stay. We saved an awful lot of money by eating in most of the time, which meant more money for shoppin!

Reviews.Title: “Good standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlc_33261
Reviews.Content: Travelled to this hotel just my mum and I. First trip to NY and was pleasently suprised to find the apartment to have a small kitchen area. Not all hotels offer this and I know it makes a real difference for some people! Tea/coffee facility was well stocked which was great as you need this to start off your busy day in the city! We found that we were able to find our way around quickly and easily to attractions from this hotel. Staff were friendly enough and made us feel welcome. Not luxurious in any way but hey there are plenty of other hotels if thats what you want! great base for exploring NYC and I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again when i return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the Big Apple!”
Reviews.Author: cb00083
Reviews.Content: great hotel for travellers on a budget. My sister and I got a room with 2 double beds, room was easily large enough for 4 to stay comfortably. small kitchenette was v handy. Room cleaned daily as standard, towels and beddings were changed every other day as requested. Mcdonalds' just around the corner a minute away, 15 minute walk to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “No frills lodging, at a great price, in a great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: cajunturtle
Reviews.Content: We were pleased w/ our recent stay, it was nothing fancy...but, who goes to NYC for a hotel? We were comfortable when we went back to the hotel to crash & we were on the go all day. For the location, look no further, you can't beat the price. Thanks to the staff too, the excellent service was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we choose Eastgate”
Reviews.Author: sportyroo
Reviews.Content: After a lot of researching for hotels in New York we choose this one based on a friend's recommendation and they had a special rate on their website. We were glad we choose Eastgate. The room was incredibly spacious and has a kitchen with full size fridge which was handy. The room is a bit dated but we weren't exactly in NYC to hangout in our room! The room was clean and the bed was comfy. The frist night we couldn't figure out how to turn down the a/c so it was pretty cold. But after asking the helpful staff in the morning we figured it out. There is a coffee percolator but no jug so I used the percolator without coffee to boil water for my tea. No room safe but you can store things at reception. The front desk service is very good but there is a lack of information in the rooms and we only found out after our stay that they had an on-site laundry. Should've asked I guess. Wi-fi is pricey but they let you print out boarding passes downstairs for free. The hotel is in a good location, a few blocks from central station and in a nice quiet area. Plenty of food places nearby and a supermarket about a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goldie1040
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and find it to be an outstanding value. The rooms are spacious and clean and it is a real benefit to have a kitchen and a refrigerator in the room. The location is outstanding and convenient with much to do. On this past visit, Betsy who worked at the front desk, was kind enough to show us a 2 bedroom suite for an upcoming trip when we will be accompanied by our wives. It was such a great room that we booked it.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jo C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six days with mother and sister and can't fault it. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and well equipped for what is required on a short break. Yes the rooms are a little shabby but the cleanliness made up for the decor... It didn't bother us and I wouldn't let it put you off staying here. It is close to everything and there are lots of little cafes close by to get breakfast or lunch. I booked a junior suite and was upgraded to a two bedroom two bath on the first night (they obviously didn't have a junior suite available) then we were moved to a one bedroom suite which was just as spacious it had two queens in the bedroom, this size also had 1 1/2 bathrooms which was quite useful. The only pain was actually having to move rooms but we ended up with a larger room than originally booked so no reason to really complain about the inconvenience. Ladies - if you have long thick hair bring your own hairdryer as the one in the bathroom is not much good but hotel hairdryers rarely are. Would I stay here again - YES I would.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: cityplayer22
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by people because of the one bedroom suites and the amount of space you get. You also get a small well equipped kitchen, which is good for making your own breakfast. The room was very clean and it was cleaned daily. The downside is the small lobby area and the decor is a bit faded. If people are unsure about staying here rather than a chain hotel you get at least double the space for the same money - we know as friends were staying at the Hilton on AotA and we have stayed at the Lucerne on the Upper West Side before. The bedroom had a walk-in wardrobe and the bed was comfortable. We looked out on the interestingly named ‘Tunnel Exit Street’, which shows how inventive NYC is at street names. The street noise was low. A bonus was a wide view facing West. The staff were very professional and helpful, special mention to Negesti, Stephanie and Louis. The location is good, a 10 minute walk to Grand Central and on the way you catch glimpses of the Empire State and pass next to the Chrysler Building. To the Empire State itself is about 15-20 minutes walk. There is a computer in the lobby from which you can check in and print boarding passes for free. There is a charge for normal internet accesses but if you need this just find the nearest Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nleo
Reviews.Content: I was mainly on this trip for business. One day I was sitting in my room and the house keeping lady knocked on my door and asked if I wanted my room cleaned now and I said yes. We had a great conversation and I learned about her Family and where she was from. She was very nice. I told her that my Wife was coming this weekend to visit New York for the first time. She told me some ideas of where to go and helpful tips. She finished cleaning and left. About 2 or 3 hours later she knocked on my door and gave me a bottle of wine and a box of chocolates to share with my wife for when she came. I was in total shock and very grateful. Her name was Marie Henry, an amazing lady. She has a friend on another floor that I met and learned about, who was also sweet. Everybody in this hotel was very polite and helpful in all ways, from the Valet to the Front Desk to the Bellman. The staff was excellent. The room was nice and big but the only default I disliked was that the bathroom was small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: addy-family
Reviews.Content: We booked here because of its location and because it offered interconnecting rooms (as we were a family with 2 young girls). On arrival, we were offered rooms on two different floors, but after a referal to the manager, we were upgraded to a 2 bed room suite. This was very spacious and clean but the bathroom and kitchen were tired but adequate. Overall, it is a 10 min walk from Grand Central Station and from the UN. Great location with courteous staff (especially the bellhop who organised the cab back to the airport)

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: vacationsforme
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonable hotel in New York and came upon this one. The hotel is quiet, and located perfectly. We walked downtown and uptown, and then to the theater district. The service was incredible. The people at the desk couldn't have been more helpful. The bellhop was great too. By the way, most hotel rooms are tiny. This was spacious with a kitchenette--so nice to make your own breakfast. The only drawback was the furnishings. The furniture looked in need of refinishing. But we still enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Eastgate was just fine!”
Reviews.Author: janejsb
Reviews.Content: I am quite puzzled at some of the negative reviews of the Eastgate. I agree it could do with an upgrade but the studio that we had was just fine. I was quite suprised how big our room was, I was expecting something smaller!! Having a kitchen was an added bonus, we just used it for making a cup of tea & breakfast but there is a cooker & microwave there if you want it. The bathroom in our room was up to date certainly not 1970's & thought the price we paid was good value especially for New York. I've paid more in London for a lot less!! I think the Eastgate is in a good position. Close to Grand Central, Chrysler Building & walked to Rockerfeller Centre & Empire State Building. The only time we used the metro was when we down at Battery Park. All the staff were brilliant, couldn't do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a good Refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: DanFrov
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights, the staff was very accomodating but the whole building looked tired and for the price it was NOT good value. The room and especially toilets would probably passed muster in the 1970's. grubby looking think next time we will stay in a recognised hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: KenLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: Took my time before booking a hotel in NYC as we stayed for four days. Thought this would be a good choice but it wasn't. Its off the main areas which I thought would be a good thing but wfter a full day you don't want a long walk home or to spend half an hour trying to get a taxi. The room were not the best. we booked with Hotels.Com and did not get good rooms. The room was dark and looking old and 'tired'. It needs a re-vamp and some public space. The lobby is no more than a corridor to the elevator's. Look elsewhere. Only good thing was the staff, very nice and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: culinarytourist
Reviews.Content: An older suites hotel only 5 blocks from Grand Central, an easy walk. Very friendly helpful staff and even though it's an older hotel, the suites are spacious, comfortable, quiet and clean, though kitchen and bath are very small and a bit dated. Beds really comfy. All requests were quickly and cheerfully taken care of by the very friendly and accommodating staff who always greeted us with a smile and hello when we passed through the lobby. We took our TV remote to the front desk when the battery died and when we got back to our suite after printing our boarding passes, 10 minutes tops, the remote was already returned to our room. Our only complaint: the $14.00 a day charge for WiFi. Should be free in all hotels. We stayed for 5 nights - would certainly return to this hotel for our next New York holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice - large apartment, great laundry”
Reviews.Author: OnceWereBackpackers
Reviews.Content: Hi. We (husband and I and our two kids, aged 9 and 10) stayed at the Eastgate Towers in September this year. We would definitely stay again. What we loved - heaps of space in the apartment. There was a separate bedroom with two queen beds (the kids shared a bed, or invariably, one slept with me and one with my husband - we don't mind on holidays). It was great after a busy day as the kids could head to bed and we could sit in the lounge room, have a chat and a drink, watch tv etc. It was also great that in the morning, whoever woke early could sit in the lounge area whilst the others slept in in the bedroom. It was also great having two bathrooms. There is a laundry onsite downstairs. This was excellent - saved us carting the dirty clothes to a laundromat offsite or having to pay huge drycleaning bills. Having a kitchen and dining table was also great. We didn't cook any meals but was lovely to be able to spread out, bring back salads etc and sit up at the table. It is an easy 10 min walk (with kids) to Grand Central station and about 15 mins to Times Square. There are also a number of nice delis nearby for salads, fruit etc etc. The bathrooms are a little dated but definitely clean. If you are after the latest bathroom, then this place is not for you but really they are only about 5-10 years old and clean so to us that's all that mattered. The only couple of negatives and these are very little - there could have been a bit more crockery in the cupboards - bit lacking on plates, cups etc but maybe someone had taken some. Also the cost of the internet is quite expensive - we didn't have our own laptop etc so if you have, then it's free wifi. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Eastgate Tower, New York”
Reviews.Author: Spudbud35
Reviews.Content: My family recently had a trip to NY and stayed at the Eastgate Tower. The rooms were very spacious and clean. We had two rooms on different floors, I had the assistance of Doris Mitchell and my daughter had Joyce (12th floor). We could not have been looked after any better during our stay. Both ladies went out of their way to help us finding our way about, directing us to the best places and making us feel so welcome in NY. This is all outside of making us comfortable during our stay. All the staff were very pleasant especially Manuel who worked on reception and Ash who was one of the porters. It is certainly a hotel I would return to when I visit NY again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travellerTweedHeads
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 4 nights, 23/9/11 - 26-9/11. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. The location was walking distance to everything. We had a 2 bed 2 bath apartment and found it clean and roomy. It had everything we needed and have no complaints about this hotel and would recommend it . We love NY.

Reviews.Title: “Best Price for Experience”
Reviews.Author: Transpacific
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of price - $1623 for five nights inclusive of taxes and because of mostly favorable reviews. Negative comments - tiny bathroom relative to suite, vanity in bathroom was made of formica, bathtub needs to be refinished and bathroom had no exhaust fan. Kitchen was also tiny. As everybody else has said, decor is tired but after a few days the room started to feel like home. Old TV's, don't expect flat screen TV's. Had to pay for wi-fi- $45 per week. Positive comments - great location, Grand Central is 6 blocks away and Times Square is a 20-minute leisurely walk. Lots of good restaurants nearby - Jackson Hole for burgers, Phoenix Garden for Chinese food, was told Aquamarine would have been a good one to go to. Booked a Junior Suite with two beds; was given a better room with a separate closed-off bedroom. Room had plenty of closets and drawers. Good quality linens changed daily. Very comfortable beds. Laundry facilities available in basement of building. Very friendly staff. Overall a great value. Would definitely come back unless I see a better deal elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Spacious but Tired”
Reviews.Author: Kat0chs
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews on this hotel and decided to give it a chance. The price was right and the location was good (we walked everywhere from here). I was very concerned when we walked into the lobby. It was shabby, tiny, and the elevators looked like they had been installed in the 50's. We crossed our fingers as it groaned its way to our 12th floor room. I was pleasantly surprised when we walked into the spacious rooms. It really looked like it had been an apartment that was now a converted into a hotel. We had a kitchen, dining area, living room, and a 1/2 bath off that area. Then the bedroom was very large with some seating and an attached full bath. The room was spotless but very dated. Clearly it was maintained well, but the decor really needs a do-over. The kitchen had very clean, but very old appliances. The cabinets had new doors, but the cabinets themselves were metal. That means old. It didn't bother me at all because I was after the value and we sure got that. Overall, the room was very clean, the staff was extremely helpful, and the location was great. I would most definitely visit this hotel again and would recommend it. NYC can be very expensive and rooms short on space, so this was a great find. If you're looking for a boutique hotel, modern or stylish decor, this is not the place for you. If you're looking for lots of room, cleanliness, good location and great value, then definitely check this out. We did not experience street noise and slept very well. I expect it might be because we weren't facing the street and were also on the 12th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but needs renovations...”
Reviews.Author: l4lx
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of Affinia properties, but this one was a real odd ball--it lacked that charm and boutique feel. No room service, no quirky-cool lobby--it was more than likely an old apartment building that has yet to be renovated. My room was relatively large and spacious for NYC standards and had a few kitchen items which could be nice for a family. The bathroom was very small and didn't have a curtain over the window, nor a way for me to cover it with a towel??! I didn't mind it much, but the hotel is located next to a very busy street, so the noise could potentially bother some. But between the air conditioner and tv, I was able to block it out. Overall I wouldn't stay here again just based on my own preferences and expectations of an Affinia property.

Reviews.Title: “street noise and damp carpet”
Reviews.Author: Rob N
Reviews.Content: I booked this place based on the many reviews. I had request a quiet room, but got a room on a low floor facing the street and the room looked old. I could hear people's conversations out on the street, which means I could hear everything else going on outside. Not good if you're a light sleeper. Secondly there was a industrial fan in my room. It looked like the carpet was just cleaned and not completely dry yet. I voiced my concerns about the carpet and the street noise and I was told that there would not be any quiet rooms available for a couple of days. The next day I made alternative arrangements and went to check out. At this point the manager offers me an upgrade to a quieter room, available straight away. So why wasn't this made available when I first complained but only when I wanted to checkout? I stayed there one night but due to my early check out I was charged for 3 nights. Unfortunately, my experience in this hotel was not a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space, great for families, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CCG461
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a two bedroom suite on the 14th floor with two adults and two teenagers. The accommodation was even bigger than we expected, as it was actually two apartments with a connecting door. So we had two sitting areas, two kitchens and two bathrooms and our sons had their own room, with two double beds. So lots of room. Beds very comfortable. Great location too, easy walking to attractions and buses, and cafes and shops nearby. High standard of cleanliness and the staff were always helpful and courteous. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Indian spice smelled floor and room on 13th floor!”
Reviews.Author: ech200
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at Eastgate if you have a choice and if you booked it already, make sure you have a copy of your confirmation.
