In my experience, my reservation was changed from a 2 bedrooms suite to a junior 2 beds. I had to go online and print out the reservation to prove it. After they finally got me the 2 bedrooms suite, it was on the 13th floor. Bad sign! After I got out of the elevator, pungent curry smell just overwhelmed me. Should have just went downstairs and cancelled the room. But, I thought maybe the smell would be gone once the hotel cleans it. Nope, the smell lingered and after one night, I was DONE. Checked out and cancelled the rest of the reservation. Can you believe it, the hotel staff didn't even seem surprised. They knew!! And the front desk lady didn't even bother to apologize for it. Unbelievable. Terrible experience. Don't stay at Eastgate Tower unless you can tolerate bad customer service, smelly floor and smelly room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful and friendly staff and huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: susan D
Reviews.Content: We had four of us with our two sons aged 20 and 15, and the accommodation was ideal. It was a fantastic location, we walked a lot of the time as the UN was in session and the roads gridlocked. Lots of local restaurants and places to stock up at nearby supermarkets. All of the staff were great, not one bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location , incredibly large rooms and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Macksher03
Reviews.Content: I recently visited NYC on a retirement trip for my father with a party of 5 including my sister.having visited Manhattan on two previous occasions I was absolutely amazed at the space we found in our 2 bedroom suite.The decorations are dated but I honestly believe the prices are in proportion.having the second bathroom was perfect for the one female in our party.we found the location perfect for getting around the five boroughs as grand central station was a 10 minute walk so we were able to visit Yankee stadium in the Bronx and also the mets baseball game in queens within 1/2 hour.there are plenty of good value bars and restaurants that were within walking distance along with the usual fast food choices.But the biggest plus point of all were the friendly and helpful staff who could not have done more to make our once in a lifetime trip more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “New York hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larion04
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at the Eastgate. Basic but clean room and a very convenient location. Surprisingly quiet given proximity to all the attractions. We were on the 6th floor, had windows open and had no traffic noise. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Debbi134
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for getting to the sites of New York City and beyond. We especially appericated the size of the junior suite. There were three of us and we didn't feel crowded at all. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We intend to stay at Eastgate Tower again when we return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Ants everywhere”
Reviews.Author: cardio2live
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this weekend and it was really gross..YOU pay $325 for a room and you get MOLD, Dirt, someone else's hair all over the sheets, fruit flies and ANTS....ants all the over the room!!! yes there was no bed bugs that i saw, but ants crawling over all the walls and rugs. The shower curtain was so old, it was prob from the 80s!! and the showerhead, omg that thing wasnever cleaned. Sorry but i would NEVER stay there again. The manager was very nice and apologized and compensated us for the ant infestation...but really all that money you are taking in, u cant get a 10$ shower curtain?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and price”
Reviews.Author: Monica N
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a little old and they have no free WIFI. The price to get WIFI was very expensive and you could only connect one computer. The front desk was helpful and nice. The location is excellent and the kitchen clean, complete and useful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: happycamper930
Reviews.Content: Eastgate Tower on 39th Street off second Avenue - near Grand Central and subway lines. Converted apartment building with suites and kitchens. Rooms are comfortable and good value for NYC but could use some upgrading. The standout is the staff - in particular Donna was very helpful and was able to check us in early; answered all our questions with enthusiasm and courtesy. happycamper930

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ailish2101
Reviews.Content: I checked into a 2 bedroom room in this hotel with friends. The room was very spacious and clean but the decor was dated (which was not a problem), the only down side of the room was that it had a stale smell on arrival !! The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We requested a slightly later check out which we got with no extra charge.The hotel location was good just off 3rd avenue on 39th street.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to fault”
Reviews.Author: Robert16
Reviews.Content: Good location: I’m not sure NY has an ideal hotel location; broadly speaking, anywhere on Manhattan Island south of Central Park seems as good as anywhere else, and this was just fine. The area didn’t feel threatening (but, contrary to some expectations, I didn’t find anywhere in NY to be threatening). Plenty of nearby places to eat and buy groceries. Huge room: actually, I was upgraded free to a suite, which meant big bedroom, big lounge, small kitchen area, two bathrooms, two TVs, – what would be called a “spacious apartment suitable for six people” in a French ski resort. Great views from the windows. Furniture had a quirky nature: it seemed old-fashioned, but didn’t seem to be all that old. Excellent bed, everything clean. Staff couldn’t be better; friendly, helpful. Can I think of anything to criticise? Nope. It’s not the Ritz, but it doesn’t pretend to be. It delivers on all its promises, doesn’t disappoint. I’d go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: CAhiker09
Reviews.Content: Not only was the location excellent, the staff was also great. Very clean room, kitchen appliances, comfortable bed. Everything that one could need for a wonderful stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaiwen
Reviews.Content: Staff and employees were perfect. And very clean hotel. Room wallpaper could be renovated...

Reviews.Title: “going back there”
Reviews.Author: unseasonedtraveller9
Reviews.Content: keeping it simple: location: great price: good room: massive! as a suite comes with a kitchen so were "cooked" for ourselves and did not much the rest of the time. am looking at deals to go back again. was surprised to find such a large room in manhatten at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Irene couldn't stop us!”
Reviews.Author: aine1234_567
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I and three friends stayed at this hotel for 5 days which coincided with Hurricane Irene. Our room consisted of two queen beds (for myself and daughter), a kitchenette and bathroom/shower. We were on the 2nd floor and the room itself was very clean and spacious (by New York standards) but a bit of wear and tear was evident. The hotel itself is just off 2nd Avenue and about 12 mins walk to 5th Avenue and the Empire State Building. It is quite an old building but everything is good about it. The staff were very nice and friendly and the service was good and the air conditioning in the room was quiet and really good. There is no bar/restaurant but there are plenty within a few minutes walk of the hotel. The only thing that could be annoying is the sound of machines not far from our room on the outside of the building (generator or heating/cooling system perhaps). But other than that, I would fully recommend this hotel and a good place to stay in NY city for it's size of room, the kitchenette, the closeness to all the main parts of the city. I would also llike to say that the doorman/concierge was a really helpful person and hired us a private taxi (suv) to get back to the airport for €87 for 5 of us. This was great because the yellow taxis are a nightmare and drive like lunatics and the cars have no air conditioning and you would either die of fright or heat when you get into one from/to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families!”
Reviews.Author: Sarahbabes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eastgate Tower Hotel, New York from August 18 to August 24 for 6 nights. The 2 bedroom suite was very spacious and was perfect for 6 people. The location was fine (15 minute walk into Times Square). The staff are all friendly and helpful. The maid, Joyce, was very frindly and always made the room up perfectly. The only two downsides are that the hotel is quite dated and needs decorating. Also there is no restaurant or bar so the price is a little expensive considering these amenities are not available. Otherwise perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: SallyBoosMum
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights here and as a family of four found the rooms very spacious and well equipped. The decor is a little drab and tired but we didn't mind that as it was all spotlessly clean and serviced every day. The hotel location is excellent and easily within walking distance of shops, restaurants and attractions as well as Grand Central Station if you need to take a subway. The reception staff were great at recommending restaurants (Phoenix Garden chinese was amazing!!) and very helpful with any probelms or questions. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a family who like to spread out!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay.”
Reviews.Author: mrfeh
Reviews.Content: Can't really add anything to other reviews - it was as expected. I wish I could assess the value of this hotel vs. others (after taxes, it came to $250 per night), but as this was my first stay in NYC, I have nothing to compare it to. Spacious but somewhat dated.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer”
Reviews.Author: CJLacy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Eastgate Tower hotel in 2009 in support of the UN general assembly and enjoyed the location, service, and the distance away from the normal Manhattan attractions. Fast forward to 2011 and I brought my wife to Manhattan for our honeymoon. Not only were they still very helpful, they upgraded our room to the top floor suites with a bottle of wine and a card congratulating us on our marriage. Both times were an awesome experience and anytime I'm in the area I'll always come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Eastgate Tower. The staff -- both front desk and housekeeping -- is incredible. I had my pets there, and Joyce from housekeeping was incredibly friendly to them, and also to us. Donna helped me solve some room problems quickly, and Peter even helped us find a missing item after we had checked out! The hotel location is quite good. It's a short walk to Grand Central, and from there you can get anywhere. There's also some very good food within walking distance. The hotel rooms are nice, but could be updated. The TV in the room was an older CRT, and the network connectivity was unbelievably slow (though I heard they are soon putting in a T1, where the slow speed will be a thing of the past). Two really nice features: they allow pets, and there is a nice kitchenette in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A priority of guest service excellence and exceptionally clean”
Reviews.Author: LauraMSReadingPA
Reviews.Content: Very modest furnishings and amenities, but the location cannot be beat...close enough to everything without being tangled in the midst of the crowds of Times Square. My daughter and I received exceptional service by every single hotel employee during our stay and it is clear this is of highest priority at Eastgate. Noise carries a little between the suites...but in most hotels I have stayed it is unavoidable to hear something of your neighbors...we would definitely stay here again...it was great to have a lot of space, including the living room area, full kitchen, and closets.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: WoodridgeGreg
Reviews.Content: I was looking for reasonable accomodations in New York City for sightseeing. This turned out to be a good choice. The room I booked was a little on the small side, but that is to be expected in a big city. The room and bathroom was clean. The location was fine, at 39th and 2nd avenue, we were able to walk to Rockefeller Center, Times Square and the Empire State Builiding. All in all, this hotel, for under $200, was a good choice for anyone seeking clean accomodations in a good location in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Joyce Mangal Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: kaypee061
Reviews.Content: I had misplaced my phone and it lurked between the edges of the sofa of one of my friends room. I was really worried as this was my lucky phone and it had been missing for 7 days. It was Joyce's vigil that helped me find it. Not only is Joyce a vigilant housekeeper she is very nice to the guests and gives your room a homely treatment! Thanks to her I am finally have my expensive phone back ( I had lost hope) Cheers Kapileshwar Room No 12D

Reviews.Title: “Good central but basic”
Reviews.Author: MacJanet
Reviews.Content: Good value for being self-catering and so close to Grand Central and between Upper and lower Manhattan. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially Emmanuel when we arrived after midnight from a delayed flight. The bed was comfy, bathroom good, but the kitchen could be better equipped. We booked this because Murray Hill apartments nearby where we stayed last year were not available. Standard of accommodation at Eastgate was generally lower than Murray Hill.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice option for budget-conscious travellers”
Reviews.Author: Aquanaut65
Reviews.Content: My wife and 9-year-old child stayed at the Eastgate Tower for two days in June, during a stop-over before heading to Europe. I was pleasantly surprised to find that this comparatively inexpensive hotel met and exceeded our expectations. The rooms are clean, quite comfortable, and in an excellent location (3-4 blocks from Grand Central Station, 1/2 a block from a McDonald's and a 24-hour pharmacy, and 1-1/2 blocks to a well-stocked D'Agostino's supermarket, for those who prefer to cook themselves using the kitchen, which is stocked with cookware and utensils.) There are also many restaurants and services nearby (laundry, dry cleaners, hardware store, FedEx Office, etc.) The front-desk staff was extremely polite and most helpful, even upgrading us to a suite upon arrival. When we asked about transportation to JFK, they even arranged for a town car to take us to the airport, at a VERY reasonable rate (just ask one of the bellboys, Luis or Mike -- they'll help you out!) The maid service was excellent (they even did our dishes and pots and pans every day). While other reviewers are correct in stating that the rooms could use updating, the accommodations are by no means shabby or uncomfortable. As a well-travelled reviewer, I can honestly state that this is an excellent option for those on a budget. So good, in fact, that we booked another four nights at the Eastgate Tower on the return leg of our trip, and we were able to easily visit all of the major tourist sights via subway from Grand Central. Overall, a great bet!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of space at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: clanwilson
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed in the two bedroom suite and were very pleased. There was not only a kitchen but also a huge living area that included a dining room table. (Eight people could easily share this suite.) The two bathrooms came in very handy--no waiting time! I also appreciated the free use of the lobby computer for my airline check-in. The hotel is situated on a relatively quiet street with lots of food choices plus a grocery and drugstore nearby. Grand Central Terminal is about a ten minute walk away. I would definitely stay at the Eastgate again.

Reviews.Title: “A great week in our own "apartment"”
Reviews.Author: NYCforMe
Reviews.Content: 2 friends and I spent a week in a 2-bedroom suite at the Eastgate Tower in June. The suite was huge, and it was just like having our own apartment! I was fortunate enought to take advantage of a sale offered in January for $219 per night, and it was well worth it. Our room had a full kitchen, including a stove and refrigerator, a dining area, a large living room, 2 bathrooms and 2 bedrooms; 1 with 2 double beds, and 1 with a king bed. This hotel is not fancy by any means, and the furniture is a little worn and dated. But that was unimportant to us because the suite was very clean and the carpet looked new, housekeeping did a great job, and there were plenty of towels and no issues with hot water. We loved it! The only drawback for me would be the distance from the nearest subway. Although it was only about 6 or so blocks away, it seemed like an endless walk at the end of a busy and tiring day. Other than that, the location was fine, with plenty of restaurants and places to buy snacks and drinks just around the corner on 3rd St. We didn't need Wifi, but I understand that there is a charge for it. There is one computer for guest use in the lobby, and you have to feed it $5 bills to be able to use it, although you can print boarding passes free. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Eastgate again, especially if the price is right. I guess I could just get used to that trek to the subway!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for large families, be wary of not getting what you reserve though”
Reviews.Author: FiveHawaiiLovers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Eastgate towers with our two 12 year olds and our 10 year old. I spent a whole day trying to find a hotel in a good location that would accommodate the 5 of us. If you are traveling with only 2 children you have many options. If you have more than 2 children you can't fit into most of the decent hotels in NYC unless you pay for 2 rooms. On advice from fellow trip advisor users I found the Eastgate Towers. We paid about $200 a night with our AAA card for a 2 queen bed junior suite that also had a small kitchen and pull out sofa. The $200 doesn't account for the almost 15% tax. BE AWARE: When I made the reservation in January I was sure to clarify that I needed a room with the 2 queen beds. Then a few days before arriving called again to make sure my reservation said 2 queen beds. No one ever told me that the 2 bed suites were based on availability. So upon arrival I was very disappointed to find out that they didn't have any 2 bed suites available. The same thing happened to my sister-in-law who was traveling with a party of 6, 2 adults and 4 children. I met another woman in the lobby with 3 children who it also happened to. The hotel tried to make it right by giving us 2 roll-aways for free (normally $30 a night). There was plenty of room in the hotel for the 2 roll-aways. Problem was they were very uncomfortable, the pull out sofa is bad too. We had already been on the east coast for 6 nights and were exhausted, so was really disappointed that my kids weren't getting a comfortable night sleep. Having one bed in a room for 5-6 people isn't acceptable. That being said, the hotel was in a GREAT location, was clean, and the staff was friendly. It was great having a kitchen and saved us tons of money by making breakfast in the room and some lunches. There is a small grocery store a block away. The rooms are large. Seems to me they used to be apartments. Ours had 3 closets in it and a table that was big enough for all 5 of us to eat at. If you're picky about decor be warned that is very outdated. Halls can also be loud. You can hear people coming and going all hours. Because of so few choices for our size family and the good price, I'll probably stay here again and try again for the 2 beds.

Reviews.Title: “unique vacation, already suggested, back in November”
Reviews.Author: izio2000
Reviews.Content: First impression wasn't superlative, but maybe we were tired from the trip. Everything was wonderful instead, position, helpfullness staff ( Betsy deserves a Nobel for patient and efficiency), security. And least but not last the size of the apartments

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: DocContinentTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights in June 2011. This hotel is a great value for the price. The suite/unit was spacious and contained everything to make for a comfortable and enjoyable stay, although we didn't spend too much time in it because after all, you're in New York with lots to see and do. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room decor would not be considered luxurious but certainly sufficient. The hotel location was convenient to many things including the subway. The only issue and it was minor was that the air conditioner cycling on noise was a little disturbing when trying to sleep--but it worked, so I'm not complaining. The restaurant in the hotel was being remodeled so we don't have a comment about that. Free internet usage on the 1 computer in the lobby would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home in NYC”
Reviews.Author: NBrylkaMee
Reviews.Content: Local travel agents Millingtons (Leicester) recommended the hotel to us, and it proved to be a great choice. Situated in a relatively quiet part of town (which is most welcome after a hectic day somewhere like Times Square) but close to great places to eat like Sarge's Deli and Duke's, the hotel is clean, good value, and staffed by incredibly helpful staff. Special mention for Joyce our chambermaid, who always went the 'extra mile' to look after us!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value! Perfect for our hectic 5-night NY trip”
Reviews.Author: suzcad
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom/two bath suite for a five night trip to New York with our daughters (18 and 20) in July 2011 and couldn't believe what great value we seemed to be getting. There happened to be a special 'suite deal' on and we paid $1300, including taxes etc, for the whole thing! In mid-town. In July. For more space than (we understand) comprises most Manhattan apartments. It seemed almost too good to be true - I even emailed the hotel to double check I'd booked what I thought I'd booked. I had - and it turned out to be even better than we hoped or expected. OK, so the hotel is a little dated and in some places could do with a lick of paint. But it was clean and well serviced, all the staff we encountered were helpful and charming, the suite certainly had everything we needed (even down to a dishwasher which we didn't!) and the hotel is in a brilliant location for exploring everything New York has to offer. We especially liked the fact that this area seemed a bit less touristy than some, so the bars, restaurants and shops nearby (including the fantastic bagel place) were used by locals. The Eastgate Tower proved a superb choice for us and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. Yes, there are some negative reviews on Tripadvisor but we had been encouraged by the management's response to them and felt that on balance this was a good bet. We're so glad we went with our instinct! If you're looking for buzzing, contemporary, beautifully decorated hotel with a fancy lobby and lots of frills, then the Eastgate Tower probably isn't for you. If however you want your own basic New York apartment where you can really spread out, get Chinese delivered to your door when you're knackered, get a great night's sleep or watch TV in another room if you're the only member of the family suffering jetlag, AND save hotel costs to splash out on taxis, great meals, shows and more of the NYC experience, then you can't go wrong. (There are Youtube videos that give you a really good idea of the space and decor by the way.) Thanks Eastgate Tower. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: Turkey42
Reviews.Content: We(Myself,wife and 16 + 12 yr old daughters) stayed in the Eastgate for 5 nights(28th May-1st June)for a holiday in New York.We booked through Expedia and were slightly concerned that it was rated as 2 1/2 stars.Searching through Trip Advisor though everybody seemed to like it and we weren't disappointed.We can't fault it in any way.The staff at reception were polite,helpful and always smiling.We booked a 1 bedroomed room which was on the 15th floor and overlooked Manhattan.The living area was huge and included a dining table and chairs,the kitchen was handy and included a big fridge/freezer,toaster,microwave and coffee percolator.The bedroom contained 2 king-sized double beds,television,large set of drawers and ample wardrobe space.The bathroom was the smallest of the rooms but was all we wanted including a shower over the bath.Both the living room and bedroom had air-conditioning which was invaluable when we stayed there as temperatures were in the 80's.Location wise it was ideal being a 10 minute walk from Grand Central.If we go to New York again the Eastgate will be my 1st choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Williamfr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so close to times square as we walked there most of the time. The staff were more than helpful and the hotel was great as it was like a mini apartment and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NY

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: bpwilson
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you want an affordable hotel (we paid $150/night) in heart of New York City. Our room was more like an apartment. It had a small kitchen (stove included), bathroom, and a large bedroom. The hotel is old and could use an update but everything was clean and bug free! The door man is very friendly and helpful! They offer parking through the neighboring parking deck for a fee. Worth the money, they took our car for us, brought it back when requested, and we paid them. I never had to even see the deck! The hotel is about 6 blocks from Grand Central and the neighborhood seemed safe. If we return to the city we will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location .. within budget :)”
Reviews.Author: Archit_Jain1008
Reviews.Content: planning for your NYK trip and that too within economic budget then this is the hotel you should go for .. near to grand central terminal/ times square. The bus stop is also nearby. the rooms were big and well equipped (with free internet). They have a full kitchen with microwave / some utensils/coffee machine. Mcdonald, Subway, pizza shop, and other general eatable items shop just next to hotel (hardly 2-5 min walking distance). Staff was very helpful (we initially booked a room for 3 but ended up with 4 . After our request, they upgraded our room without any issue (obviously with a nominal charge :) ) I recommend this hotel for every sort of trip (business/vacation).

Reviews.Title: “We had our own little apartment in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: CapeCod37
Reviews.Content: What a find! A one bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms was perfectly suited for our NYC stay. We were warmly welcomed at rhe front desk with ease of check-in. Very friendly staff. the suite was spacious, well decorated and immaculate. It was also very quiet. We stayeded for 4 nights (attended a professional conference) and walked everywhere. The hotel is so centrally located that getting around the city was easy. Eastgate Towers is our new favorite hotel in NYC and we will always try and stay there when in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good.”
Reviews.Author: MoscowNick
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff help improve this place but it's still not worth the money, even for NY. We paid over $300 a night and I wish I'd paid another $100 for something more decent as this place is old, maximum 3* and disappointing. The rooms were very noisy - I know it's NYC but the windows when closed were letting in the noise almost as much as when they were open. The rooms are big and you do get a tiny kickenette, but it's all very tired and worn down. Very disappointed and won't go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: Discountmaven
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in mid-April with our three boys (ages 8, 6 and 2). We had a 2-bedroom suite (one room with a king bed and the other with two queens). It was perfect for us. The room was huge! The extra space gave the boys room to play while we were at the hotel, and we used the kitchen to make breakfast each morning. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel has not been refurbished in quite a while, but everything worked and was very clean. I don't think my husband and I would stay here for a romantic weekend away, but we plan to stay here every time we come to NYC with our kids.

Reviews.Title: “We Always Come Back”
Reviews.Author: wredbass
Reviews.Content: For a mid priced hotel in NYC, you can't do better. The location is excellent with easy access to public transportation. The rooms are converted small studo apartments extremely large with kitchens. (great for cutting the cost of meals) The staff is excellent in every way. Although we may stay there only once or twice each year, the bus staff always greets us with with a hearty "Welcome Back". The cost varies with time of year and day of week so flexibility is key to best prices.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: singlemumandson
Reviews.Content: Our party consisted of myself and my three year old son, my father, his wife and my grandmother. We booked a 2 bedroom suite which was plenty of room for our needs. Two bathrooms meant we could all be up and ready without fighting for a shower, and on one night during our stay, we had family over. There was easily 25 people in the suite and it did not feel overcrowded. The staff were pleasant, friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a quiet neighbourhood but is in close proximity to all of the action of the City - 5/10 minutes walk to Grand Central Station, where you can catch the subway around the city and dad and I walked from Empire State Building to the hotel in no time at all. There are diners, eateries on the streets around the hotel - I would definately recommend this hotel to families and those wanting to stay a little way out of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great base, great value”
Reviews.Author: jonni2bad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights from 18th June. Had read all the reviews and I think I knew just what to expect and it didn't disappoint. Check-in very quick and efficient, very friendly staff on arrival. The room was very spacious, lots of storage space etc and was clean and cool - good air-con worked very quickly. The bathroom was on the small side given the overall room space, but it didn't detract from the overall experience. We didn't eat in so only made use of the fridge for keeping drinks cold, so I can't really comment on the suitability of amenities in there. Staff very friendly and helpful and always on hand (24hr). This hotel is ideally located for the NY visitor, it's quiet enough not to be a problem for very light sleepers yet not far from many of the main sights. No great views, but you get what you pay for and in the Eastgate, the money you save by not being in a swanky area or overlooking Times Square for instance can easily be redistributed to help you enjoy much more of NY. Anyway, who wants to stay in Times Square? Happy to recommend this to anyone considering a 'budget' hotel in NY.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: ilovenewyork92
Reviews.Content: We went with our school, it was an amazing hotel and very close to the Empire State Building. The rooms were massive and a maid came in once a day to clean the rooms. The veiws from the rooms were mainly building but what do you want! your in new york after all. I am deffiantly going back with the school next year!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms centre of the the big apple”
Reviews.Author: IAMADragon
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have just returned from a week in NYC staying at the Eastgate tower located near grand central terminal (subway to anywhere unlimited travel on metro and buses weekly pass $29) close to empire state building walkable to 5th ave shopping, times square etc. Hotel check in check out quick and efficient bag storage available the room was big and clean and complimentary coffee refreshed daily large fridge and cooker for self catering (eating out can be costly although take outs good value) also available free internet access to airlines for check in (for other sites free internet access available at NYC public library close by 42nd st). The only moan was the noise the air-con unit made I don't know whether they all sound like this but in the daytime OK although we did turn off at night also no room safes although safety deposit at reception. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again loved NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Eastgate”
Reviews.Author: aworldoftravel
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here this past March for the weekend. This is a great location. We had show tickets and were able to walk to see The Addams Family and dinner. We stayed in a 2BR suite with 2 bathrooms and a kitchen. The apartment style was very conducive to our family. The staff was pleasant and friendly. There were no surprises with our bill. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Swede085
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eastgate Tower for 5 nights on a vaccation trip with my mother. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel room was very spacious and had a little kitchenette with a stowe, owen, fridge, micro and so on. We found it very useful for fixing us breakfast every morning. The standard of the room was very out dated and run down. However, the location was perfect. A short walk to Grand Central and enough out of the way from the worst traffic noices. (A city that never sleeps is never totally quiet) For the money we payed it was worth it's value, since we were not looking for modern, high class living we were very satisfied with our stay as a whole. If I come back I would definitley stay at Eastgate Tower again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good neighborhood, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: beenaroundawhile
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant one-night stay on business. Spacious rooms with fully-equipped kitchen at a rate far below anywhere else in the area. Building appears to have been converted from apartments, so there are no frills like a restaurant, bar, etc. -- but the neighborhood offers all of that within easy walking distance. My only real gripe is the one I have with most NYC hotels -- the way they ding you for internet access in the room. Here it is $14 a day! Virtually every motel on I-95 between Boston and Florida provides this for free.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: negramontana
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean place to stay in NYC. The studio we stayed in is larger than most hotel rooms in NYC. Valet parking is relatively cheap for hotels in Manhattan. I would stay here again. Not the most modern furnishings but it is solid.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: IsabelVM
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, decoration updated but very well kept. Welcoming, friendly and very efficient staff. Many supermarkets, delis, restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: dunbar57
Reviews.Content: the service we recieved here was first class.the staff are friendly and helpful,the rooms were cleaned every day.having the kitchen saved us a fortune on breakfasts.the location was close to grand central station for underground trains anywhere in New York ,we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Our stay could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: cameo1963
Reviews.Content: I booked a trip several months in advance to bring my 70 year old mother to NYC for the first time for her birthday. In my reservation, I made a request for a higher floor, which would be quieter, based on the advise of other trip adviser travelers. When we arrived, our check-in was smooth and the staff was sooooo kind and helpful. I was pleased to note that they had indeed honored my request for an upper (22nd) floor. Apparently, though no one ever confirmed this, but I believe we were upgraded, as our suite was HUGE (not to mention beautiful and most comfortable). The views were outstanding. There was even a tiny birthday cake on the dining table with a personal card from the manager to my mother wishing her a wonderful birthday. This was my fourth trip to NYC and have stayed at another location the first three visits. However, I took a chance and am so glad I did and this will now be my GO-TO hotel when in New York. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent can recommend”
Reviews.Author: alimhall
Reviews.Content: We booked a family room, 2 huge bedrooms massive lounge 2 bathrooms beds were so comfy staff very friendly helpful & knowledgeable, yes it is slightly dated but ever so clean, can't recommend it enough, super location - we loved our stay

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: argus23
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff (Carole especially), good size studio room with handy kitchenette and very comfortable. Only 2 blocks from Grand Central Station, and one street away from a well stocked (for New York) Supermarket. Plenty of eateries close-by. After one night we were moved from 3rd floor to the 21st floor, with lovely views of skyscrapers through the clouds.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous and efficient personnel”
Reviews.Author: seedoris
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed at Eastgate Tower last May 9 to 14. We booked 2 rooms. They were nice and comfortable most of all very airy rooms. I loved them because they are clean and i can open the windows. But it is the personnel i like to commend. They are very responsive to your inquiries and courteous to help whether they are at reception or bellmen.They are efficient to work on your request. After our New England road tour, we came back for another few days stay before coming home to Philippines. It so happened we arrived too early for check in at 2pm. I requested for early check in coz we were really tired from long driving. Donna, the manager on that day May 21 was very accomodating. She tried her best to give us at least one room first so we could rest with a child. It really touched me that she is considerate and kind most of all understanding the feeling of travellers. More power to your hotel. You have good people! Thanks Donna. You are great asset to your company! Regards, DORIS SEE Registered under my son's name Halvin Henschel See

Reviews.Title: “Started off bad....”
Reviews.Author: munchkinhead_9
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the room they gave us was not the room we paid for. It was a double bed, when we paid for two double beds for the junior suit. So my sister in law had to sleep on the cot bed they supplied. They told us the rooms were fully booked and promised us the room we paid for the next day and not to unpack as they would move everything for us when we were out. After a tiring day out we came back to the hotel to wait for our new room cards when the receptionist told us no rooms were available. I couldn't believe it would be another second day when we would be living out of our suitcases and she said she would reserve us another room the next day however I was not going to wait again until a room became available. The receptionist told us we needed to speak to the manager to rectify the problem but I said we shouldn't have to repeat myself when we should of gotten what we paid for. We asked for a part refund but they could not do that but promised us a family room with two separate bedrooms. At this point I didn't know what to believe and again we did not unpack. When arriving back to the hotel on the third day of our week holiday, we were finally giving an upgrade. The room was more than we expected and after all the hassle we felt the hotel had compensated us. The room was massive with a separate kitchen, dining room with living room. Two bathrooms (one blocked but got fixed after we mentioned it) and two bedrooms, one with a double king size bed, and the other with two double beds. It was cleaned on a daily basis but the carpets were a bit dusty. Not sure if I will book again as I am not sure if I would of complained so much if they would of given us the upgrade. Also the location was ok, not great, I have stayed in New York a few times and have stayed in closer locations. It probably takes a good 15-20mins from Grand Central Central. Not so great if you have walked all over the city for 12 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with incompetent front desk”
Reviews.Author: BigShura
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great location, clean and comfortable room. Incompetent front desk. Can not handle multiple reservations and stay extension. Have been harassed by front desk daily, very unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Space: loads of it! I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: summers_slayer
Reviews.Content: I got a crazy fantastic offer at the Eastgate Tower for 6 nights from 9 – 15 May in a 2 Bed/Bath suite with my partner and 2 others. What can I say about this hotel, apart from the fact that it was wonderful and far far better than I expected and believe me when I say I have extremely high standards! We had a suite on 23rd floor and the amount of space was unbelievable! We had a big king room and a large twin with 2 double beds. And oh my goodness are they the comfiest hotel beds I’ve ever slept on! There were 2 wardrobes in each room and a further 2 storage cupboards in the living room. The dining table was great for eating and for spreading out our stuff to plan each day and there was ample space if we did want to have the full 6 people in the room. The full kitchen (which had everything you would need) could have been used for full meals but we just used it for snacks and the large fridge for keeping drinks cool and snacks which we got at the shops 2 minutes from the hotel. I did request a kettle on our 1st day and we had it within 5 minutes. The bathrooms were small but again had plenty of cupboards, ample towels and the shower was always hot and powerful. The hairdryer was also surprisingly powerful! The room was spotless and cleaned every day by house-keeping who also kept topping up our coffee supplies which we were grateful for! Some mention the décor is old fashioned, but it’s not really. It gives a much more homey feel to the hotel and I much prefer that than somewhere that is contemporary and all white tiles. We had 3 lights in our room, so when we wanted lots of light we had it. The curtains don’t close properly though, so if you can’t sleep when the sunshine comes in, make sure you take an eye mask with you! I usually sleep with one anyway so it didn’t matter to me. The corridors are a bit dark as they are papered a dark blue, but you don’t stay in the corridors, so don’t let this put you off. Also there are only 2 lifts, but they are really fast so we were never waiting more than seconds. A big plus was that we could open all of the windows to let fresh air in and to keep the room cool during the day. To shut out the noise outside at night, we put the air con on. I saw some weren’t sure how to work the air con, but the controls are under a flap on the top of the unit. The lobby was small, compact and clean and had a computer (which I didn’t use), sofas and a unit filled with tourist leaflets. All you need! Location wise was also great! The hotel is approx 7 minutes walk to Grand Central, the same to Bryant Park, 15 minutes from Rockefeller Plaza and 20 mins to Times Square! We had no problems flagging taxis right outside the hotel apart from on a Friday night but we got one by the time we walked 2 blocks. There was a great diner 3 blocks away when you turn left out of the hotel called Scotties which I can highly recommend and countless other diners and deli’s just a 1 – 3 minute walk away. There is also a Starbucks and a Pret a Manger beside Scotties and a McDonalds at the bottom of the block from the hotel to the right, so plenty of places to get free Wifi if you don’t want to pay for it at the hotel, which is what I did as I didn’t need it constantly. For the smokers or those that just want to sit outside, there is a little garden patio area at the side of the hotel which we loved just to relax in at the end of a days shopping. The staff were also superb. Unfortunately I was quite ill on the day of check-out, but they let me stay in the room for an extra half an hour so I didn’t have to rush to check-out, which helped so much. Patrick was also superb! He stored all of our bags for us (and there were many) and he also booked a transfer to the airport for us (only took 25 minutes). We felt very well taken care of. This is the 2nd time I’ve stayed in a hotel in New York and I can safely say that this was the bargain of the century and one of the best hotels I’ve ever stayed in. I said to the staff when we left that we would be back and I can promise you we will be!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, as promised in Expedia”
Reviews.Author: kendahl25
Reviews.Content: After planes cancelled & delayed, we telephoned to advise arriving about midnight. No problem .. counter staff & porter welcoming, room allocated was 16th floor ... at all times, for 6 days, everything was calm, simple, helpful when asked. Walk to Grand Central was not too onerous but once there, everywhere is accesssible - take the shuttle direct to Times Square. The ATM at hotel lobby is handy but it charges for account balance .. just don't ask. There is a convenience store & fast foods at the next corner east and a good Chinese restaurent just around in 40th St.. Nearby access to the river tunnel makes rapid access to La Guardia and JFK airports

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, everything correct as shown in Expedia.”
Reviews.Author: kendahl25
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to Grand Central gave us access to everywhere by subway or bus or direct shuttle to Times Square. Friendly staff (we remember Negesti Thompson) ready to help. Hotel is not in a "restaurant district" but there is a good Chinese restaurant close by in 40th St. and convenience store + fast foods just at the next corner east.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value, location and service”
Reviews.Author: psmorrison
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a group of friends, and between us we booked two 2-bedroom suites. I had a suite with two friends, so we had a bed each, but if you are travelling as couples you could easily sleep 8 in the apartment we had (including the sofa bed). I am 6' 6" and was swamped by the enormous bed in my room. The apartment living space was huge, and although the kitchen was relatively small, it was quite serviceable and we barely had use for it anyway. It was approximately a 10 minute walk to Grand Central, with a selection of bars and diners on the way, and a comfortable walk from midtown if the subway is too crowded. Our room was on the top floor (25th) and the views were impressive with only the minimum of street noise (and what's a stay in New York without the sirens?) as well as quickly accessible by the speedy elevator. Internet access from the computer in reception was expensive, but I paid a reasonable rate for free wi-fi which was accessible throughout the building and quite speedy to boot. Unless I was travelling alone, this is the only place I would consider staying in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: thvid
Reviews.Content: This is highly recommended. We stayed for 4 nights, and were upgraded from standard suite to a spacious 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom upon arrival. What a big surprice when we entered the apartment. Clean rooms, great and soft beds. We were on the 16th floor so there was only wind-noise! Partly view to the UN-building. Walking distance to Times Sq (about 1 kilometer) and Empire State Building etc. Small reception area - but they are open 24hours. Only minor thing wrong is the lack of free internet...Using the wi-fi/internet at the hotel is pricy, so go the nearest Starbucks or McDonalds (just around the corner) is better!!

Reviews.Title: “Your own apartment in NYC for fabulous price”
Reviews.Author: Ceilia7
Reviews.Content: We traveled to NYC for NYU graduation. I booked it in January for the May visit and got the most incredible price ever for a 2 bedroom suite for 5 people. We were there for 5 nights and were all comfortable and happy. Yes, the decor is from the '80's but it is very well-kept and who cares when you don't live there permanently? Great location and fabulous service, especially from the bell staff (Jerry was the best). My husband has a mobility scooter and we had no problems at all with accessibility. We will stay there again and recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Size isn't everything”
Reviews.Author: she-muff
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on its size, location and price but it fell short in my eyes on all three levels. First off, our junior suite was an OK size, it looked like a former apartment with a cramped full kitchen and tiny bath, plus a small living room that unfortunately wasn't separated from the bedroom. Despite its size though, the entire place felt dated (think "1970s chic" without the chic) and thus not at all comfortable. I thought it would be a place my family could hang out and relax in between sightseeing but we couldn't be out of there long enough. The carpet constantly felt dirty and there was still food in the dish strainer when we checked in. Some of the glasses felt greasy upon first use. The trash can lid in the kitchen was broken and the TV was the old-style big-box model type that wasn't very sensitive to the remote control. We woke up with bites after our first night but I checked for bedbugs and didn't find any and my husband guessed that perhaps there were dust mites instead as parts of the room did feel rather dusty and caused his allergies to act up. As for the location, I didn't find it convenient at all, and I love to walk. The closest subway is Grand Central, which is great for food but the lines that run through there weren't main ones so we almost always had to transfer anyway. Plus, I thought that being out of Times Square would mean a quieter room but I guess because the building is so old and the walls are so thin, you can hear everything, such as the ambulances wailing by and cars honking below. I could even hear our neighbors' running water or when people were talking outside in the hallway. Speaking of the hallway, it always reeked of smoke, even though the building is supposed to be nonsmoking. Even the elevator smelled like smoke sometimes too. I guess you get what you pay for though because the price isn't too bad considering its size and that, after everything, is a hotel room in New York. Still, I think we could pay a similar price for a nicer, albeit smaller, more conveniently located room elsewhere. One other thing I should mention is the staff. While the housekeeping staff was quite friendly and always greeted us, the front desk staff could've cared less when we were standing right in front of them and the doormen/bellmen always looked like they'd rather be anywhere else but helping customers. It was as if we were an inconvenience to them for staying there. I also thought it was odd that although checkin is at 3, we arrived at 215 and were told our room wasn't ready yet. Now I know we were early, but it was less than an hour before checkin. We've arrived at other hotels as early as 6 a.m. and have been shown to our room right away; this was one of the rare times we were unable to check in early and although I know it's never a given, just the fact that it was so close to checkin time anyway but were denied makes me wonder. All in all, next time, I'd stay elsewhere. The good thing was that since we were out so much, we saw everything on our itinerary, plus more, so I guess that's something, right?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: JulianneNM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in May for a 5-day mother-daughter vacation with my Mom and we had a great experience. This hotel is bare bones basic, nothing fancy, but it was a fabulous deal for the money and the location is excellent. I can't say enough about the location- 39th is just a few blocks away from Grand Central station (where you can take the subway to get just about anywhere) and from great restaurants and shopping along 42nd, Park and 5th. Because it's not on a main busy street, it was relatively quiet at night (for NYC). We found it was significantly more affordable than other hotels located just a few blocks away. We walked to Times Square one day and it only took us about 12 minutes. The staff was very friendly, our room was always clean with fresh towels, and it was great having a small kitchen. We bought snacks and breakfast foods at the Grand Central Market and it was great to have a small fridge. I wouldn't consider this a downside, but I think it's worth noting that this hotel is old, the decor and furniture is outdated, and there are no flashy amenities. This didn't bother us, as we spent all day out and about, but if you're looking for something upscale or romantic this wouldn't be my first choice. I would stay here again with family or friends.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic fantastic well done and thank you”
Reviews.Author: madtrecker
Reviews.Content: guys thank you for your helpful outstanding service. everyone at reception and the bell boy fab fab. room on 2nd floor double bed and galley kitchen with all amenities. spotless and cleaned daily. made our bxt and packed lunch so we didnt have to stop for meals and packed masses into 3 days . fab supermarket on 3rd ave at d'agostinos. and sarges deli for bxt and lunch. watch out for the 99c stores fab for batteries and essentials. grand central very close and a nice area to be in . mcdonalds across road. catching QM2 back to england car from hotel to brooklyn cruise terminal $40. city sights bus tours brilliant. shuttle bus from jfk bookable from info desk as you come out $19 each same as pre book on line. definately recomend this hotel we were very lucky booked through thomas cook. dont forget to book through boots web site to get your points by registering for treat street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience”
Reviews.Author: Iscoot
Reviews.Content: We had an early arrival and late check out. Although we weren't able to get into the room early, they were very accomodating in storing our luggage and getting us access to a restroom so we could freshen up before exploring the city. The staff was excellent and very friendly. We loved having a room with a kitchen as we saved lots of money not having to buy breakfast out and we had a place to store our left overs. We liked the location and found that it was easy to get to, but out of the way. We were in walking distance to the UN, Grand Central, Times Square and other major attractions. The area also had nice taxi traffic so it wasn't a problem hailing a cab.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place in NYC for us!”
Reviews.Author: DutchDirk
Reviews.Content: We (me, my wife and my brother-in-law) booked a 1-bedroom suite with sofa bed, but were upgraded by the Eastgate Tower to a 2-bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms. Nice surprise! The room was HUGE, it had a kitchen with stove, big oven, microwave, dishwasher, so we made breakfast every day. The decor is somewhat dated, but clean. Sheets and towels were replaced every day, as was the complimentary coffee and bathroom amenities. The beds were very comfortable. The location is excellent: between 2rd and 3rd avenue. It's (relatively) quiet at night, save the occasional fire engine. Grand Central is a nice 7 min. walk. There are more than enough locations for dining, several pubs and convenience stores in the neighbourhood. What made our stay really special was the staff of Eastgate Tower. Every single one of them was smiling, friendly, chatty and helpful. If we were to visit New York again, Eastgate Tower will be the only hotel to consider for us! 5-star service, 4-star rooms for a 2-star price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and amazing for value”
Reviews.Author: Stefano7676
Reviews.Content: Amzing apartments,service better then hotel.staff really friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Pat155013
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully large rooms with complete kitchenettes and comfortable beds. Very clean. Great showers with lots of hot water. Bathroom somewhat small. Quiet neighborhood compared to most, although the street noise at the lower levels may be bothersome if you left windows open. Within walking distance to Grand Central, United Nations, Times Square & Empire State Building. Staff was very accommodating - stored our luggage free of charge before check-in time & after check-out & gave us access to washrooms, arranged taxi to airport. 24 hour access to front desk personal safety deposit box for valuables. Convenience stores, bagel shops, grocery stores, restaurants (recommend Phoenix Garden at 242 East 40th St), & liquor store very close.

Reviews.Title: “great value stay”
Reviews.Author: kazbah56
Reviews.Content: Great location and staff friendly and helpful without being annoying. Unimposing lobby but the two bedroom apartment was fantastic for 4 friends traveling together and QUIET. Close to Grand Central Station and amenities. Would stay there again, definitely

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location, spacious and clean accommodation, helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jill503790
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with this hotel. It was like having our own apartment. Lovely laundry fresh clean beds, huge accommodation.Friendly and helpful staff. Taxi fares from airport are all set at 41 dollars for anywhere in Manhatten (50 with tip), and for the same price they arranged a car to take us to the airport for our return (very comfy). Take a printout map of address if its night time, as taxi went past it a couple of times. 10 minutes walk from grand central (go to grand central cafe under bridge for breakfast!) and 10 minutes walk from empire state. If you want to self cater there"s a wonderful supermarket round the corner (Like a tardis, sells everything). Recommend it to everyone. Jill Pepper

Reviews.Title: “can I get a permanent room please”
Reviews.Author: isg07
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5, teens and a tween. we also had the advantage of staying at this hotel in two separate rooms as we had to check out over a weekend. The hotel can definetely be a little updated but we have stayed in worse. Overall the size of the beds and the rooms were amazing and we had plenty of room. Our New York/New Jersey based family members were all in awe of the accomodation and all noted the address. Our first appartment had only a double bed in the room my husband and I used but in the second appartment we got a king sized one! Both appartments had two bathrooms which was greatly appreciated. We walked everywhere, with our ten year old: Grand Central station, Times Square, 34th Street ... There must be atleast 4 supermarkets/convinience stores in the vacinity which was just perfect for travelling with kids. Will definetely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and price!”
Reviews.Author: aereo22
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, just few blocks away from Grand Central and walkable to the Empire State building and Times Square. The rates are excellent, if you search and book well in advance. The hotel is almost always full, so not too many chances of getting checked in early if you arrive before 1500. Front desk staff is just average, however, the bellmen is very helpful. The rooms are spacious, and the kitchen with full refrigerator is a plus. There was some mildew in the bathroom, but it was very clean. Overall, I will definitively stay here again and, as a matter of fact, I will probably stay here whenever I visit New York again in the future. Don't hesitate to book this place!

Reviews.Title: “Large room, good location, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Mr_deezLondon
Reviews.Content: We were nervous before reaching the hotel as we had chosen the cheapest option within this comfort range. We were impressed: the room was very large. The kitchen was good enough for breakfasts and snacks. Also the location is fine (East Midtown) Perhaps the only disappointment was the staff at the counter. They couldn't care less and provided us wrong pratical information.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: bayou babe
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite, at Eastgate from April 27- May 1, 2011 with my girlfriend, her 16 yo son, and my 15 yo nephew. Eastgate is a hotel in the Affinia group, located in Murray Hill, and offers apartment style accomodations – actually extremely large suites!!!! I booked the suite on the Eastgate website after reading about a “special deal” on 2 bedroom suites in a thread in the NYC forum. I love the forums!!!! Arrival - We arrived by Dial 7 car service from EWR around 11:30 a.m. to store our lugguge until check-in at 3:00. When we dropped off our luggage at the hotel to be stored, the desk clerk advised that our room may be ready before 3:00 and gave me her card to call back and check. I verified that we were getting a two bedroom, two bath suite and asked what floor our room was on and was told the 8th floor. She advised that she could check us in now, so that when we return, we could just stop at the desk and pick up the room keys. With that said and done, we hit the streets. Lobby - The lobby is very small, with two desk counters, a sofa set, coffee table, TV, and short wall loaded with tourist brochures. The two elevators are “right there” in the lobby as well – all in a small compact area that was crowded just a few times when we were passing through. There is no restaurant in this hotel. There was an ATM when you first entered the lobby, but I never really looked at it or used it. The desk staff and bellmen were always very courteous and polite. No issues there. Just like clockwork, when we returned about 6:00 p.m., we stopped and picked up the room keys, only to find out that we were on the 15th floor instead of the 8th floor. The desk clerk handed me an Eastgate Tower envelope with my name on it, and when I opened it, I had a wonderful surprise – we bagged a BAG (Big Apple Greeter)! Our BAG had sent a fax to my attention at the hotel to advise me of our meeting time for our personal tour! See my trip report. It's a work in progress at the moment, so stay tuned for info about about BAG experience. http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g60763-i5-k4447113-Trip_report_Biting_the_Big_Apple_with_the_Boys-New_York_City_New_York.html The bellman retrieved our luggage from storage and we summoned the elevator. The elevators are small, but during our 5 day stay, we never waited too long for one. Several times, however, they were too full for us to get in, so we had to wait for another one. There was also another elevator around the side to the right, but we never took that one. I’m not sure if it’s for guests or not. The suite – Upon exiting the elevator, the hallway is very short. There were only seven suites on our floor. I’m not sure if every floor was like that or not. Our suite was 15G, very roomy, and very clean. The rooms were quiet. We never heard a peep from any other rooms or from outside while we were there. The suite looked just like the pictures posted on the various travel websites and in travellers’ reviews. It was kinda stuffy when we first arrived probably because there was no air circulating. We sprayed some “smell good” room spray and the musty smell went away. The furniture is dated (which we already knew), but we were hardly in the room anyway, and just wanted a comfortable, roomy place to lay our heads. And the beds were VERY comfortable!!!! I had two pillows on my side of the bed – one was soft and one was hard. It was good to have a choice or to use both if you preferred. My girlfriend and I stayed in the bedroom with the one queen/king size bed. The boys stayed in the bedroom with the two queen beds. The sofa in the living area also had a queen sleeper, that my nephew slept on for three of our four nights, leaving one empty bed in the boys’ bedroom. There were three TVs – one in each bedroom, and one in the living area. There was plenty of closet space, drawer space, and floor space. We were not bumping into each other with every step or turn – it was very spacious! Decent dining table and four chairs in the living area. The bathrooms were identical in size and layout, small, with very little counter space, but manageable. We kept most of our toiletries on the bedroom dresser. No big deal there. The hot water in our bathroom was plentiful. I never asked the boys about their water temperature, so it must have been fine. The first day, we did not have any washcloths in our bathroom, but there were two on the second day. Plenty of hand towels and bath towels though! I’m not sure what the boys had in their bathroom. I never went in there. Mainly because I don’t know if they lifted the lids when they peed.... Eeeewwww! On our last night, the toilet in our bathroom wouldn’t flush and you could hear the water constantly running. We had gotten in late once again, so I didn’t call since we did not want to be disturbed and just wanted to get some sleep. We were going to be checking out in the morning and storing our luggage until the car service pick up at 4:30 p.m. for our 7:25 flight. Both bedrooms, plus the living area had an AC/heating unit. I never really figured out how to use them properly, and with two women “hot flashing” and “night sweating” throughout the night, we really needed it to blow cold air on demand! Ha! The unit in the boys’ room seemed to not be cooling very well on our second day, but they never complained, so I never called to report it. If our visit would have been later in the spring or summer, I would have called the front desk to have them check the boys’ unit and instruct us how to set our unit to blow “really cold” for hot flash/night sweat relief. For the most part, this was no big deal either. Kitchen - The kitchen was nice – full size refrigerator, with a stove, dishwasher, and microwave. Glasses, plates, and eating utensils were provided as well. Nearby Places – we went to D’agostino’s Market on 3rd Ave to stock up on a few staples. My girlfriend and I also ate at Good Burger on 2nd Ave. on our first night there. The boys were crashed out. We wore them out that first day, so combined with the early morning flight, they ran out of gas. Ha! At Good Burger, the burgers were, well, good. We also shared a Good Burger salad, and it, too, was good. On Thursday morning, we went to Sarge’s Deli to buy sandwiches for our SOL/Ellis Island adventure. Sarge’s is on 3rd Avenue near D’agostino’s. Good friendly service, huge sandwiches – very good!!! Grand Central Terminal is only a short walk away, and it was our travel hub during our entire visit. We bought 7 day unlimited Metro Cards and used the subway the entire time we were there. The Metro Cards were well used and well worth it... Summary – The Eastgate Tower is not luxurious, but still very nice. It is a decent place to lay your head, and it fit our needs perfectly. We were only in the room between midnight and 8:00 or 9:00 a.m., and I would much rather spend my money shopping, touring, eating, etc... I would stay at Eastgate again in a heartbeat, especially at the rates that we were so lucky to get... Hopes this help... bb

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite place in NYC”
Reviews.Author: travelbelle88
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend with 6 adults in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment at the Eastgate Tower and never felt crowded or uncomfortable. Large rooms, comfy beds, clean bathrooms and kitchen. All you can ask for at a bargain price for 6 people in NYC. Liked the neighborhood and the staff made great recommendations for nearby restaurants. Only downside is that it is quite a few blocks to the subway but in the good weather we had, this was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location,friendly helpful staff,really comfy beds.Home from home apartments.”
Reviews.Author: Sid088
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, Grand central just a few minutes stroll.Good diners in this safe neighbourhood, especially Dukes. Macdonalds on corner of street open til early hours, very convenient. Kitchen cooker and fridge brilliant and coffee machine and dishwasher had fresh tablets and filters every day.Beds were HUGE and really comfy. Great to have opening windows and control of heating or air conditioning too. Really roomy apartment and clean. Staff were very quick to want to help and please and all very polite(especially Joyce in housekeeping)Local grocery store within a couple of minutes open til late. The concierge was very helpful on all our needs and arranged a taxi for us at a better rate than even the yellow cabs and it was a great Lincoln. Definately use this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: kerryklove
Reviews.Content: Large rooms. Clean. Great staff. Kitchenette. Great little neighbourhood. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: knixen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights, two adults and two girls aged 8 and 11. Very pleasant stay, spacious rooms, which comes in handy when you're more than two staying the odd night. Rooms are clean and nice, bathrooms are a bit on the small side and kitchen is minimalistically equipped, but that was no big deal for us. Reception area very small and the halls are not the best looking, but the rooms are fine and well kept. Very friendly staff, which will help you with anything, including transport. Location is really good, very short taxi ride (5-10 mins) to pretty much everywhere on Manhattan. Grocery store, cafes, restaurants just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Management-But Nice Staff and Room Size”
Reviews.Author: dcmtsav
Reviews.Content: We checked in early and were told one of our two rooms was ready and the other would be ready at 3:00-all was great. We went to the first room to discover a regular room, not the 1 bedroom suite that we reserved 3 months earlier. When I called to ask to be moved to our reserved room we were told that there had been a mistake and there were no 1 bedrooms available-for either of our reserves 1 bedrooms! No one mentioned this when we checked in-like maybe we would not notice. After complaining to the front desk AND getting the manager, we were told they would take $50 off of our rate (basically charge us the full price of the room we got) and move us first thing the next day. The next morning we dropped off our two room keys, told the front desk that we packed our bags as instructed and expected to be in the new rooms by 3:00. The manager, Donna, had never mentioned any of this to the new front desk worker but she said she would take care of it. When we returned after 3:00 there was only 1, 1 bedroom available. The same manager, Donna, then claimed we never asked for 2, 1 bedrooms(regardless of the reservations made in January). After MUCH discussion we finally got the rooms we reserved. When we checked out the $50 credit was only taken off of one room until we complained AGAIN. Now for the Affinia group affiliation-don't even bother thinking you will get the preference items you can reserve at their site. I reserved a guitar for our stay on-line and called the hotel directly the week before our stay to confirm the guitar request. I was told by the Eastgate staff it was in our reservation. Our second night there I called and was told it would be delivered, only to get a quick call back to be told they don't have guitars and did not know that was on their website until I told them. The rooms were big and served our needs well. Other than our issues with Donna and the lack of "preference items", the staff was polite and helpful. Despite our room issues, we had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “large rooms, well located, perfect for family with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: mantaray92
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite with 2 beds and a sofa bed: very convenient for this allowed each of our teenagers ( one girl of almost 13 and one boy of 16) to have their own bed. The main room is very large, which is comfortable when you want to rest a bit before going out again ( remember you walk a lot in NYC, and it is good to come back for an hour or so to rest before going out again!). YOu do not feel crowded. The bathroom is tiny...but for 5 days it is sufficient. The kitchen is not designed for cooking but it is perfect when you just have to reheat some take away dishes...which are very easy to find in NYC. The Townhouse restaurant, just around the corner, where we had breakfast is very simple, very american but perfect to have whatever you like for breakfast, light or complete with eggs, bacon and pancake. The staff was nice and helpful. Overall the style is a bit old fashioned, but it is clean, convenient, close from Grand Central Station and Times Square, with some grocery stores and restaurant around . Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Room rate very reasonable, excellent location, staff are friendly, rooms clean”
Reviews.Author: EpsteinAustralia
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very conveniently located. Very reasonable rate/clean . Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Value Suites”
Reviews.Author: CSL2
Reviews.Content: Last minute great rate from my "small local airport" bundled with this property on BookIt.com. Property located in Murrey Hill between 2nd and 3rd Ave. Convenient location walking to Grand Central Station, (to catch subway) with a safe neighborhood feel. Room valued for large size, closet storage, dresser, full kitchenette with daily coffe service, table w/ 4 chairs in living area w/ TV viewing in the Q room. Easily accommodates a couple with two children on pull out couch. Property has somewhat updated bedding, drapes, couch, but is combined with very 70's furniture giving it a lesser feel. Definitely three star rated trying to act like four star. Front desk staff did not exceed my expectation. Helpful only if I stood in line and requested help or info. A steep charge for wireless - leave lap top home and bring iPhone or iPad to use at Starbucks. Both TV (my daughter fixed) and remotete control did not work but our choice not to report it till check out as we would leave our room daily for 12 hours at a time. Awakened by loud garbage truck crushing room furniture early a.m. Renovating? Fumigating? Convinced I had one trailing bed bug bite on my neck upon arriving home creating huge work shaking out/washing everything, but it did not worsen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Quiet, Safe Area”
Reviews.Author: mmiller68
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent Spring Break (March 2011) in NYC and stayed at this hotel. The area is quiet and safe, and easy walking distance to Grand Central Terminal. There are also affordable restaurants and markets in a two-block distance. The hotel itself is not extravagant by any means, but is clean, comfortable, and has a very friendly staff. Our room had a full-size refrigerator and small kitchen, so we were able to save on not having to dine out for every meal. If you're in New York City on a budget, Eastgate Tower is certainly worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Value in New York City!”
Reviews.Author: NewZealandYankee
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge, the staff absolutely lovely, location handy and the price is great. They have two bedroom suites which are enormous and sleep 6+ easily. The rooms are always clean. We stay here every time we come to NY and now so do all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, good value.”
Reviews.Author: lroden
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to all midtown restaurants and business locations, as well as Grand Central. Friendly, responsive staff: came repeatedly to fix TV problem, offered free movies for inconvenience. No room service but area has so many good restaurants and markets, no need. Room has full kitchenette and adequate cooking/serving ware. Neighborhood felt quite safe both day and night, many young families walking dogs etc.

Reviews.Title: “hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: isaiasd
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for travelers with kids. There are couple of markets just a round the corner where you can stock up on food and bring back to the hotel to prepare. The kitchen is small but is has a stove, refrigerator, a small microwave oven and dishes and pans to cook in. This is a money saver since we didn't have to go eat out for breakfast. The kids were able to have their cereal in the morning. The rooms are no frills, two full size beds, a sofa bed and a tube tv with about 30 channels. There are a couple of pizza places close by.( DO NOT TRY "ROYAL PIZZA", it was a step above frozen pizza), a couple of Deli's and a Sushi place just across the street.. There is also a McDonald's close by. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the 42nd st/Grand Central subway station were you can connect to almost every subway line in NY. We used this station as our base. Subway tip *** make sure your train is not an express train. Express trains do not stop at every station***. The location of this hotel is great. We ended up walking to places most of the time. We used the subway was to go to battery park, where the ferry to the statue of liberty departs from, and to go to central park and the American Museum of Natural History. The walk to the empire state building/ Macy' s Store is between 15 to 20 minutes south of the hotel. The walk to Rockefeller center was about 20 minute walk north west of the hotel (The kids loved the Nintendo Store). To get to times square from the hotel just walk to 42nd st/Grand Central and take the S strain. Total travel time, about 12 minutes. One night we walked back to the hotel from Times Square it took about 30 minutes. We always felt safe walking to and from the hotel, the are is not seedy at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: glenbow68
Reviews.Content: My Friend and I stayed here because it's one of the few places in NYC that offers 2 beds and a kitchen. We arrived on Saturday expecting 2 beds since we had our half marathon race on Sunday morning. I had to reserve the room weeks in advance with a credit card (that was charged) and was allowed no modifications or cancellations for the rate. We arrived and the room had one bed. We complained and they said they would give a complimentary roll away bed or would make up the sofa bed. They had no other rooms available. We called corporate, they are an Affina Hotel. They couldn't help us since all their other properties were also full. They moved us the next day to a room with 2 beds and offered free parking. When we checked out they tried to give free parking for only one day. Manager wouldn't even come out and speak with us. The area was great a lot of restaurants within walking distance. Would definitely not return or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good neighbourhood, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: kh1881410
