Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights this weekend with my husband, location is great as quiet but with grocery store, chemist, McDonalds and coffee shop close by Hotel rooms are huge, decor not great but very clean and rooms cleaned daily, clean towels and coffee. Really handy to have the extra space and dont feel like you always have to be out. Staff are really friendly and would tell people to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service worse than airlines.”
Reviews.Author: FoxMoriarty
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotel room for a business party that was happening in NYC. Unfortunately it was on one of the days of the huge snowstorms that were rolling through the area. When my event was cancelled I called to see if they could change the room to the rescheduled night. Because the ticket was 'no refunds, no changes' they refused to do anything. Other people in my party who booked separately were able to move their rooms. Even airlines worked with people during this unusually harsh storm. Not this hotel. A letter to the head office went unanswered. Probably a great hotel if nothing goes wrong but if something goes wrong, buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great LARGE suite to relax and still be close to everything”
Reviews.Author: MH19620
Reviews.Content: This hotel/suites has the best staff I have ever experienced in NYC. From the door person to the housekeeping staff, everyone was friendly. Your at East 39th, between 2nd and 3rd and an easy walk to most GREAT restaurants, a deli or two and great shopping. A bit longer walk and your in Times Square. Stay there, you will love the privacy, and the treatment you get. Hopefully you will get Joyce Mangal as your housekeeping staff person, she is extremely attentive and cares about her work.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family to stay NYC”
Reviews.Author: Karen1340
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a huge two bedroom, two bath suite. Two queen beds for the kids and a very comfortable king for us. Full sized kitchen and enormous living/dining room. Location was great. "Quieter" part of the city but a ten minute walk to Times Square. Decor is a little dated, but when you are traveling with kids, that is not a priority. Everyone on staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Internet was slow and they charged for a second computer. Bathrooms were small, but that was less of an issue because there were two. Played around with the check in date and got a rate of less than $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “like home”
Reviews.Author: danygarzas
Reviews.Content: Its like home, the people that work her are great, I stay 2 weeks and Joyce do my room, every day check, how i was. Great place...

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Valentine-Martin
Reviews.Content: I cannot praise the hotel enough. Great value for money, brilliant location, we stayed in a 2 bed 2 bath suite and it was HUGE for NYC standards. We began looking for accomodation for 2 of us in a double room in nice-ish hotels in NYC, this was working out at $2,000 for our trip. The Eastgate Tower did the suite for $1890. The suite could sleep 8 in total (this would be a bit cosy!!!). 2 large double beds in the guest room and one superkingsize bed in the master bedroom plus a sofa bed. There were 4 of us in our group and the suite was a perfect size. Cleaned everyday by housekeeping, beds made, clean towels. Good sized kitchen. All staff were helpful and pleasant. On checking out they ordered a town car to take us back to the airport which was cheaper than the NYC cab we took in to the city at the beginning of our trip. The decor is fine and tidy BUT not the greatest style, the rooms are not the prettiest but they are functional plus tvs in all rooms. The hotel doesn't have a bar or a restaurant but as there are so many places nearby this doesn't really matter. To sum up, for the money, location and size of the suites I think it has to be the best value in the area, we had a great time and will 100% be back, we have reccommended the hotel to 2 sets of friends who are going to book up.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, perfect for families on a budget”
Reviews.Author: lizalevine8
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my friend and our two daughters in a two bedroom, two bath, with large living room and adequate kitchen for outrageously inexpensive (internet deal) rate for NYC. Rooms were clean and totally acceptable. If you are coming to the city to see, shop, and do,(and not stay in the room) and don't need anything fancy, this is the perfect place. Only drawbacks: wifii and printing your boarding pass is not free, there is no breakfast included, and the lobby is not one where you would hang out. Our suite on the 21st floor was quiet because the location is oddly out of the way near the midtown tunnel, but not far from Grand Central. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone traveling in a group and on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, not fancy, but everything you'll need.”
Reviews.Author: marymich
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for our early March visit to Manhattan with my husband and I, teenage daughter and her friend. Got a two bedroom/two bath for less than most moderate standard hotel rooms with a special on their website. The living room was spacious and also included a sofa bed which we didn't use. Full kitchen, nice sized bedrooms and two small bathrooms. Walking distance to many restaurants and short walk to Grand Central. Bell service was good for storing luggage and arranging airport transport. Would not hesitate to visit again. Not the place if you want a swanky hotel with a big lobby/bar/restaurant, but great for families or budget travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal for families, but lost some sleep”
Reviews.Author: crozetvirginia
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 3 middle schoolers and booked the Jr. Suite on-line months beforehand and got a FANTASTIC deal for NYC especially because we would have needed 2 rooms at a regular room hotel. They upgraded us to a one bedroom (2 double beds) with a pull out couch upon check in. Check in was fast for us, although one person was having troubles who arrived at the same time. The room was on the 9th floor and we had a good view with the top of the empire state building. The room was HUGE and had tons of closet space and two bathrooms (1 full, 1 half) which was great in the morning. The staff was very kind to bring us extra pillows and blankets because there wasn't much on the beds. The full size fridge was great and we bought breakfast items and drinks and stored leftovers. The living room furniture was comfortable and the TV's both worked well. As others have said, it was clean but not fancy, but the housekeeping did a great job every day to bring clean towels and make the beds. Conciege quickly brought us misc. items we needed, like salt and a corkscrew. For the down sides: The appliances were extremely old, and since there was only 4-5 plates and cups, we hand washed regularly. Once we tried using the dishwasher but it was very loud and took forever, then everything came out dirtier than they went in. The biggest complaint which made us miserable was the loud window heaters. None of us slept well because every time they came on, it banged and rattled and scraped so loud that it woke us up. The heater in the bedroom didn't work well and seemed to not even come on when it should so I was up in the middle of the night several times trying to adjust it. My son was sleeping on the couch and he confessed that it scared him every time it came on, thinking someone was coming in the door. It really was LOUD! So, by the end of the trip we were all pretty grumpy, esp because we had long days walking in the cold. I didn't mention it to the staff because I assumed it was going to be the same building wide and that we may get used to it after the first night (we didn't). In summary, yes, it was a great deal and more than expected space for a family, and a helpful staff, but if you don't need the space, I would look for something newer.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan's hidden gem.....What an amazing find!”
Reviews.Author: odyssey_1977
Reviews.Content: I honestly can't praise Eastgate Towers highly enough. We stayed 5 days in early November 2010, and it exceeded our expectations on all counts. Things we loved: * HUGE, and (I mean REALLY BIG) room! We booked the Junior Suite and we had so much space it was just a shock! * Kitchen facilities: It was so fantastic to have a full-size fridge and all the kitchen supplies and utensils to be able to have breakfast in the room. Meant we could have breakfast in bed before getting out and about for the day. * Loads of closet space: Ample room to hang clothes, as well as store your suitcases and other bits and pieces * Bathroom: Was clean and functional, with a tub for soaking in after an exhausting day * COMFORTABLE BED!! It was a really great bed, we slept very well every night we were there. * Housekeeping: They did a great job and our place was spotless everyday when we cam home. Linens changed daily. *Coffee maker: The coffee machine was just fab, and we loved the Wolfgang Puk coffee that was generously replenished every day * Helpful staff: All the staff who we dealt with were extremely helpful and gracious. They went out of their way to assist us with all the questions we had, and provided us with great maps and other bits and pieces. *Location, LOCATION! I thought the hotels location was absolutely perfect. It was a 4 minute walk to Grand Central, from there we got to anywhere in NY that we wanted to go. We walked to many places too, such as Rockefeller Centre, Empire State and Times Square. *The best thing about Eastagte Tower is the price! We paid just on US$200/night booking about 6 months out and paying up-front with Expedia, so we got a great deal. Some things that could be improved: *I guess the rooms are dated and could use a refurb, but I dare say that such an excercise would lead to a significant rate rise, and would probably be out of my budget then. I know people mention the dated decor, but seriously, it is clean and in good repair, so who cares if the place is a bit daggy? *Hotel's restaurant has been closed now for quite some time. But, with so many dining choices in Manhattan, I probably would not have eaten there anyhow *The Wi-Fi in our room had a week signal unless I sat very close to the door. I believe we were on the 7th floor - it wasn't cheap either, so that was dissapointing. In summary, I absolutely recommend Eastgate Towers to anyone who wants a clean, comfortable, roomy place to stay in Midtown Manhattan, without having to rob a bank to pay for it! If you don't mind some 80's style decor, you will find that this hotel is an absolute gem. I will certainly stay here again when I return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: fotoastron
Reviews.Content: upon arrival to the hotel in the morning,the staff was very courtious in storing our baggage, until the room was ready, allowing us to start sight seeing immediately. Returning from an all day touring walk, the staff was extremely friendly and fast upon check in. The Junior Suite on the 16th fl. was great. It had a combination of warmth, coziness,cleanliness,quite spacious, and a good view. House keeping was daily, and very satisfying, with every thing very clean!!! The room was always warm, the small kitchen was very usefull, with every thing a kitchen needs to operate.And finally,within 50-100 yards , there is a Mcdonald's, Dunkin Donuts, Duane Reade,and a Chinese rest. just to name a few...... Overall, my stay there was great. No complaints at all. ( well, the price was a little pinched up) Enjoy your stay.....

Reviews.Title: “Not the room I reserved”
Reviews.Author: Ruthie1971
Reviews.Content: I reserved through the Affinia website. Shortly before I went there I saw a review on here that a guest wasn't given the two bed plus sofabed room they'd reserved. That's what I reserved for the five of us. I called to check. Yes, they had the room. When we got to the hotel fifteen minutes before check in they told us we'd have to put our bags in storage until check in time. For fifteen minutes? Well, the room wasn't going to be ready by check in time. They weren't sure when it would be. We went out for a couple of hours, came back, and were told that they had a room with one bed and a sofabed for us. I showed them my printed out reservation and confirmation. She told me yes, but they don't have to give you the room you reserve. She said they have very few of those rooms and even when I reserved it, it was never likely that I'd get it. But I paid for it! She kept insisting that they were doing me a favor not charging me for the roll away bed we were getting instead of a real double bed. The thing is, I reserved the two beds & sofabed because one of us had back surgery and needs to sleep on a real bed, alone. That left the other four of us to share what she was offering now - a roll away and a sofa bed. One of the kids ended up sleeping on couch cushions on the floor. So, no, I wouldn't recommend this hotel because apparently this is a pattern for them. Other than that the room was clean, dated, the heat was noisy.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept NYC Hotel Secret”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom92
Reviews.Content: I am almost reluctant to tell everyone about the Affinia Chain in NYC because they are so good... The suites are gigantic, the service is great, and best of all if you sign up for their email you can get specials like our current trip to NYC, $189 a night for a 2 bedroom suite which is easily sleeping all 7 of us in our family, kids ages 5-18. Any of the Affinias are good, we have stayed in Dumont, Shelburne, Eastgate and more. They are all wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for Manhatten but at a big cost!”
Reviews.Author: Nsw123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights during a holiday to New York. I chose it because it was more affordable than other hotels in Manhatten but I was soon to realise why! The hotel is located near the UN. It is about 3 blocks walk to Grand Central Station and about forty-five minutes walk from Time Square and all the tourist precincts. The whole hotel was in need of renovation and all the common areas and rooms were dingy. The restaurant was being renovated while I was there but this was not advertised in advance and meant that I had to go looking for breakfast every morning (The Frontier Grill on the next block proved quite good!) The rooms have a small kitchenette so it is possible to self cater if you are prepared but the facilities are dingy and so one doesn't feel inclined to prepare food and eat in. I also had trouble with very ancient and noisy air conditioning systems in the rooms which made it hard to sleep and to get the right temperature. The final straw, however, happened on my second night when I was woken at 4am by suspicious scrabbling in my suitcase. When I turned on the light, a brown mouse jumped out of my bags (he had been snacking on some nuts I had brought off the plane) and ran around the room. I called reception and asked them to come and deal with the situation but they didn't come until I rang again 20minutes later (apparently they went to the wrong room). When the night porter did arrive the mouse had vanished and he sat down and watched as I packed my own belongings in preparation for chaging rooms. Eventually at 5.30am I was transferred to another room (which proved to be a 2 bedroom suite). I must say that the Duty Manager was most apologetic when I spoke to him and I was allowed to keep the suite for the remainder of my stay at no extra charge. They also refunded the cost of the disturbed night so I appreciated their efforts to rectify the problem. All in all, I would not recommend this hotel until it has undergone a total refurbishment. It was not worth the cheaper rate to be so far from the main tourist attractions and in a place in need of a major makeover!

Reviews.Title: “well located and people very nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: abrao
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, people are very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean & great location!”
Reviews.Author: streetwise45678
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks a little dated from the outside but inside, the rooms are spacious and clean; as are the bathrooms. The location of the hotel is fantastic, just a 5 minute walk away from Grand Central Station which has access to the majority of destinations in New York. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel first for a bachelorette party in the summer of 2006. Overall, the place is very clean and the accomodations are good. We had an ample size room for 8 girls that even had a little kitchenette. It worked out perfrectly for hosting our soire. After a pleasant stay, I recently booked this hotel when I needed to stay in the city for a wedding. I called ahead of time to request early check-in. The hotel standard check-in time is 3pm and I was hoping for a 2pm check-in so that I could shower and get ready for the wedding, which was to take place at 3:30pm. I was told that early check-in could not be gauranteed, but that my request has been noted. I was also told that the hotel has a full locker room for their gym facility. Not wanting to go through the hassle of showering and getting ready for the wedding in a locker room, I called again a few days before my arrival and was told I would most likely not be able to get the hotel room early since the hotel was booked in full the night before. This made no sense to me considering check-out time is at noon and they had 3 hours to prepare rooms for 3pm check-in. Surely they could have one room available by 2pm for me? I arrived at the hotel a few hours early since my train got into the city that morning. Again I was fed the same story that I could not check-in early. When I inquired why, I got the same response about the hotel being booked in full the night before. I explained that I didn't understand how this worked and that it seemed unreasonable that my request of an hour early check-in could not be granted. Fortunately after going back and forth, the receptionist phoned their nearby, sister hotel land transferred me there without any problems or additional payments. Overall, the hotel is not bad, but if you have to check-in early, I'm sure you can find a better place! At least they were accomodating in sending me to their nice sister hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheJournalist28
Reviews.Content: Great reception, Excellent place to stay at. The location was not to bad, I did have noisy folks next door but overall I felt good at my stay. Clean Suite, very spacious I almost wanted to live there. Also Negesti was gracious and lovely helping me

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money”
Reviews.Author: shoreki
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Manhattan, you can not get better value for money! The only quibble: Internet in the room is priced too high!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: vaweddedbliss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Murray Hill - which was convenient to most of the sites we were seeing. They upgraded our room upon check-in to a junior suite. I'd heard how small NYC hotel rooms are - our room was huge by any cities standards. I can't believe the price for this great hotel. There were several great restaurants within walking distance. The service was prompt and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: MHC20854
Reviews.Content: You have to know what you're getting before you reserve to stay here. I've stayed here many times when on business and on vacation and it can't be beat. What it does not have: a lobby like the chain hotels, with stores and restaurants, and room service. The lobby is smaller than one of the rooms. If you are taking yourself/ kids/grandkids to NYC for the first time and want to walk out on Times Square or walk downstairs to the Grand Hyatt's huge brunch, this isn't the place. What it does have: HUGE rooms, all with kitchens and sofabeds; a location at 39th and 3rd, which is a 5-10 minute walk to Grand Central, where you catch the subway to anywhere you want to go. The rooms are clean, the cable TV works fine, for "room service" you get menus from nearby restaurants that will deliver, the staff is friendly and helpful, and did I mention that the rooms are HUGE. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinarily honest and helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nitebird222
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night with my husband who was having surgery in the neighborhood the next morning. In the rush to leave in the morning, and with my mind on him and not me, I somehow left my diamond engagement ring in the room. I have worn this ring virtually every day for 36 years, and didn't even notice I didn't have it on until we were home later that evening. I had no idea where the ring was and called the hotel not knowing if I had even left it there. To my great pleasure, Yvrose, the Executive Housekeeper, immediately told me she had the ring. The housekeeper who cleaned the room, Elizabeth, had promptly turned it in and the ring was placed in the hotel safe. Since they couldn't know for sure which guest left it in the room they waited for the guest to call. Yvrose couldn't have been more helpful in arranging the return of the ring via Fedex. This was arranged on Saturday morning (I discovered the ring missing late Friday night), and since the safe was locked until Monday she had to arrange for the return of the ring in her absence, since as luck would have it she would not be in the following week. I subsequently spoke to Carol who confirmed the return of the ring, and called me the next day to make sure I received it. The hotel is a great find if you don't need a fancy lobby and all the trimmings. It is in a lovely convenient neighborhood and all the staff people we encountered were extremely pleasant and helpful. They upgraded us to a larger suite when we checked in (we really couldn't have cared less so it was a pleasant surprise). While the rooms are a bit dated, they are huge and comfortable. I will say the bathroom was small, which didn't concern me since it was fine for our purposes. The small galley kitchen had a large refrigerator, sink, stove and microwave, as well as some kitchen supplies. For a family it would be perfect, and for anyone visiting friends who doesn't care about hotel trimmings it is a hidden treasure. The building obviously is a converted apartment building so the rooms are truly enormous, especially for the price we paid (we booked directly on the hotel's website). And as you can tell I cannot say enough about how wonderful and helpful the staff was. I will always recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York. The price was also extremely reasonable (around $125 including tax) which is extraordinary for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Ellen034
Reviews.Content: Negesti & Donna at the front desk was most helpful with suggestions to see attractions.Friendly staff. Big rooms for New York City includes kitchenette. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Warmly welcoming in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mc362
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Dec 3rd and received a warm welcome from the outset. The lobby is tiny and soon fills up. The location was great - everything was within walking distance - Grand Central, Times Square, the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, etc - but the hotel itself was in a quiet district which felt very safe. Lots of traffic during the day but fine at night. As some of the other reviews indicate, it's not in the first flush of youth, and it shows in the general wear and tear in some areas: our first room was very disappointing, a 5th floor, small room looking onto the side of a building, with worn (rusting in places) bathroom shelving/cupboards and tiny kitchenette, also worn fittings. I felt a bit let-down, especially as I had emailed the hotel beforehand requesting a room with a view as it was our silver wedding anniversary trip! On our way out the lovely receptionist asked if we were happy and we told her the truth - she immediately started checking it out, apologising and promising to sort it out next day as the hotel was full that night. The duty manager sorted us out next day and moved us to a lovely big room on the 25th floor (I know -appropriate or what!) with a fabulous "New York" view - including the top of the Empire State!! Great value, and the staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. There's no restaurant but plenty of good places to eat out for breakfast, and you can order in from nearby places at all hours if you wish. Or you can cook in the room as all rooms have their own kitchen with cooker, microwave, kettle etc., great for tea or coffee between trips out. The staff, location and the "New York" view from our second room made our visit enjoyable: I liked the idea of staying in a converted apartment building, but ask for the upper floors if possible. Loved New York, especially at Christmas time!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: Caitlyn_PERTH_88
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I stayed here for Thanksgiving, we had never been to New York/America before but were told that all Hotel rooms were TINY so we were a bit nervous but when we arrive we were very happy with the amount of room there was and the location was great! We could walk to Grand Central, Times Square, Empire State with walking times of 5 - 20 mins... We also had no problem with noise, we were on the 7th floor. We plan on going back next year for Christmas and will not hesitate to re-book.

Reviews.Title: “Room Rip Off !!”
Reviews.Author: DDHerbie
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here quite number of times now over the years, and have usually had a good service. However, big mistake to stay here over thanksgiving and arrive on a late flight on the wedensday.. means you are left with the rubbish rooms. We booked a 1 bed suite, and paid extra for 2 double beds (even through I also had a free room upgrate, wifi and paper (business freebie) wanted to take no chances. On arrival was told there was no upgrades as the hotel was full. Our room only had 1 double bed and even though I told them and showed the reciept for the extra payment for the 2 double beds room, was advised that they had all gone, we would have to wait until the friday to move to a room with 2 beds. he also advised that the living room had a sofa that doubled up as a bed and that was the second double bed... I advised that this was not the case, I have stayed here many many times, and that they do in fact have rooms with 2 double beds.. he did eventual admit that this was the case, but that he still did not have any rooms to move us to and we would have to make do with the pull down sofa bed. When we got to the room found that there was no bed linen on the sofa, nothing had been made up and had to call down again to get linen. Overall the hotel is a good location, and rooms are a decent size, however it is now becoming very scruffy and dirty. The electrics did not work in the room, the toilet overflowed and the TV sound would not work properly... probably because we were in a room that was not used very much... NOT A GOOD WAY TO TREAT YOUR guests that stay at your hotel often !!!!... not any more... will find somewhere else this year !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: knorman0929
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great. The location was close to everything yet, away from the hustle and business of the city. It was safe, somewhat quiet and the rooms were spacious enough for three adults and our Shih Tzu dog to stay comfortably. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful. We were there Christmas during the Great Blizzard of 2010 and experience no problems. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Penny164
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been recommended to us by a friend and we were not dissappointed. The room was quiet , clean and spacious.The kitchen was well equipped with all the utensils you would need for Breakfast , lunch or dimmer perparation. So nice to have the choice .The staff were very freindly,pleasant, and hepful -- could not have done enogh for us . The furniture in the room was older but it was very clean and functional -- but the bed was so comfortable!!-- what more do you want in New york City after walking all day !! Last thing, -- it is only three blocks from Grand Central Station !!!PERFECT !!! B&P from Victoria B.C.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: redhead1942
Reviews.Content: The hotel as wonderful for the value. Staff (Negesti and the others) were very helpful.We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath and aside from a lack of decorations it could not have been better. Clean and very comfortable. Supermarket a block away, plenty of fast food restaurants. Doorman got us cabs and cars to airport. If you use a Car service get Juan Rodriguez, 631-512-2181 reasonable and fair. I would and have recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: oztravellers1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Eastgate. The apartments are not new but clean and comfortable and perfect for those looking to save a few dollars in expensive New York. The beds and pillows are comfortable and bathrooms roomy. With a supermarket around the corner it was easy to prepare a meal or go out to a variety of restaurants nearby. The apartments are very spacious and the location excellent for walking to most sights or hopping on the metro.The staff were friendly and helpful. The guest laundry is also handy. For those looking for luxury then this is not the place but we and two other groups of friends have now stayed here and we would all happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: bussjoh1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Eastgateback in June, i just wanted to leave a note to say if you're looking for somewhere thats reasonably priced, very comfortable and clean then stay here, its a 15 min walk from Times Sq and nicely set back, we absolutely loved it the bed was so comfy :) excellent value, couldnt believe how big the room was!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tnightgirl
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at upper end hotels and this time due to circumstances and needs I chose this hotel. It is located in a great location and the rooms were amazingly clean. While there, I became suddenly ill and the hotel staff, Donna and Yvrose, treated me as I would have been treated with care in a doctors office. I was so fearful of what was happening and regardless of the fact the hotel was sold out with guests on the way, (i was checking out), they comforted me until I felt better and regained energy to leave! This is the kind of hospitality anyone should receive at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: louisedetorres
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent. The room was spacious with just enough of a kitchen we used for breakfast and bringing home leftovers of the excellent meals we had in New York. We could see the Empire State Building outside our window and Grand Central Station was just a couple of blocks away. Rooms were really clean and bed was comfortable. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: djc2010
Reviews.Content: Staying here for a NYC vacation Dec 2010. Got a suite with a separate bedroom which is working out great with two small kids. Great location - very close to Grand Central. Lobby is a bit cramped and seems like it's always busy. Great staff - very helpful and nice - highly recommend. We will be staying here for all our future trips!

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: MrsHavenCumbria
Reviews.Content: Was a little worried about reviews prior to travelling but some of them were a little unfair although I would agree it could do with a little updating. The hotel is well situated but unfortunately the restaurant was closed during our stay. The room served its purpose as we were out for most of the day, was always warm and the bed was clean and comfortable. Can reccommend Scottys Diner for breakfast and Murphys bar to finish off the evening.

Reviews.Title: “excellent for indication”
Reviews.Author: drmanoel
Reviews.Content: I`d like to congratulate Joyce`s attention to my family and the care of my room. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: machadojr
Reviews.Content: Well located, big rooms, kitchen, helpful staff (Ms.Negesti is one of them). It was not the first time I stayed at the Eastgate Towerand certainly not the last. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Top Central-Top Treatment-TopService”
Reviews.Author: osschuetze
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay for 6 Nights at Eastgate Tower!!! Stuff very friendly and helpful!!! Very central in Manhattan, everything around the Hotel!!! The Hotel must be renovate,than it will get the 4th star for us!!! Nice Christmas decoration, but only inside!!! We come again, be sure!!! Thanks for all !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: HolidayReviews1980
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here with our two friends at the start of December 2010 and found it to be everything we had hoped for. It is just a short walk from Grand Central Station which means getting around to see all the sights is very easy. We were upgraded for free (both rooms) as there was space, without even having to ask. The room was very large, the beds were very comfortable and the room was always kept very clean. Despite the busy location it was very quiet at night and the staff always seemed very helpful, from getting us take away menu's to lending us scissors! Broadband was a little slow (and quite expensive) but nevertheless it was sufficient for all we needed. Yes the decor is slightly dated but it was perfectly adequate and for the price we paid you could not expect 5 star decor! There was plenty of draw and wardrobe space, and all the little extras that you don't always get (hairdryer, iron and ironing board, coffee maker). It was really everything that we needed for our short trip (4 days) and I would reccommend this hotel to everyone, and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money.”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoLover64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eastgate Tower (2 bedroom/2bath) with extended family (parents, children & sister) for Thanksgiving 2010. The hotel location was wonderful. We took a shuttle from LaGuardia airport to Grand Central Station and walked the remaining 4 blocks. There is a small grocery store 2 blocks away from the hotel. You can catch subways at Grand Central or buses along 3rd. The area felt safe for walking around. The hotel entrance is very small, but the rooms were quite roomy. We saved money by eating breakfast at the hotel every morning and occasionally dinner. The hotel rooms were dated, but very clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, no frills hotel. I will stay there again if I make it back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “basic needs satisfied”
Reviews.Author: funfamily4NewJersey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is part residential/part hotel. It is in midtown and a "short walk" from most attractions. The hotel itself needs some serious updating-wall paper peeling, curtains didn't fully cover windows, bathroom dated. Our suite was really a two bed hotel room with a kitchen-small fridge and microwave.The beds were comfortable and the tv worked. We spent two nights. If you're going to NYC you don't need spend alot of time in the hotel. For the price it was a good deal but wouldn't go back unless it was cleaned up.

Reviews.Title: “This is A Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: dat2974
Reviews.Content: We were going to be in the city for 3+ days and wanted a room that was on the larger side but did not want to shell out meagabucks. This place is a rehabbed apt building that has larger rooms and was very quiet as well. Manuel at the front desk was exceptional in giving directions, advise on dining and getting extra towels for the family. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibely helpful stuff!”
Reviews.Author: MCB2209
Reviews.Content: The most friendly and helpful staff one could imagine in a hotel. Why? Our flight out of New York was at 6:00 am from La Guardia. Although we haven't booked a room for this last night, we could spend the night in the hotel, including the key to the gym where we could take a shower (towels provided by the staff) and resting for some hours in the hotel lobby. We did not expect this at all! Thanks!!!! Would chose no other hotel, great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for money in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Buffy41
Reviews.Content: Though the rooms are a little dated (understand there is a refubishment planned), the Hotel is in a great location - walking distance to everything but in a quiet location. The rooms are spacious and clean. Would stay here again when in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Another good visit”
Reviews.Author: forgotmypword
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Eastgate this year. In the spring I travelled with my husband and 2 children and stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. This time I travelled with an 11yo daughter and stayed in a Junior Studio Suite. Once again, I found the staff at the Eastgate to be proffessional, courteous and efficient. The room was large and clean, but as mentioned in almost all reviews, it is old and dated. The beds seem new and are made up in lots of white linens and are quite comfortable. I didn't do any cooking, nor did I have any desire to cook ... , but did use dishes, because we got takeout. I was surprised that there was only one pot and no pans in the kitchen. Although, if I had actually needed them I would have called housekeeping and asked. The kitchen I had in the spring was better equipped, but perhaps in the larger units people actually cook more. (But not me!) This room had a door that could be unlocked and opened to connect it to the room next door. It was secure but because of that door, sound from the next unit seemed to travel, and it just wasn't as quiet as during my first visit. Nonetheless, it worked fine for us. I was disappointed to see that the Frontier Diner on the corner of 39th and 3rd closed, but we were content with bagels from Daniel's and Scotty's on 39th and Lex is good for a sit-down breakfast. I enjoy getting out first thing in the morning and am not bothered by lack of breakfast in the hotel. If I really wanted it, I'd stock in cereal and fruit from D'Agostino's grocery on 3rd. If you are looking for an upscale fancy hotel, this isn't it. If you are bothered by mirrors that have gone dark at the corners and visible cables inside your closets, then stay away. But, if you are looking for a clean, spacious place to stay (with kitchen) at a reasonable price, then you really cannot go wrong with the Eastgate Towers.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing, do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: samantha197238
Reviews.Content: had 2 bed apartment. travelling with my husband, dad and 6 year old son. staff seemed friendly enough and lobby was modern looking. that all changed when we got out of lift. was a big apartment but had no kettle for 3 days (after asking many times). kept moaning about lack of bowls, knives etc but then advised to check dishwasher (never emptied before our arrival). not well equipped kitchen at all. very dated decor and furniture. wall paper tearing at various parts in apartment. mould on bathroom ceiling. very noisy apartment and dirty carpets (wore slippers and soles were black at end of stay). electric sockets in kitchen were very dodgy, almost pulled one out of the wall when pulling toaster out of socket, not good when you are travelling with a 6 year old!! asked at reception within 20 minutes of being there to change apartments but only had another 2 bed apartment exactly the same or a one bed apartment with sofabed (not suitable for 4 of us). was told the hotel ownes 5 other hotels in manhattan but not offered another location, was told if i wanted to get 2 smaller apartments had to pay. hotel cost over £2000 for 6 nights. would not say good value for money at all. stayed in a 2 bed apartment 5 years ago in manhattan(and much better location), paid over twice as much this time and feel totally ripped off and disappointed. do not stay here!! wish i did take photos of apartment, there are some bad pictures on the web of this hotel and i did see them after i booked this place. my fears were confirmed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quality for equally fantastic price”
Reviews.Author: ConnorParker
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Eastgate Tower Hotel was a fantastic experience. With a fantastic central location, spacious rooms and unbeatable prices, the Eastgate Tower Hotel is not to be looked over. The staff were friendly and performed quality work, and my overall experience was fantastic. I think I've found Manhattan's hidden treasure of a hotel in the Eastgate Tower, and I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to New York. Thankyou for the excellent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value! Very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: JLKWolf
Reviews.Content: The Eastgate Tower was recommended to us by a friend and I'm so glad we took his advise. We had a great experience from the moment we arrived. The check-in was easy and quick and we received a room upgrade without asking. Our room was not fancy but it was spotlessly clean and big (two bathrooms). The furnishings were functional and comfortable. It was great to have a kitchen; this saved us time and money on coffee and breakfast each morning. Also, the hotel is in a nice, quiet neighborhood The staff was very knowledgable about the area and answered all of our questions about New York. The only downside was no free internet access. We hope to be back to New York soon and we'll be staying at the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here with girlfriend at the end of...”
Reviews.Author: Si3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with girlfriend at the end of September. We only due to a Thomas Cook cock up. Anyway the hotel is in a great location, only a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station. This is handy as this is where the Newark Airport Express coach drop off/pick up is. The hotel as stated in previous reviews is a bit tired but our room was spotlessly clean when we arrived. We also had a junior suite which was massive and had one comfiest beds I have ever slept in. It was also great having the use of a full kitchen in the room. All in all The hotel was a great place to stay whilst in New York and would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & value!”
Reviews.Author: HockeysMum
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by friends, and we were not disappointed. Location: We were visting NYC on a vacation. Location was very important to us to get around the city. We used the subway and walked, a lot!. The EGTH is about a 10 min. walk from Grand Central station. This is a hub for the NYC subway system, allowing you to travel east & west (line 7); north & south (lines 4, 5, 6). We conveniently walked to the following sites- NYC Public Library (15 min); Empire State Bldg (20 min); United Nations (5 mins). There were a few nice restaurants nearby, but not a ton of selection. Amenities: The hotel at one time was an apartment bldg, so each suite is spacious (not your typical tiny NYC hotel room). Each has a kitchen too, which was very handy for light meals. We were anxious to get going on our sightseeing, so it was great to grab breakfast as we got ready in the mornings. We didn't waste time sitting in a restaurant for breakfast, when there's so much to do in NYC! There are 2 grocery stores nearby to buy food for your stay. Just like many reviewers have already commented the furnishings in the room are dated, but they were clean and the beds were super comfortable- just what we needed after a long day of siteseeing! I should mentioned that the bathrooms were spotless- I'm a bit of a neat-niq so I can spot dirt from quite a distance, and this room fully met my picky standards. Value: What deal this hotel is for comfort, cleanliness & location! We booked months in advance on the hotel's website and booked one of their "special" rates that were being offered at the time- this was a great deal for a one bedroom suite (2 adults & 2 teenagers). What a pleasant surprise upon check-in to be upgraded to a 2 bedroom (& 2 bathrooms) suite. It was fantastic to have that second bathroom (my daughter could occupy it solely each morning without causing a family feud!). Service: Because we were so focused on siteseeing, we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel. But the few interactions we did have with the hotel staff, were pleasant. One thing I did like, was that before I left for our trip, I checked tripadvisor reviews periodically. I liked that the hotel manager took the time to respond to most reviews, whether positive or negative. This suggests to me that he takes pride in his hotel and strives to respond to the needs of his guests. It you're looking for a luxury high end hotel, this probably isn't the hotel for you. But if you're looking for a well situated, clean hotel that's reasonably priced- I would highly recommend the Eastgate Tower Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: Flufhead88
Reviews.Content: This place was a complete dump! The staff was extremely unhelpful and when we got up to our two suites it looked like a train wreck. Everything was dirty and outdated. There was a 6 inch roach on the bathroom floor and a used razor right next to it. It was so gross that we called every other hotel in Manhattan but due to a major conference in town was unable to get a room. We literally almost paid 1300 to go over to the Ritz that is how bad it was. Then to top it off, when we got our car back from the valet the entire right rear quarter panel was dented in and smashed. This place is a complete joke and should be burned to the ground. I would never ever ever stay in this place again. I would rather sleep on a bench in central park then to step foot in this dump again. If you google the word "DUMP" this place would come up.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were huge!”
Reviews.Author: Rudas
Reviews.Content: Big rooms are hard to find in NYC so I was grateful to come upon this hotel. The kitchenette was super helpful to have...made breakfast easy and affordable. The bathrooms are small and the decor is slightly worn...a little outdated, but the place was really clean and well equipped. The location was great...lots of shopping/restaurants on both 2nd and 3rd avenues, easy access to the subway and buses. It felt very safe and the staff was friendly and helpful. Great place to stay, great value. Would be a perfect choice with kids because of all the space and kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “The price is right”
Reviews.Author: cs481
Reviews.Content: Our stay was positive overall. Nice rooms and walking distance to most things. Room could use some upgrades but for the price you can't complain. Stores very near by as well. Booked hotel over 3 months in advance and asked for a high lvl room. but when we arrived we were given only a room on the 3rd floor. Unacceptable seeing as how i booked months and months in advance because of this one request. Other then that our stay was good. Don't expect a 5 star hotel and Eastgate will serve you well

Reviews.Title: “Eastgate came up trumps again!”
Reviews.Author: alwaystired222
Reviews.Content: our last trip was a bit niggly but was promised an upgrade on next stay and the eastgate delivered and we are spoiled! thanks to Deborah. location of hotel is amazing the hotel in need of a bit of a decor update but our suite was spotless and no bedbugs! see you next year! should have free internet access though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nkulergs
Reviews.Content: The Hotel's location is great. Right in the middle of mid-town manhattan easily reachable from anywhere. Rooms are a bit run down but the junior suite is huge esspecially by New York standards. The staff is very indefferent. I had booked the hotel from their own site and then I saw that booking.com had a better offer. I wrote to the hotel because of their best rate guarantee and noone answered. When I checked in the clerk at the front desk didn't know anything and when I checked out they asked me why I hadn't used my 50 dollars worth of complimentary amenities. I told them "Because this is the first I heard about it" Turns out they accepted my complaint bumped me up to a junior suite and credited me with 50 dollars worth of amenities but didn't mention any of this to me. I suspected the room was a little too large for a normal hotel room :) Well it wasn't a big deal since I really wasn't going to spend my time in NY ordering movies in my hotel room but the service should be better.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: shoppingfan_10
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Eastgate Towers for three weeks. The accommodation is affordable, comfortable and clean. The staff friendly and professional. The location is quiet but close to all the amenities. Recommended highly particularly for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great as a base”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSara
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a group of friends so it was ideal for 5 people. It is very close to grand central station and has lots of nearby places to get food and drinks. The apartment was not the most pretty and could do with a re-paint and new bathrooms, for the price we paid did expect it to be in better condition. However if you are looking for a place to just sleep in this is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Best self service apartments I ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: iloveparis59
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff at the reception who told us what floor we were on and answered all our questions! Our room was massive and the beds were so comfy. We went out for the day and when we came back we remembered we had forgotten to ask about bedding for the sofa bed. We rang reception and they quickly brought up some. The kitchenette was a great bonus and so was the free use of a computer at reception.The location was brilliant, central Manhattan and a 5 minute walk from Grand Central Station did it for us as we only used public transport during our stay in New York. It was very well priced and there was a big difference in price compared to the first place we stayed in. The porter, Patrick was Irish too, he was really nice and we had some connections with him, its a small world! Although we stayed here because the other hotel was booked up for the 4th of July we preferred the room and service we got here! Amazing experience, would definitely return! By the way, we stayed in the Affinia apartment block but it's all run by the same people!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, not really friendly or helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: FrankGeneva
Reviews.Content: The hotel has indeed a very good location, which makes it easier to go everywhere in New York City, rooms are really big and it is cheap compared to other 3 star hotels in Manhattan. However, the place needs renovation urgently. Moreover, the staff could be more friendly and helpful. My key card failed to work for 3 or 4 times and I never heard any apoligies; and when I checked out, the woman at the reception didn't even ask if I needed a cab.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clarisiza
Reviews.Content: went to NY with my husband to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and we both were very positively surprise by this hotel. it used to be an apartment block, so rooms are very spacious and have a kitchen with everything you can possibly need, which was very handy for breakfast and for a quick dinner after a all day sighseeing. room and bathroom was spotlessly clean and very quiet,so we able to sleep without problems. Hotel is in a very beautiful residential area but close to everything (walking distance to time square).i would reccomend this hotel to anybody with children as well. A little gem to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location and good price”
Reviews.Author: MaaikeSteven
Reviews.Content: We went to visit NYC this summer and stayed in the Eastgate Tower Hotel for one week. NYC can be really expensive, but this hotel wasn't. Its located on 39th street, which makes it a great location. Only a few blocks away from Central Station and Bryant Park and like a 10 minutes walk from Times Square. The rooms are really big and there's everything you need. There's a little kitchen and a table with chairs. It's really a lot of space for such a low price in the middle of Manhattan. The staff was really friendly and helpfull. The only thing less good I can think of is that you have to pay for wifi. It's not that expensive, but most of the hotels nowadays have free wifi, so it should be nice to include this in the price. But even then, still a great place and I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and still pleased!”
Reviews.Author: NSutton1103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Eastgate Tower in 2007 for the first time and found it to be the best location, comfortable, clean and very reasonably priced. So when we were planning our next visit, this was the only choice for us. The way to describe it is," it's like having your own apartment in NYC." Full kitchenette, decent sized bathroom, comfortable bed and dining table and chairs for nights that we ordered take-out. Location is perfect (only 3 blocks to Grand Central Station and a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square) There are several restaurants near the hotel and a handy convenient store/corner shop that sells everything under the sun! Service in the hotel was once again friendly and professional. A note for housekeeping: please pay attention to lampshades and light bulbs when dusting... ours seemed neglected for awhile. The only thing letting this hotel down from being a 4 star is the need for an update and the outdoor area, where the restaurant used to be. (This sadly has turned into a "free for all" hangout for the city of NY and some undesirables). I think the management should seriously do something about this, otherwise, it could deter future customers. We hope that this hotel survives and improves, so that we can enjoy another visit in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “not impressive”
Reviews.Author: skhemka74
Reviews.Content: its like a extended stay america. the rooms are quite the same. view is nothing to write home about. too expensive for what it offers

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Jog-Aub
Reviews.Content: We were two adults and four teenagers. We had a two bedroom suite with two bathrooms and a kitchenette. One room had a king bed, the other room had two double beds plus there was a sofa-bed in the living-room. It was very spacious and quiet. The personnel was very friendly too. It cost me less than if I rented a regular room in another hotel and we would have been squeezed quite a bit. Yes, the rooms are aging a bit and would benefit of some renovation but, bottom line, it's a great value. We will stay there again when we come back to New-York city again. There was no free Wi-Fi although we tend to expect it standard these days. You had to pay to get it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rball300
Reviews.Content: 5 adults, age range 18 - 80 stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms, kitchen, living room, dining area. We paid less than $400 per night! We didn't have to squish into 2 adjoining rooms, we had an apartment. It was an amazing amount of space for the price. The accommodations were perfect for traveling with a big party (repeat 2 bathrooms!) Staff was helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: rococo2010
Reviews.Content: Do Not Stay Here if you want a CLEAN room. The room/suite I stayed in was disgusting. There is a difference between an outdated hotel, and a dirty hotel, and this was both. The hallway was creepy and smelled bad. Behind the dresser was some sort of shirt/pillowcase/crumpled white cloth, with a dirty q-tip on next to it. So obviously, housekeeping does not do much cleaning. The next morning I discovered the tub did not drain when I showered, and the shower curtain was pink with bacteria at the bottom. So I had a 60 second shower before I had to leave for work. Some of the towels looked like they had some sort of bug dropping on them. I had checked all the beds for bedbugs/bedbug droppings etc when I first entered the room, and found nothing. Though, when I woke up a dropping like the ones found on the towels was discovered on the bed. Gross. There was a kitchen area– and between the stove and counter was filled with food, grime and disgustingness that looked liked it had been accumulating for months. On the counter near that was some sort of droppings, bug or mouse, I don't know, in a line and then several in the corner area. Roaches? Carpet was gross and coming up from the wall. Walls dirty. Lights dingy. Also, less important but the tv let off a loud screeching noise when it was on. The person at the front desk when I first checked in was nice. In the end, I'm glad that I had actually kept my suitcase in a large trash bag tied up and on the table because I don't want whatever was crapping on things in my home. I can't believe I stayed here the one night that I did. Really a terrible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Needs Update”
Reviews.Author: Texasfamily98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eastgate Tower for a family visit to NYC in June. Our flights had been delayed so we arrived into NYC after midnight on a Saturday night (June 19). Our first impression of the hotel was not good. The place looked like a bordello - seemed a number of hookers were walking around and there also seemed to be bouncers, etc. The manager behind the desk was nice enough and provided us with a nice room. The next day the hotel looked much different - with families, bellman, conceriege,etc... all in place and looking the part. The next 4 days we stayed we didn't notice anything unusual and the hotel seemed in a nice location with families and businesspeople using the facility. The room itself was in need of an update - but we were pleased with the cleanliness. The design could be updated as well - we actually had a very spacious living room, a decent sized bedroom with 2 double beds - and a small kitchen. The bathroom was the disappointing part - very small, with only one sink which made getting ready to go out on the town more challenging with 2 teenage daughters.. Overall, we were pleased for the price and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Eastgate Tower Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa R
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. It was cheap, it was roomy, and it was in a great location. It was about a 5-10 minute walk from Grand Central Terminal. When I got into the room, I expected it to be much smaller for what I was paying, but it was amazing! There was SO much room, we had a king sized bed and a kitchenette! The bathroom was spotless, as well as the room itself. My room was on the seventh floor. The hotel staff didn't seem that amazing, but we didn't really need them for much, so it didn't matter. They weren't too unpleasant. All in all, a pretty decent hotel for a stay in New York City. I would revisit this place.

Reviews.Title: “After a bit of dismay upon arrival, grew to love this place”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1958
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 2 adults, 6 teenagers and thought the 2 bedroom suite (with 2 bathrooms!) would work great for us......boy was I right! Upon arrival, I must say I was a little taken back by the tiredness of the room and the odd odor in one of the rooms (poopy diaper), wasnt quite what I've become accustomed to while staying in NYC. In fact, after one teen took a shower the first night we were there, the next morning the tub still hadnt drained and I had to take a shower in ankle deep water. 2nd bathroom, same thing, didnt drain completely after the first person's shower. However, as we were preparing to leave the hotel for the day, I mentioned to the maid in the hallway that both showers were clogged, no exaggeration, maintenance was at our room before our entire party could get out into the hall to wait for the elevator!. I fully expected we would be dealing with tub draining issues our entire stay, I was wrong, never had a problem again. On another evening, one of the kids unwittingly locked the bathroom door as he exited, we called downstairs to get maintenance to come up and unlock it, and no kidding, he was there within 5 minutes!! I also highly commend the maids, they were accomodating on the days we let the kids sleep in, they would come late in the afternoon to clean the rooms. And they made the suite look as though no one was occupying it, everything was picked up, beds made, abundant clean towels, vacuumed, kitchen was spotless, they were great, cant say enough good things about the maintenance and maid staff! Any negative impression I had at our arrival about this hotel was eliminated by the wonderful staff and roominess of the room for the eight of us. We never got in each others way, this suite was perfect for us. I couldnt come close in price if I'd had to reserve two rooms at another hotel. Pricing for our 2 bedroom suite was more than fair ($270 per night). If you're traveling with kids or a large group, this suite is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Homebase in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: TeacherandDad
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Eastgate Tower. We had a roomy one bedroom suite (2 bathrooms) on the 25th floor with windows facing Midtown - always an interesting view. The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Though the furniture and carpeting were a little worn, the linens were of very high quality. There are several groceries within two blocks, so it was easy to pick up food tems for the fully equiped kitchenette - which was especially great for breakfasts. It is about a ten minute 4-5 block walk to Grand Central station. We found it easy to make at least two seperate city excursions per day by subway from there (we do a lot of walking when we travel so it is always nice to be able to conveniently stop back at our room for a little rest and freshening up between ventures). Most of the guests we encountered in the hotel were European families. The reasonably priced suites are excellent for several days of family travel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious yes, but not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: thicks12559
Reviews.Content: My group of 5 ladies stayed at this hotel for 6 nights while on a mission trip. Several weeks ago I spoke to the accounting department to arrange for our tax exempt status. At check-in, I provided exactly what I was told to bring but was told that their policy had changed and that we would have to obtain a direct bill account in order to be tax exempt. Before I finally got it straightened out (day of checkout), I was told 4 different stories. Additionally, on the Affinia website, under the Bells and Whistles section, it lists some really awesome amenities. At check-in, we were told that this hotel wasn't affiliated with Affinia and these amenities weren't available! The website is VERY misleading. Our 1 bdrm suite was spacious, but the furnishings were old, worn and dated. I might stay there again because of the size of the suite, but would know not to expect much else.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: DJinconcord
Reviews.Content: Three of us had a 2-bed, 2-bath suite at the Eastgate for four nights. We got the promotional price for $239/night. Our stay was very comfortable, the suite was clean and spacious, the beds and linens were excellent. It was great to have a full-size apartment instead of a cramped New York hotel room. The bathrooms are small, but there were two full baths. The location in midtown east, away from the crowds and grit of Times Square and Penn Station, was pleasant and convenient. Parking garage ($35/day - typical for NYC) is adjacent to the front entrance. Grand Central is a short walk for the subway and the excellent food emporium - try Zocalo. There are good supermarkets and restaurants around the corner. Hailing a cab was always easy. The area - Murray Hill - is safe and a nice mix of commercial areas and charming, old residential side streets. This is not a luxury hotel, and there were a few minor glitches. We arrived a little early, and the room wasn't ready until after 3pm, which is their check-in time. The staff was friendly and accommodating about storing our luggage while we went for lunch, replacing a non-functional iron, etc. The air conditioner in one bedroom was temperamental. The furniture is a little worn out, but basically in good condition, and everything is clean. The suite was clean, quiet, and private. We were on the 10th floor with good light and city views, and not much traffic noise at all. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for a small group or family. If they did a lot of upgrading and remodeling, they would have to raise the prices. I think they are doing a good job of maintaining a nice facility and keeping prices reasonable - for New York. Look for a promotional price directly through their website.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: imalreadyhome
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights in a Junior Suite. Rooms were spacious and clean. Decor was a little tired looking but for a place to crash in NYC - it was extremely good value. Wireless internet was a little expensive at $50 for the week. Check out took a while too - the reception area was small so we were in line for 30 minutes which can be a bit frustrating. There are only 2 lifts for guests to use and with that many rooms - it can take a while for the lift to arrive. But I'm willing to look over that if we had a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...what a bargain”
Reviews.Author: grandkidsfun
Reviews.Content: We had a corner 2 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms and kitchenette. Rooms were clean, linens fresh, and the rooms large. It was nice to have a separate kitchenette with a full size refrigerator and dining area. It was very convenient to pick up cheeses and wine from the numerous markets and have down time snacks and bagels for breakfast from the near by deli. The price was reasonable. The furnishings contemporary and to have a separate area from the kids was great. The staff was helpful and responsive. The location was good...appoximately 6 blocks to Grand Central Station and 8 -9 blocks from Time Square with lots to see in between. I would definetly go back to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice value hotel”
Reviews.Author: arandygail
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Eastgate Tower was very nice. The rooms are huge and there is a nice kitchen with a full-sized refrigerator, stove, microwave, toaster, dishes, etc. It is within 3 blocks of Grand Central, so it was just a subway ride away from anything we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT START TO OUR HONEYMOON”
Reviews.Author: Bdagal
Reviews.Content: My first stay at Eastgate was in late Apil this year as the first leg of our honeymoon. We loved the spacious room and the fact that it had a kitchen with a ridge to keep our wine chilled. The area around the hote is quiet, there is no hustle and bustle and you don't hear a lot of honkng of car horns. We rode back to the airport in a black GMC jeep which was comparable in price of a taxi but much more comfortable. Not sure if they are affiliated wit the hotel but the doorman secured it for us. I'm coming back at the end of July wih my son this time.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in town was a 10 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: eaw449
Reviews.Content: Went to New York City with my sister and our teenage granddaughters and met up with other family members staying at Eastgate. I would like to add this is my 4th trip to NYC so I'm not a novice. The staff was more than friendly and helpful. My sister, me and the girls stayed in the Junior suite. The rooms was very spacious and large enough to entertain the other members of our family after "hitting the pavement" of the city. Close enough to Grand Central to easily catch subways or if you are energetic walk to Time Square. Also little deli's and grocery stores nearby. Saved money on breakfast, snacks and on some lunches. Best bang for my buck that I ever had staying in New York. Clean, decent location, friendly staff, and lots of space what more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, great price, but getting a bit tired!”
Reviews.Author: UK_Hockey_fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite, with a separate living / dining room, and a small kitchen for $259 + taxes. As others have said, the decor is tired, and the kitchen units etc. aren't of the best quality, but at this price we were very happy. Everything was reasonably clean, we had new mattresses on the beds, and it's only 10 mins (max) walk south of the Chrysler building. Felt like a great base for our first trip to New York. Two local supermarkets, and a McD on the corner meant that eating cheaply and quickly was an easy option too. Having never been to Manhatten before, everything else cost a fortune, so this was a good compromise.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price for NY and no frills”
Reviews.Author: sunray0102
Reviews.Content: Its just that - a place to stay at a good enough rate in a good neighborhood ! Pros - Good clean rooms, efficient housekeeping and a friendly front desk. Location was very good, reasonably quiet and close to grand central. We used the subway throughout our stay and it was very convenient. The #7 line went straight to times square! Cons - No pool (none i saw), a small desk with a pc that served as busniess centre, no free breakfast or parking. And 13$ a day for internet!!!! That was outrageous. The rooms were dull and outdated too. All in all, i recommend a stay here. Got a rate of 280$ for the 2 BR and u cant beat that in Manhattan. As for the pool and parking, i suppose very few hotels (and only very pricey ones at that) offer these services. Once again, the location was very nice

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful!!”
Reviews.Author: anandrajdesai
Reviews.Content: We were around 10 family members and friends who had booked rooms in the hotel during our trip to New York in May of 2010. The hotel is nothing special. The rooms are average, the amenities and services in the hotel are average too. The only plus point was the hotel rates as it could get really expensive in new york for hotels. The hotel is not far from the broadway and timesquare. A taxi only takes 10-15 mins at the most with traffic whereas a walk to these places is around 20-25 mins. If you are tourist and your main purpose is to see the city, this is one of the hotels to stay as you will spend less on accommodation and will be able to make better use of your money with food, broadway shows, shopping and other tourist destinations. Definately a go if you are looking for something not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, nice location, but "tired" facilities”
Reviews.Author: jurgenlison
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a "Junior Suite" at a price of $259 (prior to taxes) - and found the room very spacious. The building looks like a converted apartment building. The carpet in my room, the kitchen and the bathroom looked 'tired' - but clean to the best of the staff's abilities. The bathroom ammenties were of good quality, a new & clean shower curtain - but you just can't avoid the look and feel of outdated applicancies, carpet and paint. I reserved this hotel through booking.com - and my confirmation letter stated things like: "wired Internet available through the hotel" - well, not in my room as checked with the staff, and "internet at 9.95/24 hours" - well, I was told and invoiced 13.95/day (for wireless internet). The restaurant (in the same building, on the corner) was closed for renovations: no breakfast available. So, not a bad place, and in fact one of the largest rooms I ever stayed in in New York, but could use some updating of the carpets, applicances, hallways, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations for Girlfriend Trip”
Reviews.Author: MDK38
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. Location in nice neighborhood, easy to get to and from. This time we taxied most places since we spent a lot of time on West side or we walked since weather was perfect. Normally we take subway from Grand Central but with 3 or more sometimes easier and not that much more than taking subway. Desk and housekeeping very accomodating and pleasant. Rooms comfortable and large. Coffee is Wolfgang and good for early a.m. Great closet space for 3 women with lots of clothes and shoes. If you don't need high end, want to be safe, comfortable and have warm service this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a city trip in NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: EriW
Reviews.Content: A friend of our recommended this hotel and it was great! We wanted to see a lot during the day and a nice room to rest during the night, and that's exactly what we got: the hotel is close enough to be able to walk to the best NYC attraction, but not so close that you can't sleep at night because of the noises. Our room was big, clean, and although it could need some rennovation, it was just perfect. Don't pick this hotel if you're looking for luxery, but for a city trip, it's the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: worknhockey
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on this hotel by going directly to the website affinia.com. This is an Affinia affiliate hotel. I read reviews on different websites, so I knew it wasn't the Ritz, but I don't need the Ritz when I am in NYC. I want a decent hotel in a convenient location because I'm only there to rest, change and sleep overnight before tackling another day. We got a 2-bedroom suite for $199 a night - great deal! The living room and dining area were very large! A pullout sofa, chair and 2 tables were in it, plus the desk. A large table with 4 chairs was there for eating. It had a small but full kitchen - microwave, dishwasher, stove, refrigerator, small coffee pot (they supply Wolfgang Puck coffee). The first bedroom had 2 queen beds and was as large as a normal hotel room. The 2nd bedroom had 2 twin beds. The room had 2 full bathrooms (small, but funcxtional). The beds were VERY comfortable! We slept like rocks every night! The bathrooms were basic, but the shampoo, conditioner, lotion and soaps were great! My friend and her daughter came with my daughter and I, and she has stayed at lots of nice hotels all over the workd, and she was impressed at how big it was for the price. The furniture was slightly dated and a bit worn, but nothing horrendous. I felt it was a good location - 6 block walk to Grand Central Station to get uptown or downtown, walking distance to Herald Square, a few blocks to The United Nations. I liked the location because it was quieter than staying in, for example, Times Square area. No traffic noise at all, no noise from other rooms. We seriously slept so well!! The staff was very friendly and helpful, but not too pushy or anything. There aren't any ice machines, but you just call Housekeeping, and they bring a bucket within 5-10 min. There is a convenience store like a 1/2 block away, a Wine/liquor store 1.5 block away, restaurants everywhere around, hey, it's New York! They did charge for internet($13.95/day) which I think should be free, but that was the only thing I could probably complain about. Overall, I would stay there again in a minute if I could get that same rate, even for a smaller suite. We were very happy!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trace51
Reviews.Content: suite was big and perfect for three people, not central location but not too bad, take aways and shops near by. staff were helpful. overall good stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent space, great location”
Reviews.Author: forgotmypword
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd Affinia property we've stayed at. We stayed at the Shelburne last year and loved it but the room we wanted was not available this time. So after reading a reviews and getting a great rate on the Affinia website, we chose this place. We knew what we were getting into ... and we were quite pleased. Most of the previous reviews are accurate. The place needs a facelift, but is clean and spacious and the staff is pleasant, helpful and knowledgeable. We had a 1 bedroom suite ... the living room/dining area is HUGE ... with a sofabed, easy chair, desk, tv, dining table and chairs and plenty of room to move around. My 11yo did a lot of dancing ... just because she could -- lol! The bedroom had two queens, a nightstand, a 6 drawer dresser and TV. And plenty of space to move around. Large closets and a "linen closet" helped us to put all our suitcases and 'stuff' away so the room didn't get that cluttered look. The first two days were were there, we knew there was a large group of school-aged kids staying there for some kind of soccer event. We saw them in the halls and elevators, but once in our room ... we NEVER heard them. Our 8th floor corner suite was quiet ... The beds were comfy. Lots of white linens, even 'encasing' the blanket. The upholstery on the easy chair was worn, yet it seemed clean ... like the it had been steamed clean or something ... the wooden furniture and baseboards were nicked. But nothing horrendous. And that was all over-ridden by the space. We were a reasonable walk to Grand Central station where we could pick up multiple subway lines. 2nd and 3rd ave have everything you could need: pizza, bagels, deli, diner, grocery store and drug stores. The door man found us a taxi when we were leaving w/ luggage, other than that, if we wanted a cab we walked to 2nd or 3rd (depending on whether we were heading uptown or downtown) and never had trouble hailing a cab. I never cooked, but liked the spacious kitchen, with full sized fridge and even a dishwasher. We kept ALL our drinks cold, made coffee and microwaved popcorn. We got take-out one night, and it was nice to be able to sit at a table and eat normally rather than sitting on the edge of a bed an balancing everything on our laps like we'd have to do in a 'regular' hotel room. Bagels, cream cheese and nova from Daniel's on 3rd were great ... we ate our fill and refrigerated the rest for another day. I don't like eating all meals out ... it takes up time ... not to mention money ;)

Reviews.Title: “GREAT space! GREAT value!”
Reviews.Author: mirajo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eastgate Tower for two nights. We rented a two bedroom suite which easily accommodated our party of 5 adults and a child. It was really more like an apartment than a hotel room.
