There was a HUGE living room with comfortable pullout sofa, large dining room, spacious bedroom with 2 double beds, FULL kitchen, another bedroom with 2 twin beds AND two full bathrooms. It was only a 5 minute walk to Grand Central so transportation was easy. The morning we left, we took a taxi to Penn Station and even with all of the traffic, it was still only $10.00. Eastgate is not the most luxurious place--it's a bit dated--BUT it was VERY clean, nice neighborhood, GREAT staff--perfect for families or groups that are looking for an affordable place to stay but don't need a lot of frills (which of course adds $$$.) I HIGHLY recommend Eastgate Tower Hotel. My only complaint would be street noise. We stayed at a different location near Herald Square and never heard a thing. At Eastgate my husband actually got up to make sure the window was closed because it sounded like every car or siren was right next to us even though we were on the 22nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious hotel rooms, nice staff, great value but...”
Reviews.Author: DLDVienna_VA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about 15 years ago and found my experience to be pleasant, since I was upgraded to a nice one bedroom suite. The hotel today still maintains the same types of spacious suites but, during my recent stay with family members, I found our two-bedroom suite only adequate. What made our experience average was the dated, worn condition of the room and its furnishings. But, we were offered the two-bedroom promotion at $199/night, which is a bargain in New York, especially for hotel suites, which did help us overlook the disappointing condition of our room. The hotel staff were professional and courteous, despite the slow check-in process, since we had to wait for our room to be cleaned well past the traditional 3pm check-in time. The hotel restaurant was closed, due to efforts to expand the existing hotel lobby, which is sorely needed -- the lobby can get a bit cramped even with only 10 people in the lobby! The hotel location was ideal for dining out, with an adequate variety of restaurants within a two block radius. I hope the Eastgate Tower improves soon, as it was disappointing to see that not much had changed from my previous stays about 15 years ago. The way the hotel is now, I will not return there.

Reviews.Title: “Huge apartment, with great staff.”
Reviews.Author: PerthFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: We had split stay here, we had a 2 bedroom apartment booked for the both stays. Our first apartment was an interconnecting one bedroom/junior suite. This had a view of the Empire state from the bedroom, bathroom and kitchen. This was huge for our group. The second stay we had a 2 bedroom apartment, no view this time and the apartment itself seemed not quite as well maintained. The doormen at the establishment are excellent, they are very knowledgeable and give great information. We relied on them for recommendations for dining and transport and they were spot-on. Grand central station is an easy walk, although we found the subway ticketing system complicated and ended up relying on taxis! There is a great supermarket close by, that has everything including a great range of fruit and vegetables, also a Walgreens. Basically, everything you could need is close by. We felt absolutely safe walking at night, even on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, spaciuos rooms”
Reviews.Author: NY123456789
Reviews.Content: Feels like at home as every room, I'd better say apartment, has a full kitchen (stove, microwave, coffee maker, fridge, plates, silverware, pots, glasses). Good location, friendly staff, clean (approved by my wife). Mattress could be a bit more firm, but it's fine. For TV viewers: HBO included.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but loved the space!”
Reviews.Author: chriscarm
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 year old son & I stayed here for nearly two weeks over Xmas & New Year. We chose this place after reading some of the reviews & liked the sound of this hotel being an ex apartment building. The last time we stayed in New York, we stayed in a room no bigger than a shoebox, so it was a refreshing change this time to stay in a one bedroom suite. Apart from the separate bedroom, it had a living/dining area, a large bathroom & a small self catered kitchen. We were on the 8th floor, so had a pretty good view of the buildings. The hotel itself is quite dated, but if that's not a problem, which it wasn't for us, then it's fine. The location is pretty good...you're about a ten minute walk to Grand Central Station. There are various shops just down the road from the hotel (convenience store, chemist, liquor store, pizza, burgers, McDonalds, chinese etc). The convenience store is very handy for bread, milk etc. Although it was freezing (snowing) outside when we were there, it was always toasty warm in our room. Some nights, we even slept in a sheet. The housekeeping ladies were always lovely. The only problem we really had, which isn't a biggie, was that every time we wanted to watch a pay per view movie, we had to keep ringing reception to get it uploaded, which was a bit of a pain, but as I said...no biggie. The only other little complaint was sometimes there was a weird smell on our floor once we got out of the elevator, but the smell was never in our room, so it didn't matter. There is a laundry in the basement for you to wash & dry your clothes. Definitely buy your own detergent as I brought some laundry powder from the lady at the counter & it ruined some of our clothes (bleached some of the colour out). This was really annoying because I specifically asked her if it was safe to wash my clothes in it & she said yes. It looks like there was a restaurant at this hotel, but it was closed for renovations when we were there. Also, you have to pay for the internet which was about $50 for the week. All in all, we had a great stay in this hotel & would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WOULDN'T STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!”
Reviews.Author: tomcal
Reviews.Content: We discovered the Eastgate Tower Hotel in February 2009 and booked to stay there again last week. We were once again thrilled with our stay and can't imagine staying anywhere else in new York. Travelling with two teenagers, we booked a two bedroom suite and got what can only be described as an apartment - two huge bedrooms, one with a big double bed and the other with two double beds, two bath/shower rooms, a massive lounge with sofa and chairs as well as a dining table and chairs, TVs in both bedrooms and the lounge and a fully fitted kitchen. So much space and only a few blocks from Grand Central Station and the ESB. There are plenty of good diners close by on 3rd Ave as well as a couple of supermarkets if you want to stock your fridge and eat or snack in. The staff were super polite and helpful and we got a great rate by booking direct.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: EricaD1
Reviews.Content: Having a kitchen was great and it was close enough to walk to Times Square

Reviews.Title: “1300 euros for 10 days,view of Empire State, good value for Manahhatan!”
Reviews.Author: rachobri
Reviews.Content: As my second visit to New York and my Husbands 6th, we both felt that the Easgate represented reasonable value for money in a very handy location. It is only a few blocks from Grand Central Station. He had stayed there before with his band and they had very large 2 bedroom suites they felt were great, we had a one bed Studio suite room on this visit. The room we had was 25C, which is on the top floor with a nice view of the Empire State Building and the surrounding streets. We had requested in advance that we had a room near the top with a view ideally-as we were on honeymoon! When we arrived there we were greeted and quickly given our room key. The foyer was nice-very christmassy and welcoming. The corridor on our floor was very dated and faded and this was par for the course for the rest of the interior-basically it was all quite outdated, things were scuffed & marked. It was a very large room, lots of storage space, little kitchen area and bathroom - there were a few unwanted hairs in the bath, even though the place otherwise seemed spotless. It had a fairly cool view I thought! As the rooms are self catering, you can cook some meals yourself or at least have breakfast at home a few times-that in itself can save you a few bob! There is a lovely fresh food market in Grand Central Station that I would recommend if you were planning to cook a meal in your hotel room. The Hotel staff were consistenly pleasant and helpful and the room was serviced every day. There are loads of diners nearby to get a great breakfast in - our favourites were French Toast and Bacon, or Pancakes and Sausage!! I would recommend Scotty's Diner (39th & Lex), the Frontier (closest to Hotel, come out door, turn left, keep walking and its on the corner on the left before you cross the next avenue) or Sarge's (36th and 3rd, or maybe 37th..) - all of these had lovely breakfast. Scotty's do fabulous burgers too as we discovered very late at night -they are open 24 hours too!! There is a 24 Duane Reades nearby (they are a mix of pharmacy and grocery- have alcohol, sweets, medicines and very cheap make up!!) Murray Hill as an area is nice, we have stayed in that district before, the streets feel safe late at night, we never saw any trouble. The hotel is nice, I wouldn't pay anymore than we did though- I would confidently say too, that I suspect there are some pretty crap rooms in this place, so If you have a price you are happy with, request a top room with view to get best value. If you are not experienced with New York, then you should learn now, what we would expect from a standard Jury's hotel or Days Hotel bedroom in Ireland, would be considered positively brand new and luxurious for new york! You just have to accept this, lower your standards BIG TIME, unless you are prepared to spend an awful lot of money, expect small rooms, outdated facilites and no frills for a Manhattan hotel. You will always hear traffic noises - this area maybe had a fire station nearby as there were sirens going off constantly and the air con unit was seriously loud - if you need your sleep, bear this in mind! But again, this is all fairly normal for New York and you do get used to it - it adds to the character of the city!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Tr1padv1ser
Reviews.Content: Looking back at other reviews of this hotel I am surprised that it has been receiving such high ratings. I guess it is all relative. We stayed 4 nights at the Eastgate Towers in a one bedroom apartment. Three disappointments greeted us on our arrival: the floor in our room was clearly not vacuumed, the lights in the lounge + TV did not work and there was no in-room safe. The lighting + TV issue was fixed fairly promptly. I must admit that the room saw huge for the price ($199 per night) and the kitchen facilities were very handy. I did find it odd that tea and coffee making ingredients were in the room but there was no jug to boil. Given the pretensions to quality of the Affina brand, we might have had a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and brilliant central location”
Reviews.Author: trishwnottingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed on New Year's Eve for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed our visit there. We were welcomed warmly by the receptionist and shown quickly to our suite, which was surprisingly big by New York standards. Within five minutes of arriving we received a phone call to ask if we had everything we needed and that we were happy with the room, which we were. There was plenty of hanging space in the wardrobes, a bathroom big enough for two to get ready in, a huge comfortable bed and a very convenient well-equipped kitchenette, which was topped up with tea and coffee supplies daily. A free safe facility is provided next to reception with 24-hour access. We found the location very convenient, just a 10 minute walk from the beautiful Grand Central Terminal, which became our local subway start each day, and around 20 minutes to Times Square. Locally there is a fantastic supermarket if you wish to cater for yourself, or excellent delis for a filling hot breakfast before you start your day. Another major plus at this hotel ... it is very quiet and, unlike other hotels we have stayed in in Manhattan, you don't hear the police sirens going all night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in a convenient location. Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: mintha
Reviews.Content: The excellence of this hotel starts with the General Manager Mr. Drepaul. We were thrilled with a very spacious suite and spent fourteen nights there. The living area was large and included a desk, TV and sofa bed (where I had a cousin stop over one night). Also an open plan kitchenette and an adjacent dining table. The bedroom had two Queen sized beds, lots of storage space and one and a half bathrooms. The hotel is extremely well located to all transport. Buses along Third Ave. A couple of blocks toward Grand Central Station there were buses to take you along Madison Ave or across town to the Lincoln Center was easy. Buy a Bus Pass the convenient way to hop around. The underground trains worked well for us to many locations and great restaurants including Soho. I'm not hesitating in recommending friends to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: chconger
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over new years eve. Excellent location in Murry Hill. Very large suite for the money. Has kitchen (saves a lot on breakfasts), 2 baths, 2 bedrooms for $1300 over 3 nights. Was in room 20B - no bedbugs to report! Feels old and tired but would go again as is good value for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Flawless Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vicdawg1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eastgate Tower Hotel during the week of December 8, 2009. I booked online and read TripAdvisor before confirming. I couldn't be more pleased. I have stayed in New York enough to know "the territory" and I avoid the Fancy Chain Corporation Hotels. This hotel was the best of the nonchain hotels that I have stayed in. If your looking for someone to pamper you, then stay somewhere else. I know how to find my room. I know how to get my luggage on the elevator. I know where I want to go. The front desk was helpful with any question that I had, but don't go looking for concierage (sp) service. There was a bellman, but he stayed out of your way unless you needed his help. I did have to store luggage on the return flight and that was easily taken care of. Now, the room. Most of these hotels you have to go outside to turn yourself around. NOT at Eastgate Towers. My room was large. It had room for closet, a desk, a small refrigerator, microwave, and even cabinets with a few glasses and dishes. The Bathroom was large enough to close the door and not feel like you were on a cruise ship bathroom. It even had a double medicine cabinet with mirror and a vanity cabinet with extra towels, toilet paper, etc. My only 3 star rating is that it is a solid 10 minute walk to Grand Central to catch subway. So if bad weather you are probably limited to cabs. Once at Grand Central you can get anywhere including a direct train to Times Square (the S). I recommend Eastgate Tower to anyone who can survive without being pampered and who justs wants a nice clean room at a comfortable price.

Reviews.Title: “Crap hole and false advertising”
Reviews.Author: Dom47
Reviews.Content: I recently booked through travelocity a 4 night stay at the Affinia Eastgate Towers in New York's Murray Hill area. Of course, online the pics were great and claimed to be a 4 start hotel and paying $270.00 per night which I expected would get us a decent hotel. Upon arrival, what a crap hole, location was run down, the exterior of the hotel was mediocre, the lobby was a joke, one tiny elevator that fit two people at best. Oh, but the rooms took the cake! they were horrible, old beat up furniture, the room smelled like urine, mold and nastiness. Don't believe the pics you see online, the rooms are nothing like them.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate and location, but watch out for the staff!”
Reviews.Author: yfrantwo
Reviews.Content: The location was great. The room was very spacious and clean. The only big caveat is the staff. The front desk has this post office mentality - like they were doing you a favor by letting you stay there. Even worse, it appears to be business as usual for the staff to walk into your room when THEY felt they had a reason to do so. They always had an excuse, double checking on something or another guest gave them the wrong room number. If it weren't for that, I would have said great stay all around, but we felt like our safety was in jeopardy because of the staff walking into our room when they felt like it. We had never experienced anything like that before and found it to be very unsettling. Despite that, I recommend this place, but only with a caveat. I would reside there if I got a great rate again -- otherwise, I would not. I would keep the latch on the door when in the room, and the "do not disturb" sign on the door when not, and only allow the staff in the room when I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not the Best!”
Reviews.Author: JCBrick
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of pros and cons... Pros: - Great location - Incredibly large studios (larger than my sister-in-laws 1BD Manhattan apt) - Reasonably priced (Great for the area) - Quiet, off-main-street Cons: - Bed as hard as plank wood, did not personally sleep well. - Did not take a shower because the bathroom was old and dirty (only stayed one night) - Old, needs a lot of renovation - Reception staff unfriendly - Valet told us $8.95 for an overnight then charged us $35 for "special event" rating (special event being us using the hotel) - Reception messed up the charges on our room and got rude when we asked for a refund on non-purchased items (such as internet, movies, etc) My husband and I would only stay here again because it is just a few blocks from family... other than that, we would find somewhere a bit nicer. I would recommend this hotel, however, be warned of the cons... I'm big on comfortable beds, and this just didn't have it!

Reviews.Title: “Used to be good - getting worse each time”
Reviews.Author: theinphillips
Reviews.Content: This hotel goes more downhill each time I stay, which has been often over the years. I want to like it as it is very familiar to me, but I am struggling to justify further stays. Reasons the same as everyone else: the hotel itself is so rundown now, dirty, grimy, smelly. The fitness center was all but unusable for its stench, plus weights falling apart. It is a personal pet peeve that floors marked as non-smoking literally knock you over with a smoke smell when you get off the elevator. Internet access continues to be way to expensive, most places make it complimentary now, they still charge nearly $15/day. It actually replicates the experience of living in NY in a rundown, lousy apartment, instead of being the experience of staying in a hotel and even for an ex-New Yorker like myself it is getting too much. Staff are always nice, although given that there is nothing that they can provide, there is no reason for them not to be. Location is excellent and rooms are not as disgusting as the rest of the building, but I wonder how long that will last since nothing ever appears to be updated. If you can afford to be somewhere else, I'd say make a different choice. This time the rate was so good I couldn't pass, but I would not pay more than $200/night here.

Reviews.Title: “Just stay home it is muchhhh better”
Reviews.Author: joojoo0626
Reviews.Content: I believe this is the worst hotel in newyork city you would be better off staying at motel 6 or the holiday in and thats the honest truth the resturant is closed they do not tell you that till you check in, the front desk reception says things that are not true. they say that there are menues in your room which you can order out from (LIE), they say check in is not till 3 (LIE) people checked in before us when i asked why they said they paid more when i asked they guest he said "no way". The rooms are old very dingy and disgusting the bathroom tile is very old the toilet seats are all chiped and so is both the tubs our toilet even broke while we were there. House keeping does not clean your room like they are suppose to for example i had but a wrapper under the table on purpose to see if they vacume and we stayed there for 7 days and for that 7 days that wrapper was there. One day they did not even bother cleaning our room, when i came back to the rom at 9:30 in the evenaning and called to ask ehy my room was not clean they did not have an explanation they had the neves to ask if i wanted it cleaned now. what more should i say its old its dirty its disgusting and the staff are not one bit profesional. oh and one more thing do not relay on baggage claim to bring your luggage up or don my fiance hurt his back because he was sitting on one of there old chair which broke and we had to carry 9 luggage on the cart and bring it down ourselves while the girl just watched. just spend a little more and get a better room oh and i also paid an aditional 850 for a nicer room whch was maybe 1 percent nicer than the regular room. long story told short IF YOU LIKE AN OLD DIRTY CHEAP PLACE ENJOY YOUR STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: FatClone
Reviews.Content: The good points - reasonably priced, friendly staff, convenient location. The negative points - very basic kitchen facilities and cleanliness not always at it's best. It was also a bit noisy sometimes. It's a 10 minute walk to Grand Central station, so a very good location for accessing the Metro system in New York. The room was reasonably spacious, although it would have been nice to have a sofa in the room. We could either use the bed or the two upright chairs at the dining table. We had to ask for the room to be cleaned when we arrived as the kitchen and bathroom had not been done properly. The kitchen was a bit basic and lacking in utensils and cooking pans. On the plus side, they did give us two more saucepans when we asked, but their were no kitchen knives or a breadknife, measuring jugs, grater, things like that. Three mights we were woken up in the early hours of the morning by people talking loudly in the corridor outside the room. Not really the hotels fault, but irritating nonetheless. Despite this, the price of the room was reasonable and the staff were always helpful and courteous and we would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastballer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is older with large rooms. You get a kitchen in the suite, so if you are a with a family that is a great addition (eat inside). If you need the space and want a low cost hotel, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Very user friendly”
Reviews.Author: A2ZCanada
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a couple of days of fun in New York. Stayed at Eastgate in room 25B. We were on the last floor. Great view. Very quiet and very clean. Very helpful staff. This was a big, clean appartment with 2 bathrooms. a well equipped kitchen, a dining room and a big living room. Beds and pillows were comfortable. I have back problems so I am almost an expert.... Got it through Priceline. 15 minute walk to Times Square and loads of shops around for groceries or anything you want. I would not recommend Byblos restaurant nearby. Food was so-so and expensive. I will be coming back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Huge suites, clean sheets and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: AmazingChan
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Eastgate Tower along with our baby daughter. We needed a one bedroom suite with a kitchen and got a great online deal. The reviews on tripadvisor were generally positive, so we hoped for the best without any great expectations. As it turned out, we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a great spot in midtown Manhattan, close to Grand Central Station and with a Diagostio supermarket, ubiquitous Starbucks and fresh bagels just a few minutes away. On first appearance it's a little tired, but it's clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. Our suite was very spacious, with a dining area, separate kitchen, huge lounge and a very large bedroom with two comfortable double beds, another TV and no sign of bedbugs. The bathroom was clean and the shower pressure was great. It's not the Hudson, but it's great value and if you want to hang out with the hip crowd, the W is just a minute's walk up the road. You will like The Eastgate Tower if you: - want plenty of space - are on a budget - are travelling with children - want to escape from Times Square - like to make your own breakfast You will not like it if you: - want an hotel that looks like a page out of Wallpaper* magazine

Reviews.Title: “Why are standards for hotels different in NY than anywhere else in the world.”
Reviews.Author: Nels
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on reviews on Tripadvisor and all I can say is this hotel is a dump. Not surprising since hotel standards in NY are different from any other city in the world. A 5 star is actually a 3 star, a 4 star is a 2 etc. So, since this hotel is a 2.5 it is actually a .5 which makes sense because that is exactly what it is. Picture a really bad bachelor pad with mismatched furniture clunky light fixtures a TV that has horrible reception a layer of dust on the vanity light in bathroom. The only good thing about this room was the fact that the shower worked very well, it drained properly and the water pressure was good. That's all that was good.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for our family of 4”
Reviews.Author: Joanne04
Reviews.Content: Have recently returned from a 4 night stay with my husband and 2 children (aged 8 & 10) and I have no complaints about this hotel at all! We had a one bedroom apartment on the 14th floor which had two beds, sofa bed and full kitchen. As others have said, it's not exactly stylish but the rooms are huge, the beds are comfy, it is cleaned every day and the staff are friendly. We were able to walk to many places of interest without complaints from the children and when we wanted to go further Grand Central was a short walk away. We had a couple of good breakfasts at the Frontier Diner which was close-by otherwise there are plenty of delis and restaurants to choose from if you are staying local. One thing to note - when we arrived the hotel put us in a one bedroom apartment on the 9th floor by mistake (theirs not ours). We only spent about 5 mins in it before they moved us but it has to be said that room wasn't in as good condition - the carpet was much older with a few dodgy looking stains and the beds weren't as comfortable. The kitchen appliances also looked older. It wasn't bad enough to make us complain but the 2nd room was definately better - maybe they are rennovating from top to bottom? Might be an idea to ask for a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, huge rooms, clean and safe.”
Reviews.Author: SandyVancouver39
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days and were very satisfied with the location (short walk to Grand Central station), small kitchen, coin-laundry in the basement, service, and many places close by to eat and get groceries. We had a Junior Suite and the room was huge with 3 small closets, plenty of drawers and room to dance. The TV color and channel selection were poor and the furniture outdated, but we were there to see the sights, so not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about, budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jweisberger
Reviews.Content: I got placed here via Priceline. It was fine and a good value. Room was large, has a kitchenette. Bathroom clean and totally serviceable. Room was a bit cold but not nearly as bad as some 4-5 star places I've been in NYC. Its an old city that was built like crap, most of the buildings are cold, in my exp. For sub-$200 a night prices, it was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Eastgate Fulfilled All Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: St_LouisMaltese
Reviews.Content: We found the Eastgate Tower to be ideal for our group of five. It was so quiet - even from one room to another. We had a two bedroom suite with sofa bed. We bought some breakfast foods from a small grocer nearby and saved ourselves time and money. There were even wine glasses in the kitchen. The furniture was outdated but the beds were wonderful and everything was clean. One word of caution. I had a confirmation showing rate and number of persons. When we arrived not only did they not have a suite with separate beds in each bedroom as requested but they also tried to change our room rate. Lucily I had brought our email confirmation to show them. They changed us to our choice of room configuration the next day when a room was available.

Reviews.Title: “No luxury, but spacious for our group”
Reviews.Author: aruba1983
Reviews.Content: We reserved a two bedroom, two bath suite on a non-smoking room, which is what we got. Check-in was quick and easy, at most it took 5 minutes. The bellman, Luis, loaded all our luggage to his cart and took there to our room. he also gave us a tour of the room, showed us how to use the AC and we can open the windows if we wanted fresh air. The room was HUGE, our toddler had a blast walking from room to room. We did open the windows every day. Having a full kitchen was nice, though we didn't need it. The maid stopped by every day to make beds, change towels, etc. The hotel did not have a restaurant, but only minutes away is the Frontier Diner, they offer breakfast, lunch & dinner with free delivery. Other stores in the area include: McDonalds, Dunkin Donuts, convient stores, Duane Reade, chinese restaurant, pizza place. We only paid about $299 per night which is an awesome deal in Manhattan for our group of 7.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - basic hotel, great base, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: TigEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights. This hotel is basic - room was above average size and very clean, but dimly lit and somewhat dated. However, it was exactly what we needed for the price, and was great value for money. The room we were alloacted was a mini-apartment with ktichenette, and the bathroom was small but functional. Its location was ideal for exploring the city, and it was a perfect base for our holiday. The staff were extremely helpful, and happy to assist with any needs we had. Bars and resturants were nearby (cheap breakfast spot at one end of the street - try the chocolate chip pancakes!) and just a 10 min walk to Grand Central Station. Overall, we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about”
Reviews.Author: asrosen
Reviews.Content: Good size room, serviceable as a place to stay, but not a particularly comfortable or inviting room environment. Very hard bed, chairs for working at table were in terrible shape, and TV was old and had pretty poor reception.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a perfect price”
Reviews.Author: sdnl
Reviews.Content: The Eastgate Tower hotel is located in Midtown and a five minutes walk from Grand Central Terminal. Nearby are deli's, restaurants and shops. It was our groups second trip and we really loved this hotel. We had a two bedroom suite that was huge for a very friendly price. We had breakfast everymorning in the room and even made dinner once in the room. When we came back from dinner we relaxed in the sittingroom, talked, had a drink. Very relaxing! We could see the UN building (24th floor) and a reflection of the Chrysler building. Then you know you really are in New York. The room was better than expected for the price (240 euro's/night) but do not expect a fancy room. Each room had a tv. The kitchen was equipped with the necessary utensils. including a dishwasher.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, roomy apartment style suite”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDreamer
Reviews.Content: Eastgate Towers exceeded all of our expectations for our first family vacation to NYC! Great location a 5 min walk to the subway at Grand Central Station. The two bedroom suite was not luxurious but roomy and comfortable - apartment style, with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, kitchen, roomy livingrm/dining w sleeper couch. The web special price of $199 was an unbelievable value. With three teenagers, we were nervous about NYC hotel room sizes only to be pleasantly surprised with this most spacious suite, we've ever stayed in all our travels. Definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious, not lux”
Reviews.Author: shuytza
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a 2br apartment. It was very spacious. The beds were ok, rooms were very spacious, there was kitchen which was great, though not the cleanest. The pull out sofa was not comfortable for sleeping (as expected). The hotel has not been renovated in a while, but it was roomy and comfortable. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Run down & Dirty with the worst bed I've ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: bgmix
Reviews.Content: Like many these days, when traveling on business, I need to be budget conscious. It didn't help that my stay overlapped the NY Open. I'd read reviews and seen pictures of the Eastgate here so I wasn't expecting anything terribly new, but this hotel is in FAR worse shape than the reviews I saw would indicate. I wouldn't have minded the fact the it's dated if it was clean. Unfortunately it was not. Not even close. Then there was the bed.... if that's what you want to call it. I've slept in airport waiting areas that were more comfortable. I can't wait to get out of here and give all of my things a disinfectant level cleaning. Bottom line, even in NYC you can do better for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for small group”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBarney
Reviews.Content: We (5 friends) took advantage of their weekly rates which was great value for the accommodation received. The size of the rooms were very good. Lounge and dining area furniture were abit dated, but bedrooms big and clean. We had the 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment. The lounge was a sofa bed and could be used as sleeping quarters. There was also a fully functional kitchen with microwave in our apartment. The hotel did not have breakfast, but we had no trouble having a quick meal on the go or eating nearby. Also check out the sushi restaurant next door which was really tasty. The hotel had a computer downstairs and a 24hr reception. Couldn’t see any other facilities, but that was all we needed. Location was great, very close to grand central and the Chrysler building. Took us about 5min walk. The only reason this did not get a 5* is that the rooms were overbooked when we stayed (June). We had to be put up for 1night in a 1 bedroom apartment before changing the following day. A nominal amount of compensation was given, but we would have preferred to just get our chosen rooms in the first place. Not sure if this happens often.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but it could have been better”
Reviews.Author: pdionne
Reviews.Content: The Eastgate Tower is conveniently located near Midtown and Grand Central – 42nd St Station and is in walking distance of many attractions. The hotel was fine. The rooms are very spacious, but feature a very noisy air conditioner going on 24/7. I had a great view over Manhattan. The staff was O.K., but could have been a little friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and comfort at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: totobobo123
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Eastgate Tower. Our "junior suite" was quite spacious and included a kitchenette - a rarity in downtown Manhattan. We found the price quite reasonable compared to other similar hotels. Our only complaint would be the steep cost for a wireless internet connection. Most hotels offer complimentary free wifi nowadays. Fortunately you can find free hotspot connections in the street less than a block away if you aren't willing to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: handersson
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed eight nights in Eastgate Tower Hotel and we definitely liked the hotel. The rooms were spacious and tidy and what's most important the location was brilliant. The service was ok and there was no noice from other rooms etc. Grocery stores and cafe places (such as Starbucks) are situated close to the hotel. There was a guest computer with an Internet connection downstairs. Unfortunately the price of using the Internet was quite pricy. But don't worry. If you need to check your emails you can always go to BurgerKings or net cafe that you may find every where. The location was ecxellent. Just a 15 minutes walk to Empire State Building and also the Grand Central Terminal with nice subway connections is very close. This is also one reason why the hotel is good for people who want to explore the city during their stay in NYC. Eastgate Tower Hotel isn't the newest hotel in the city but it is definitely a great choise for a normal traveller. It is great for couples and families. I am more than happy to recommend this hotel to everybody who are travelling to New York City for leisure. We would choose this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value in the heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Weekend_getaways
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Eastgate for 7 nights in August. As others have said before the rooms are enormous ( I think larger than the two bedroomed wimpey house that was our first home ). I travelled with my husband and two teenaged sons and we had a two bedroom suite. This meant that anyone suffering from Jetlag could go and sit in the sitting room whilst others slept. It was cool ( in a very hot and humid NY ), very clean, and quiet. The rooms could be a bit smarter, but the carpet in ours looked brand new ( certainly less than a month old ), and the bathrooms were well cleaned each day, and the sheets changed every other day. We used the laundry room in the basement that has 6 washing machines and four dryers – so we could leave with all our clothes clean. The location in mid town is great, just in the area that tourists think of when they think of New York. We had 7 day passes for the subway/buses and we became expert at catching the uptown/downtown busses at each end of the block. The buses are clean, and air conditioned, and the stops have the schedules, and the buses are on time. We asked a question of reception the first day, and they gave us bogus advice ( recommending a taxi to go to somewhere 3 blocks away ) – so we used tripadvisor from then on. Apart from that , the Eastgate was perfect. We got a $200 a night deal which included internet, and the value we got for that price could not be beaten. Also check out the Mexican restaurant Singuel on 3rd avenue and 40th – the best meal we had in 16 nights in the US. We went on the last night – and wished we could have gone again.

Reviews.Title: “new york new york you got to love it”
Reviews.Author: flowman692003
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the eastgate hotel in new york and the rooms are small but nice the price is good but be very careful i recived the bill after my stay and paid with my charge . when i returen home i recived a call that we went over our limit on our charge card .i called the bank and it turns out that the hotel put in a charge higher than what the bill stated . you would think that the bill which stated paid by visa was what was sent to the bank . well i guess after you leave they must spin a wheel and see what they will charge after you check out im not happy with what they did .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Value and Location, Cannot Fault”
Reviews.Author: d02473
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New York and the hotel was great for what we needed. Its in a great location, 5 min walk from Grand Central Station where the subway will get you anywhere. Only 10 min walk will also get you to time square. The room was very clean, with the maid making up the room and changing the bedding and towels every day. The hotel staff were very helpfull and answered any questions we had. The hotel could not be better for the price. Only thing id say against is if you need internet it is available but its now $14 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: MennoLaura
Reviews.Content: For our 5 day stay in NYC we were looking for an affordable room in the city and I stumbled upon the Eastgate Towers. After reading the reviews on tripadvisor, we booked a room for about $120/night. On arrival, the staff was friendly, explained that the restaurant was closed for remoddeling and gave us some tips for nearby places to eat. Checkin was fast and friendly. The room was very big, had a nice little kitchenette (microwave, fridge, coffemaker and stove) and - most importantly - was clean. The room decor was a little dated, as mentioned by other reviewers, but that didn't bother us at all. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly during our stay. The location is great - some restaurants, shops & deli's are located just around the corner. Grand Central, also has the nearest metro, is a 5-10 minute walk. Concluding: great place to stay if you're looking for an affordable room on a great location in New York - would stay there again next time. If

Reviews.Title: “A huge appartment of 110 m2 / 1200 ft2”
Reviews.Author: DutchFamily2
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in this great appartment hotel (I think it was a junior suite). We had a large livingroom, a large bedroom, a bathroom and a kitchen. What more can you ask for? After walking around in New York all day we had lots of room for the four of us to relax. The deli was just around the corner, so we filled up our fridge and watched lots of baseball in the evening. We just loved the hotel! and New York :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value.”
Reviews.Author: jazmania
Reviews.Content: I booked our reservation online after I saw a Web special offer for $149/night from the hotel. Wow, where else can you get such a good hotel deal in NYC? Of course I checked through all the reviews on TA about the hotel, and even with mostly positive reviews, I still had a bit of apprenhension. The hotel is conveniently located near Grand Central Terminal and subway stations. The area is bustling with plenty of shops for shopping. My friend and I booked a 1-bedroom with 2 Qn beds suite. The suite is spacious (think of it as a one-bedroom apartment as it was before it was converted into a hotel). It even has a half-bath off the dining area. We had more space than we know what to do with. The kitchen area was equipped with coffee pot and the essential dishes and wares. The furnishings were a bit dated and worn. But the bed was very comfortable. Most importantly, the suite was clean (which is very important to me). The service was fine but perfunctory but didn't bother us since we only needed to check-in and out. I'd definitely stay there again if they keep offering such good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Great Prices”
Reviews.Author: LEM1972
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights last week. I thought it was a very good deal for the size of the rooms. We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2baths. The decor was a little outdated but nothing too bad. It was a great location too. We walked to Times Square several times. Grand Central is a short walk too. That was great. I thought all the employees I dealt with were very kind. It was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: MartinSweden65
Reviews.Content: The hotel is run down, location is good, staff was very unprofessional, and they charged me 500 USD instead of 149 USD pr night, the rate that was confirmed when I booked. When I conplained they said they where sorry,and it was an obvious mistake, but that they couldn't do anything about it. Never ever stay at this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location, big rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Tweety61
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed here last week. I was a little nervous after we went to check in and as of 3:30, our room still wasn't ready. They had given late check-out to the people before us, well, that's fine if you don't have someone waiting. We arrived at 10:45, had a very early flight, they checked our luggage and we went to explore. We came back at 2:30, and room still wasn't ready, checked again at 3pm and they said another 1/2 hour. My husband was not happy. I had told them we needed a non smoking floor as my one daughters has allergies. We had booked a 1 bedroom suite, and they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite! Well, this made up for the wait. They also made sure they cleaned very well knowing about her allergies. I loved my pillow, slept like a rock every night, maybe that was because we were out all day!! It was so nice to have the 2 bathrooms with 2 teenage daughters, they loved having their own beds in their own room! There is a McDonald's, Dunkin Donuts, grocery store and drug store right on the corner. Nice to have a fridge and microwave for leftovers, which there were plenty of. All the restaurants we went to we brought something home. I know this hotel doesn't have a huge lobby, restaurant or bar area, but the large rooms and location make up for it. We weren't there much anyway. I don't usually like to eat in hotel restaurants anyway. We liked that it was away from Times Square, about a 15-20 min walk for us, but not too far from a walk to the subway. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for family of 5”
Reviews.Author: erdaky
Reviews.Content: We loved the 2 bed rooms and privacy of 2 bath rooms. Suite is very big, even for 5 of us. Only thing, there are only 3 comfy seats to watch TV. The suite can really do with another couch. Cost for wireless internet is a rip off but fortunately there are other free wireless networks that you can receive. Price pretty expensive, but hey, this is New York. No hidden costs upon check out. Convenient location & we felt safe walking around in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby. Welrdly Detached Staff.”
Reviews.Author: HeisenbergCT
Reviews.Content: OK, I check these reviews all the time, and it often strikes me that certain people are just complainers. Now I'm going to sound like one, and that's not my usual style. I picked the hotel because of the good rate, especaily for a suite. I had stayed at the Affinia Gardens in March and loved it. (Same chain.) At this hotel: check-in was weird. They never cited the agreed-upon rate or the number of days of the stay. I asked for a room on an upper floor. They assigned me to a smoking floor without telling me that. The room itself smelled like stale smoke. The furniture was shabby. We wound up leaving a little early -- the night before the morning of our scheduled check-out. when I called down to tell them that, they told me they would not be able to show me a printed bill or statement at night -- which means I never saw my room rate -- not at check-in or check-out! I thought the maid service was sloppy. (Smudgy, streaky toilet rim when I checked in.) Then there's the little things: in this day and age when people travel with laptops and other equipment, you really have GOT to offer those little in-room safes. Not here. I also really hate having to pay for internet service every day, call down, get a new password every day, etc. And those of us who like to fall asleep to quiet, gentle music really appreciate having an iPod docking station or at least a CD player at bedside. Not here. OK, I sound really whiny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for our family of five.”
Reviews.Author: Hawk34
Reviews.Content: We traveled to New York with our three teenagers and found a two-bedroom suite at the Eastgate Towers to be an excellent alternative to getting two rooms at a standard hotel. We got a very good price online. As noted in other reviews, the decor is a bit dated and the furniture a bit worn but our suite was very clean and huge, larger than most two bedroom apartments on Manhattan. The upholstered furniture was in good shape. It was great to have a kitchen with a refrigerator for our milk and juice, a coffeemaker, microwave and a toaster. We did not use the oven or stove. We really like the Murray Hill neighborhood as it is quiet and has a residential feel. We were literally all over Manhattan and even in Brooklyn and used buses on Second, Third and 42nd (M104 and M42) as well as the subway in and out of Grand Central. (Get the unlimited rides MetroCard and learn to use both bus and subway and you will save your feet and legs.) Nearby Frontier Diner and Daniel's Bagels provided basic meal support when we were in the neighborhood. We had a little interaction with the staff. Some seemed more friendly and helpful than others. The hotel charges for internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - dirty room, unhelpful/unpleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: mswood
Reviews.Content: Don't do it! We were staying here to welcome some family for a celebration so checked in before they arrived. As per other reviews and photos, we expected the hotel to be outdated in terms of decor but this was fine, though the Hotel's website photos weren't what we were given. We stayed in a Junior Suite and the good aspect is that the size of the room is very big for just the two of us which was nice as I know other hotel rooms can be quite small. What wasn't fine was the uncleanliness. The carpet needed a good vacuuming, it was full of dust everywhere, walls unfinished around aircon unit and worst still....... HAIRS in the bathroom and on the shower wall that DID NOT BELONG TO US!! We quickly asked at reception to change rooms and were told there was nothing else available so could not move us, and they didn't even offer to re-clean the room. Their attitude was of complete disinterest. Some of our family stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which was a little cleaner than ours but the sofa bed which they needed to use was very torn and filthy. They asked for it to be changed, were told it couldn't be, so we suggested they swapped it with ours as we didn't need to use ours, and the staff member didn't even offer to swap these for us so we had to bring down ours in the lift from another floor then take theirs back to our room!! Not very helpful/attentive. Also, on arrival we were told that their restaurant was closed so had to take any meals we required in our room. We cancelled our booking with the hotel on the same day and transferred to a different location the following day.

Reviews.Title: “too good to be true and it was”
Reviews.Author: bpowell824
Reviews.Content: what a revelation. I do not think you could find such fantastic accomodation in New york for the price. it had everything you needed and even staff who wanted to help. ideal for visting the sights. for breakfast try Scottys only a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Wazza145
Reviews.Content: After reviewing a lot of hotels in New York, we came across this one. It didn't seem correct, the rates we got in the location, and we heard from everyone that New York is expensive with small rooms. NOT the case here. We were pleasantly surprised to find that our room was nice and large, with kitchenette and fridge, stove, everything you need if you want to stay in. It was great. Also had king size bed and tv. The shower was good, and bathroom clean. It is nice and quiet, situated very close to a grocery store and a short walk to Grand Central. We actually walked to Times Square as well, which is only about 15 minutes away by foot. It is a great base to tour Manhattan, and we were incredibly happy that this hotel met more than our expectations, and thanks to everyone who had posted reviews and swayed us to book this hotel, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, especially good for family with young children”
Reviews.Author: dollar911
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for our short trip, especially with a 12 and 10 year old who don't like walking! close too small convenience stores and cafe/restaurants. Using subway was easy as it is not too far away from Grand Central station thus making it easy to get to tourist attractions. Staff were helpful especially the irish doorman (apologies if this is wrong title). Good facillities within room especially easy for catering for breakfast. Would stay again, hopefully for a longer vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding family stay”
Reviews.Author: AustDigga
Reviews.Content: We were after an appartment rather a Hotel room as we were travelling with three young children (4,3 and 1). After some searcing we found this place at some VERY good rates, even the staff were surprised. The rooms were spacious, (stayed in the Junior Suite) even with a crib. All facilities were clean and kitchenete was excellent. Plenty of Dining options for families close by, MacDonalds, Pizza Shop and Convienence store all within 200yds. Hotel resturant was closed due to being refurbished but didn't posse a problem. As per above plenty of other options close by. Pharmacy within 300yds.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for those on a budget, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: anke_lue
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights recently in a large room. It's great to have own cooking facilities, fridge, microwave, gas hob; with pots, crockery and cutlery provided. The decor is not the most up-to-date, and some of the cupboards could do with a spring clean, but overall this is a great hotel for those who want to explore Manhattan. Grand Central is very close by so it's easy to hop on a train elsewhere too. For people who don't want to eat out morning noon and night, this hotel is great. My mother - on her first trip to the US - was impressed with the staff; they offered to post her letters, held our luggage for a couple of hours at no extra charge before we left for the airport, and generally were genuinely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks All The Boxes”
Reviews.Author: Kags09
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in hotels in New York which are notoriously small so was intrigued when this option came up. We were upgraded to a King size suite on 20th floor - room was huge!!! Bed really comfy and very clean. Furnishings were a bit tired but fine, kitchen area was impressive with coffee maker (supplies always replenished), toaster, microwave and full cooker. Fridge freezer which was brilliant for keeping our beers and water nicely chilled!!! Also has iron and ironing board and more than ample storage space. Bathroom was bright and good shower with plentiful hot water. Pleasant staff, great location with diners, restaurants and deli's in abundance close by. Good selection of bars close by, and a short walk to Grand Central for subway. Two of our party were moved to the 25th floor on the last night due to a leak in their bathroom on 5th floor .................. Huge 2 bedroomed 2 bathroom apartment!!! One bedroom has 2 queens and the other has one king, also has large dining area, living area and larger ktichen. I would definitely give this a try next time - it really was huge

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation, in a nice location.”
Reviews.Author: chrisuk1000
Reviews.Content: Ironically the first thing I have to say is that there is fantastic food available from the Frontier diner, just 50 or so meters on East 39th street, out the door to the left. So breakfast was good but always out, this was because once again the hotel restaurant was under refurbishment. Why the hotels don't mention this before we book always annoys me. My second observation was that the staff are poorly informed when it comes to local advice. We received a lot of incorrect information and there was plenty of contradictions from various members of staff on reception, watch out for this. The location is very central and good, about 20 mins walk to the Empire State Building. Bathroom was nice and clean, it was small but quite functional. Room was okay, nice and quiet. The bed was very comfortable or maybe I was just so tired from the pace of New York! Cleaners were spot on, towels done etc. The internet was very expensive here. Shuttle bus runs from airport or a taxi is $50 flat rate. Did the bus vip tour 48 hour pass. Found it poor and very tying (afterall you had paid for it) actually, would say it was of limited use if exploring NY as I could have travelled around far better on my own with public transport.

Reviews.Title: “It couldn’t have been a nicer and warmer ‘welcome’.”
Reviews.Author: Hiiri
Reviews.Content: After the Shelburne Murray Hill Hotel turned us away, when we arrived after 12 hours of travelling and they realized only then, that I had asked for a smoking room, but told me ‘there are no smoking rooms in this hotel’ (see separate review for this hotel), they called The Eastgate and asked, if they could accommodate us. Donna, the manager in charge, could not have been more understanding and helpful. She did not even bother with all of the paperwork, just made sure that we got up to our room as quickly as possible and even called, when we had settled in to ask if everything was ok, or if we needed anything. The smoking rooms are on the 3rd floor, no view, but the room was large, clean and nicely furnished, with a separate sitting area and a desk. There are 3 built-in closets, enough room for two people. The bathroom was small, but of sufficient size and very clean. We had fresh bed linens every other day and the room was sparkling clean. The bed was very comfortable. The room had a little kitchen and there are good supermarkets right around the corner. The non-smoking rooms are just great - some with separate living rooms and when you're on a high floor, there is even a view. When you get there, don’t let the lobby fool you, it is small (but who needs a large lobby). It is a very affordable place in a convenient location and is quiet, even when you’re facing the front with 39th Street right outside your window. The subway is on 42nd street and that is an acceptable walk. Hertz Rental car is on the next block. I am a frequent traveller and service is very important to me. People like Donna make you feel right at home ! Thanks again and I will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Towering over them all”
Reviews.Author: Scubatripper
Reviews.Content: My review ratings aren't high, but that's a relative thing. We stayed two nights in the Eastgate Towers with 2 teenaged daughters. Two find a suite hotel at these prices in NYC is astounding, but to find one that is completely comfortable, relatively close to major area and fairly accessible to the subway is rare. It's fully functional, but completely devoid of atmosphere and style. The rooms are if anything, overly spacious given their Spartan furnishings. Walking into my one bedroom suite, I thought somebody might have removed furniture it was so empty. Everything looks a touch worn, but not dirty. The full kitchen was roomy, though could use lots of work. The wireless broadband was good, but at $13.95 a day, I felt a bit gouged. The fitness room was claustrophobic, but like the room, fully functional with 4 different cardio machines, dumbbells, and a Universal style workout station. Staff was accomodating, the cleaning staff did a good job. There's parking immediately adjacent to the building but you'll save money going two doors down to the Icon garage. It's about 4 blocks from the 42nd St/Grand Central subway stop. Lots of restaurants in the neigborhood. Overall, a fantastic value. Just don't think you're getting the Grand Hyatt, or even the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: zardoz
Reviews.Content: Hotels are expensive in New York so a hotel like this in a good location, with a mini-kitchen so you can make your own meals is a real find. The room was massive, the bed was massive and OK the decor isn't going to win any awards but who cares the room was clean. The kitchen saved us the cost of breakfast every day and delicious Wolfgang Puck coffee was supplied and replenished It is in a midtown location abut 10 minutes slow walk from the subway (either 33rd or 42nd Grand Central stations). The staff were helpful, the room was always kept clean for us and for the money I am well impressed. Great place for people who are in New York to see New York not spend loads of money on a fancy boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMB33
Reviews.Content: Just back from NY - stayed 5 nights in Eastgate. We booked 2 rooms and have no complaints at all. I would certainly recommend it. We paid €1,200 total for both rooms for 5 nights. Don't think you could get better value. Rooms were huge and kept very clean. Maid around every day. Location is v. good also. Plenty of bars and restaurants around. One thing I would say about the area is that restaurants seem to finish taking in people after 10:00pm. We were hoping for a quiet night around the hotel on Friday but could not get into a restaurant at 10:15pm. Had to go further into midtown to get one. Other than that you should have a very pleasant stay in the Eastgate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Families in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanDakman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights over easter with family - 2 adults, 2 children (7 & 4). Pluses: Great location , 10 minute walk to Grand Central. Had 1 bedroom apartment - 2 queen size beds in bedroom, galley kitchen with basic utensils (only used to prepare breakfast and keep beer cold), good sized living area. Front desk very helpful, had no toaster and lacking a towlel - called reception and itms delivered in 10 minutes. Doorman very helpful in getting taxis, helping with luggage, Minuses: Furniture/decor a bit dated but price for Manhattan and the space means who cares. Some areas needed a bit of closer cleaning attention (pots & pans, blinds, bathroom window) but if you are not a neat freak this will not concern you. No room service/restaurants, but plenty of options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service, Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: gingethecat21
Reviews.Content: Eastgate Hotel came as a very pleasant surprise. We chose budget and were thrilled with what we discovered. We were in a very large 1 bedroom apartment with 1 and half bathrooms and a kitchenette on the 22nd floor. The decor was a fraction tired but that paled into insignificance with the myriad of other benefits. The apartment was spotlessly clean and wonderfully comfortable. Excellent heating, very good shower and bathroom and daily room service. The Manager is a total professional and it followed down the ranks to his staff who were great. Nothing was ever a problem with any requests being dealt with swiftly and competently. We loved the location - 1 min to 3rd Ave and a bus up to Bloomies, 3 - 5 mins from Grand Central Staion and buses and subway in all directions. We frequently walked up to Park Ave and caught a bus up to the Met or the Gugenheim or Lincoln Center. Loved this accommodation and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: maco1976
Reviews.Content: Having booked the eastgate on price alone I looked at the reviews on here and found the reviews to pretty spot on when describing the hotel, The decor is pretty drab but the rooms are very big and really clean,ours was cleaned everyday, and the staff really helpful and polite, there is still no restaurant in the eastgate, but turn left out the hotel and there is a nice little deli on the corner of third ave for breakfasts, and then alot more eating places within walking distance. The empire state and grand central station and the chrysler are about 5 mins walk aswell. This is the ideal hotel for tourists as its a nice hotel and cheap enough for what you pay for (as you are out of the hotel for the majority of the time you are in NYC anyway) also there are safe deposit boxes free of charge and there is a hsbc bank across the way from the eastgate with plenty of cash machines.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Nickleics
Reviews.Content: As the other reviews have said, don't expect the finest luxury from the Eastgate Tower. Instead, expect a simple, functional hotel with polite staff, very large rooms, and clean facilities. We found the location to be excellent: just a few easy minutes walk to Grand Central terminal, and well in touch with all of the major tourist attractions. Inside the room, there was a large bed, two sofas, a small kitchen and bathroom, and plenty of wardrobe space. It is very much like moving in to an apartment in New York for a few days. For sure, it lacks the fancy reception and other facilities of more expensive hotels, but the size of your room and convenient location will be the envy of others.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic space”
Reviews.Author: orla_8
Reviews.Content: Ww stayed at the eastgate last july for a week ,my 2 children ,myself and my husband.Our 2 bed suite was ideal,sure the furniture is a little worn,the lobby is tiny ,no eat in facilities,however the value and space and comfort is amazing.Great location,you are in a real residential area of manhatten with a dagastinos shop around the corner its an upmarket grocery store,plus delis,drugstore,mcdonalds,newsagents ,drycleanes all within a minutes walk,try the chinese drycleaners i never knew clothes could be folded so neatly and so reasonably priced,there is also a nice pedicure/manicure /massage facial salon beside hotel-v reasonable....excellent value all round .

Reviews.Title: “HUGE rooms, amazing location, very comfortable. Will definitely be back AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: jdrake29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eastgate Tower Hotel with three other members of my family in 2006. It was the 1 bedroom suite. We liked it so much that for our trip in 2009 with my cousins (we were six people in total), we decided to book it again! This time the 2-bedroom suite, which is just like having your own little apartment in Manhattan. One bedroom had two queen beds, the other one had two twin beds. Each one had its own TV, apart from the TV in the living room, where there was a couch that turned into a huge sofa bed. We stayed in the 22nd floor after requesting a high floor (and the staff there is just amazing and polite). The elevators are not FAST, but they're definitely not slow. The kitchen was a huge help for breakfasts and a few dinners, instead of going out to eat. The suite also had two bathrooms, which was a big advantage having six people in the same room. The hotel is close to Grand Central, and there's diners and restaurants everywhere. We had breakfast the first day at the Frontier diner on 39th and 3rd. There's also a D'agostinos between 38th and 39th where we bought stuff to cook at the suite. Overall it was a very pleasant experience, and we'll definitely try to stay here next time if prices aren't too high. At first they WERE a bit high, so we booked another hotel. But just out of curiosity I checked a few weeks after, and we got a $195/night rate through hotels.com that's amazing for the date and type of room we got.

Reviews.Title: “Eastgate Tower never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: jesspinkfoot
Reviews.Content: My second stay here. Phoned ahead and booked and got a generous discount because I was returning (never hurts to ask). On arrival we found that at no extra cost we'd been upgraded to the top (25th floor), and we were given a room which was like an apartment, I suspect this building used to be an apartment block, in that it was very large. It was warm, spacious, well serviced and the westward looking windows had spectacular views. It would appear from reviews of other hotels that slow lifts are a problem, the lifts here are speedy if you need to know. Coffee machine worked, so excellent American coffee every morning. Breakfast can be obtained from the welcoming Scotty's diner on Lexington Avenue and E39th, just 2 blocks away. Be aware, this hotel has no breakfast or meal facilities, but you do get the whole of New York to choose from. Times Square is a 15 minute walk away, and we walked to Madison Square Garden (to see the Knicks) on 7th Avenue and 34th Street in 20 minutes. I feel safer walking around Manhattan than I do Cardiff or Swansea and definitely London, but it's still a very big city so keep your wits about you. A small negative would be that's its just a little out of the way, but not too bad, we did find a pizza place open at 1.30am around the block on 2nd Avenue, and lots of "local bars" like the FDNY bar on second or the black sheep on 3rd, and even the brilliant chill lounge on lexington.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel, friendly staff, not bad at all.”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Sam
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Priceline for $81 + tax. I was a bit concerned when the hotel came up as being categorized as a 2.5 star by Priceline standards. Most of the reviews on Tripadvisor, however, were very positive so I decided not to panic until I saw the place for myself. Firstly, the hotel itself is literally two blocks from the Westin W Tuscany on the east side of Manhattan. The neighbourhood is a safe and clean part of the city. The hotel isn't that close to the subway but in Manhattan "close" is a relatively thing because you can be at the subway in about 10 minutes. The hotel is a converted apartment building so each room has a kitchen and livingroom area. My suite had a king sized bed and was basically a bachelor apartment. The furniture (as most noted) is old and could be replaced. The room and hotel have everything you'd find at a regular hotel. There are plenty of towels, toilettries, pay per view movies, individually controlled heat/ac, etc. The bathroom was old but clean and well stocked. I snuck a peak at the fitness centre on the second floor and it had a universal weight machine and some cardio. Not bad. The checkin staff were REALLY friendly. They told me all about the hotel and local restaurants as part of their greeting. I will say, for Manhattan these rooms would be considered HUGE! Most hotels give you a cubby hole and call it a room. Since this place was an apt, you'll be much happier with the size, especially if you're travelling with a family/children. Having a kitchen is a definite plus if you're going to be in the city for a long period of time. I am rating this a 4 because it really was a great price for the City. However, as hotel standards go, this is probably a 2.5 or 3 star property since it really needs some updating. Definitely would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what it is”
Reviews.Author: latte4me
Reviews.Content: Just to be clear: this isn't a high-end hotel (ala Hilton, Westin, Hyatt) nor is it a chic boutique hotel. This was once an apartment building, which means that your room will be much bigger than the hotels here, and will include a small kitchen. However, you won't have some of the amenities from the hotels (turn-down, room service, overall fit and finish) but for a good place to stay in a great location, this can't be beat. Staff was very nice and helpful, and Grand Central is 4 blocks away. The only reason I gave it four stars instead of five is because it could use a little updating in the interior. I probably wouldn't stay here for business, but for a personal trip, it was just great.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Melz86
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Eastgate Tower in June 2008 for 3 nights. This hotel is clean, the staff are very friendly and best of all it is located right in Mid-Town. We walked everywhere! Shopping, restaurants, supermarkets, Times Square and the Empire State Building are all within short walking distance. Rooms are roomy - surprising as most New York Hotel rooms are notoriously small. The kitchen is a great convenience, with a full sized fridge and stove. Great for having a quick breakfast before heading out for a fun-filled day in New York. Beds are comfortable - which is great after a long day and all you want is to put your feet up. Would definitely stay here again if we had the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: Barsuchok
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. The location was superb and service very welcoming. We found room's facilities to be quite old, especially mirrors, but spacious, clean, good looking and with a great view. We've been in NYC during coldest period ever, but in Tower's room we always felt cosy and warm. Overall great price to value ratio!

Reviews.Title: “Really happy with The Eastgate Tower”
Reviews.Author: Willo1984
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 including 1 teenager, and 1 pre-teen, and we stayed in The Eastagte Tower for 7 nights in January of 2009. Our room was exactly as represented, a clean junior suite with lots of space, including a full kitchen. The hotel location is superb, 20 min walk to Times Sqare, 10 min to Grand Central Station for train or subway, 5 min to the East River at the United Nations. The hotel bar and restaurant were closed for rennovations, but there were listings in the room of local deli's and restaurants that delivered in. There is a 24 hr market and drugstore on the corner of the block, and Dunkin Donuts, McDonalds, Abitino's Pizza and the friendly and cheap Frontier Diner are 5 min away. In addition the hotel staff were very helpfull with suggestions for other restaurants and travel tips. Upon checkout our bill was exactly as agreed with no surprises.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: yedsa
Reviews.Content: We got a great time andeal at the Eastgate tower. It has a great location and such a good service. The room is very clean and well organized, really big for NYC. We have 2 kids and they really enjoy time at the hotel. My only concern is not having restaurant at hotel but you have multiple choies at the area.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: djh_lau_sat
Reviews.Content: Myself and partner stayed at the Eastgate Towers in Dec 08. Booked at 1 bed suite with Expedia, the cost was less than a small hotel room! The suite was on the 15th floor and had everything (and more) we could have needed. Lovely comfortable massive bed, TV in the lounge and bedroom, full en-suite bathroom and a seperate toilet, full kitchen - although we only used the fridge and dishwasher! The suite was always cleaned, the furniture whilst dated was functional and clean. The service was great one evening requested further pillows these were delievered to suite within 10 minutes, the reception arrange transfers for us back to the airport! There is no restuarant on site but there are so many places to get food this is no problem. We had no problems with the location walked to Grand Central Station in 5/10 mins, Empire State Building was 15 min walk. At the end of a busy day it was nice to get away from the noise and relax in space before going out for the night. Can not wait to go back - loved New York and loved the Eastgate Tower.

Reviews.Title: “A so so stay at the East Gate”
Reviews.Author: southDublingirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Eastgate Tower on a number of ocassions. This trip was for a family holiday. The hotel is in a great location and is wlaking distnace of a lot of attractions. I have to agree with one of the previous reviewrs and say that while the hotel is clean it felt a little grubby and is in need of a major refurb in terms of the decor. We stayed for 10 nights and the while the towels were changed daily the sheets weren't changed at all during our stay. On the first night the sofa bed in one of the rooms we had booked was full of crumbs and had no covers on it. We contacted the housekeeping staff and had to wait four hours for the bed to be made and cleaned so that someone could sleep in it. The noise from the corridor also made it hard to sleep at times. We were located in a room adjacent to what we think was a staff room and the door to this room was closed by a bang throughout the day and night which was quite irritating. The lifts were also slow and hard to get into at peak times. We found the front desk staff to be quite unhelpful. They gave us wrong advise on a number of ocassions. This was in relation to a range of things, for example on new years day they told us all of the major department stores were closed, which was in fact incorrect and theytwere all open. They gave wrong directions and seemed to try to push bus tours and booking these type of things through the front desk. This happened throughout our stay, we were careful to double check any information they gave us. When it came to checking out we found that the service of the front desk staff really failed. It took over an hour and a quarter to check out. One of the rooms was over charged, another was chraged out without telling the person having been told at check in that the credit card was a security thing only and that no chrages would be made until check out and the third rooms money was miss counted by the member of staff who found that they had made a mistake after very reluctantly agreeing to do a recount. The staff member at this point was quite difficult to deal with. It was a very bad way to finish off the stay. Overall I was very disappointed with my stay at the Eastgate. I am a frequent visitor to New York and don't intend to return to the East Gate,. I would also be very reluctant to reccomend it to a friend as we had so many problems. I had organised the stay in this hotel for a large group of family members and was very disappointed with the overall level of service we received.

Reviews.Title: “Very very very central”
Reviews.Author: mazaaron
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after being ripped off by a 'taxi driver' that charged us $95 dollars to get to the hotel. our fault.. we were warned !! We were pleasantly surprised at the hotel as there had been mixed reviews. It is a bit dated but that was the only thing that was a negative !! It is very clean, large rooms with kitchenette. staff are helpful and friendly and when we had a minor problem it was resolved within minutes. the bellhop, patrick, in particular was excellent. the hotel is central and everywhere is within walking distance, underground or taxi. i would say if you are travelling at peak holiday time like we wer, be prepared to queue (get in line) tip... pay the extra to be 'fast tracked' up the empire state building unless you dont mind waiting for two hours. all in all we had a good stay and would definitely use the hotel if we were to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place”
Reviews.Author: BrianK02
Reviews.Content: This place is really brilliant. Its got a good location between 2nd and 3rd avenue so about a 20-30 min stroll to times square and 10 mins from 6th avenue shops. We had a 1 bedroom suite on the 10th floor. It was spotless and warm and the sheets were changed every day along with fresh coffee. There's a small kitchen but it has a cooker fridge and microwave and a large lounge and 2 big ( and comfy) double beds in the bedroom.it also had 2 bathrooms and 2 TVs which with 2 kids was very handy and a convertible bed settee which wasn't too uncomfortable either. And the downside...I cant think of any!! There is a nice gym so take your trainers All in all highly recommended. Id definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aka_sheep
