Reviews.Content: what a great friendly hotel! Carole was the most welcoming of the staff however all were friendly. The hotel room was clean tidy, Very spacious and bathroom was good size. the hotel is in a good location and walking distances of all attractions if you don't mind a 20-30 min walk. good eating places too. try the black sheep for snack and the frontier for breakfast. the resturant was closed but definately going under refurb as i found out by pressing the wrong button in the lift and ending up in the basement. the staff were vey helpful and luggage can be stored. safe deposit boxes are giving free of charge. I felt totally safe walking around anytime. tip : take the shuttle bus from 42nd street to airport $15 bargin

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: thenutkin
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find acceptable accommodations in New York for less than $300 per night. $200 is a steal. So when we secured a junior suite at the Eastgate for less than $150, it was too good an opportunity to pass up. Yes, the decor needs a bit of freshening. I was told that starting in January, the place would be undergoing renovations. Meanwhile, the furniture is serviceable and the space is very generous. All is clean and the beds are triple-sheeted so you won't see the blanket at all. There was a full kitchen and a comfortable seating area with sofa, chair and excellent lighting. We only had a view of another building but that meant there was minimal street noise. Bathroom was small but clean. The location is very convenient for most things. We had to take a train leaving from Grand Central Station which is just a short walk away. There are plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby. Our one peeve was that we could not turn off the heat. Thankfully, the window opened so the "fresh" air coming in cooled things off to a comfortable temperature. There is virtually no lobby. All the workers we encountered were friendly and helpful. We even parked in the garage in the building. This cost us $34 per 24 hours including all taxes. Not bad for this expensive city. We'll be interested to see how the renovations affect the pricing. Meanwhile, like other Affinia properties that we've tried, this is a well-run establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!! Will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: AJCairns
Reviews.Content: Quite simply a wonderful stay at the Eastgate. There was 5 of us, my husband and I and our 3 small children. We had a 2 bdrm suite with massive lounge, dining table, kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms. All clean and spacious. Others have complained about the decor, but I'm not in NYC to critique hotel furnishings. Everything was functional and clean, which is all I wanted. It must surely be the BEST VALUE in NYC. The location was great, neighbourhood has lots of good restaurants (Patsy's Pizzeria on 3rd Avenue is great). I have no complaints at all about this hotel. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: RSlicker
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 nights stay at the Eastgate. Overall it was "OK", as in a five and a half out of ten sort of way. Good points? 1. Location, and close proximity to eating and drinking establishments and the sights. 2. Warm spacious rooms with comfortable (though small) beds. 3. VFM (allegedly) - even at a discounted £200 a night. Not-so-good points? 1. The staff (with the exception of Carole on the front desk) are a bit "precious" and not naturally receptive. 2. The constant "whirring" of the elevator through the night is a pain in the butt. 3. The bedrooms, bathrooms and kitchen haven't been decorated for about 15 years. 4. The reception area is the size of a broom cupboard. 5. The restaurant on the ground floor - seemingly undergoing a refurb. since June ! - has actually gone bust. Just tell the truth about this. Overall: 5.5/10 = A promising attempt in some areas, though undoubted room for improvement (and attitudes).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place - will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: DuiDublin
Reviews.Content: It was my first time to NYC for shopping, and I booked the Eastgate Towers a week before I flew out due to a mix up with a previous booking. I was a bit shocked to find that the price was almost half of what I had booked in another hotel only 2 Avenue's down and EastGate Towers was amazing for the price. For the week in NYC I paid only 672 Euros!!! I had an upgrade to a junior suite upon arrival at no extra cost, and the Staff at the front desk were so so very helpful - Morgan did my upgrade. Staff are polite and very helpful - and always able to deliver prompt service when I needed it. I'm a bit of a clean freak when it comes to accom overseas, but I had nothing to complain about during my stay. Some of the floors however are smoking floors so you can smell a bit of it from the stair wells ... but then you're not spending more than a minute in the hallways waiting for the lift so it's no biggie. Around the corner from the hotel is a load of places to eat and drink and Frontiers cafe is serving up the best pancakes I've had in years ... two mornings I had to go back just for the coffee and pancakes ... Dunkin Donuts is a bit further down the street, as is a whole range of other places to grab a bite to eat. There's a NYC Steakhouse about 10 minutes walk from the front door, and also a ton of cocktail bars along the way into Times Sqaure. I've already had a look at my next dates in NYC and the rooms available in May. I'll will certainly be booking another stay there. The rooms are huge, the fridge is massive, the bathrooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: AGorthy
Reviews.Content: I was a little fearful of what to expect, this hotel was FAR cheaper than 2.5 star hotels we looked at. I looked at other traveler reviews and concur with what most say. These are very roomy rooms, we stayed in the Junior queen suite, which had a queen bed and a sofa bed. The decor is not great but not bad, I think the room looks better in real life than in the travelers' photos. Our room was comfortable and clean. There is tons of closet space and room to spread out. Our room had one large closet and two smaller closets, one dresser and two nightstands. There was a small kitchen with sink, stove, microwave, toaster, coffee maker and dishes, glassware, silverware and cookware and a table with two chairs. The elevators were reasonably quick for an older building and we had no problems at check-in/check-out. This hotel also had larger suites that could accommodate slightly larger groups of friends. I only had two fairly minor complaints, the location, though not bad, was not really near anything of interest, we were a 15 minute walk to most things, not bad. The other issue is even though the heater said cool and off, it was spewing out hot air and we had not control of this. We had to crack the windows (which is all they would do for safety reasons) and cover the vents with pillows to keep the room at a comfortable level. For the price paid, the space and quality, I would definitely stay here and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing break”
Reviews.Author: HarryAngstrome
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel. Initial impressions were of a very average NY hotel with not much atmosphere, dated decor etc. We stayed 6 nights and it soon became home, warm and welcoming, plenty of space in our room (14th floor) facilities and friendly staff. It is located within easy reach of the centre and Gr Central for subway. We had a few meals in Frontiers on the corner and had no complaints (hotel restaurant is closed). We would use this hotel again as it wasn't bad value, particularly given proximity to city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasKB
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is great eay walking distance from everything. Hotel itself was not like the photos, the rooms were out of date and needed modernising, and there was a lingering smell everywhere. The room size is really good, but the decor dated. Only 2 lifts as well, so sometimes a bit of a wait. i would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the eastgate tower”
Reviews.Author: paula099
Reviews.Content: first time visitors to new york. just returned from 10 nights at eastgate tower. hotel really great. pleasant speedy check in, great sized room (junior suite) with adequate kitchen. House keeping was good and everybody very friendly. Location just perfect, fairly quiet but close to grand central station for every where that you want to go. Some great eating houses/bars within 100 yds. an earlier review mentioned that there was no safe in the room. on enquiring at reception they gave us a safe of our own in a room behind the front desk. (no charge at all, unless you lost the key) overall i would stay there again as we were very comfortable. ps. great irish bar just around corner for good food and drinks. (out of hotel, turn left to top of street, turn left again and it is just down there on your left) also great chinese restuarant - out of hotel, take road opposite, at end of road turn right and it is just down there on your right.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need a kitchen”
Reviews.Author: Fuzby
Reviews.Content: I recently visited NYU to give an invited lecture, and my hosts booked me at the Eastgate, which is a convenient place to stay if visiting the NYU medical center, just a few blocks away. The hotel has an odd layout. It is 25 floors tall, but each floor has only 7 rooms, all located within a few feet of the elevators. My room itself was spacious, and had a full kitchen complete with 4-burner stove and oven, pots & pans, microwave, and under the counter refrigerator. There was also plenty of closet and dresser space for the 'extended stay' traveler. But the bathroom was so tiny it was a trick to close the door while in it, and the overall decor was pretty tired. Bed was fine; ancient heating system had two temperatures: Arctic or Amazon Rain Forest. But the noisy fan tended to block out street noise, which was a plus. No food available at the hotel. Overall, I'd pick this for an extended stay, but for a normal business trip it was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: moll23
Reviews.Content: Just home after 7 nights at the Eastgate tower it was great . The staff were very helpful , after booking a room with two beds when we got to our room it had only one bed it took staff only 30 minutes to sort it and move us to new room . the room was big with kitchen and it was very clean . The hotel is very quite at night. All in all our holiday was made all the better by staying at the eastgate.

Reviews.Title: “Definite recommendation”
Reviews.Author: AliSmith
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was great. It was quiet (which is quite something in New York!) with a big room, clean and tidy. The kitchen we had with our suite was perfect for our needs (breakfast each day before setting out to explore the town). The staff were pleasant and helpful. The area round the hotel was safe and non-threatening, and local shops and restaurants were useful as well. And not far to walk to Grand Central, Empire State, Broadway, 5th Avenue, etc. All in all an excellent choice, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends looking to stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “it was okay”
Reviews.Author: mujipor
Reviews.Content: So i stayed here for 5 nights with my partner, we paid about £850. upon arrival, the check in seemed rushed, and so we got our room on the 10th Floor. It was a non smoking room, and we have booked a smoking room. So had to go downstairs to check in again, and we got a room on the 12th floor. The room was okay, average. The lobby is more fancier than the rooms. Housekeeping was good too. The only negative thing i have to say is that there is not a proper lock, and even though we had the sign to say do not disturb they tried to come in. And there is no safe in the room. Also, the restaurant is getting refurbished and we were told that we could order in food from nearby restaurants. However, upon check out, we were charged with the telephone calls (local calls) which seems a bit unfair. We also asked to check out later at 3pm rather than noon and Donna was very accomodating, they would have ususally charged but it was waived. We were also able to use the computer in the lobby where you can check in and print your boarding passes for free. We also wanted a cab to get us to the Newark airport from the hotel, but the concierge recommended private hire, it was 68 dollars in total plus toll which was really good. Location wise, i would say its a 20 minute walk from times square and empire state building (not 10mins!) It was in a quiet area, theres a 24 hour pharmacy across the road, and a mcdonalds and other shops. Overall it was okay, but I probably wouldn't stay there again. The

Reviews.Title: “All good!”
Reviews.Author: Chicklet_7
Reviews.Content: The Eastgate Tower Suites is a winner - a great location in Murray Hill close to the Chrysler and Grand Central and an easy walk to midtown, Fifth Ave etc and Central Park! Staff were welcoming and rooms very generous! Great view from the 19th floor too. Clean and comfortable, just what you need, a great base to explore the city from. We booked through Expedia and this hotel looked by far the best we could get for our budget and we were not disappointed. A good value hotel that is pleasant and welcoming - with huge rooms!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jax11Sydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eastgate Tower hotel for 6 days and thought it was a great experience. We arrived to the hotel early in the morning and they were kind enough to check us in straight away. There were 3 of us and we were provided with a junior suite which was huge and cheap (thanks to Expedia) so we were very impressed. The room had a lounge, a kitchen and a great sized bathroom. In terms of position, it was perfect. The hotel was close enough to everything. We stayed at another hotel for the second week of our stay which was closer to Times Square and it was too noisy. The area Eastgate is in is quiet, close to Central Station and great shops while being within walking distance to Times Square. There were great little terrace homes typical to the nice areas of New York surrounding the hotel too. We loved our stay at Eastgate and will return next time we are in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Eastgate a great deal!!”
Reviews.Author: Camcan101
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Eastgate after landing at Midday at JFK and arrived before check in time. I had called prior to arriving as I realised that we would probably arrive before official check in and I wanted to ensure that we could check in early if needed. The answer was yes and when we got there true to their word they were ready for us to check in. We are a family of four, two children a girl of nine and boy of thirteen. We checked into our 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite on the 9th floor and were surprised at how large the suite was, absolutely amazing!! Each bedroom had it's own TV, it was clean and obviously very well kept and. On arrival we put our bags down and hit the streets almost immediately, stopping at the front desk to ask about places that we wanted to visit. Jenifer directed us to this fantastic camera shop (B&H) so off we went, great tip. The staff were friendly and we stopped daily to ask for guides on how to get to different places and even got tips on where to eat, fantastic deli called Sarges on 3rd Avenue, great deli ‘ The Frontier’ on the corner of 3rd for breakfast and great Sushi on 2nd Avenue. The location of the hotel is great, the UN is just a few blocks away and conveniently this is where you pick up tour buses. It is clean and has a very cosy feel. It is not lavish, but is well kept and the space in the rooms is fantastic. The lobby is small but pleasant and the staff are very amicable. Special thank you to Donna who checked us in and out. If you want a hotel that is very ornate and in the middle of Time Square you will have to pay a great deal more. The Easgate is great value for money and is still within good distance of most things in the city. I have attached some pictures to help you with your decision, hope they help. We all enjoyed it immensely…highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: baur24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and found the rooms basic but clean. The location was central and was a good base for sightseeing. 15 mins walk from Times Square. Rooms had kitchenette which was useful for food from nearby deli. Found a really good deli on Lexington and 41 st. - great breakfast rolls and bagels. Staff in hotel were in the main helpful but some seemed a bit put out. We found other USA guests were more forthcoming with guidance than hotel staff. The reception had a free safety deposit service which was a bit of a palaver and would have preferred something in the room. The bar/restaurant next to the hotel was under refurbishment so can't comment on this. The area seemed safe but some nearby restaurants closed early.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bill when you leave!”
Reviews.Author: Ann_Onimme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is generally OK but getting shabby - good for an extended stay as there is a kitchenette, basic but functional and clean. Some of the staff are a bit surly (as in "customers are a nuisance"). The hotel book in the room said that calls to 1-800 and 1-888 numbers are free for the first 20 minutes. On checking out I saw that every call I made was billed at $ 2.66 (even for two minutes) - when I queried it they showed me a bit of paper that said $ 1.50 for the first twenty minutes which did not match the charges built into their computer system. (By the way WiFi is charged at $10 per day while many other hotels provide it free - in any case the signal was not strong enough in the higher floors). Because of the discrepancies the reception called the duty manager who did not explain or apologize and in the end after making me wait re funded me the calls. I reported this to the HQ of Affinia who did not bother to acknowledge or reply. Suggest you check your bill for unexpected charges before you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: 95Braves
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this wonderful hotel. Perferctly located within walking distance of so many things. We arrived and were greeted by very helpful and courteous staff. We were quickly checked in and went to our room. They were completely full and unable to accommodate our request for two beds, however they told us to come down the next morning and they would take care of us. The rooms were nice, nothing special but had everything you need. The next morning we went down and they told us we could move to a new room later that morning. We told them we were leaving and would be back for quite a while and the reply was "no worries, we will move your items for you". When we returned late that evening, I was surprised to see they hadn't missed one thing, even the items in the fridge. Everyone was very nice and informative. We asked for different suggestions, directions and other thing. We always received great information. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: HeritageMakers
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of hotel reviews before selecting Eastgate Tower Hotel for our 8 day stay in NYC. This was our first time traveling to NYC and I read a lot of bad reviews on various hotels throughout the websites. So of course, this made me nervous in booking a discount hotel. Our entire stay at Eastgate Tower was wonderful. We had NO complaints. The room was large and clean. There was no problems with the AC, elevator, staff, etc. Our room was cleaned daily with plenty of fresh towels put out each day. We never heard noises out in the halls or through the walls. I can't say enough about the staff. We stopped at the front desk every day, sometimes twice a day to ask questions, directions, recommendations, etc. They never failed us. The employees went out of their way to help us with our questions, look up information on our their computer and recommend great restaurants to eat at. On my next trip to NYC, I plan on staying at the Eastgate Hotel. I have already recommended the hotel to friends. Our first trip to NYC was wonderful. We loved your city!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room - 30 years worth of dirt”
Reviews.Author: LAmonkey
Reviews.Content: My husband booked here because it is near his NY office and the hotel he usually uses is no longer giving him a frequent-user discount. I came several days after him and found the room to be pretty gross. It is in severe need of renovation - the shabby industrial carpeting had a trimming of decades worth of dirt and dust at the floorboards, the furniture is cheap and shabby, and there was mold growing on the ceiling above the shower. I would not walk barefoot on the carpet. We got booked into the W Tuscany hotel the next day - more expensive, but 10 times the quality for the extra money. No, I did not tell the staff the reason for our sudden departure - the place needs a complete overhaul and that can't happen in one day.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Wulsylovers
Reviews.Content: Wow! From the moment my wife and I stepped in, to the moment we checked out, the service was top notch and our room very clean. We stayed 4 nights here and the location is quiet, safe and within walking distance of anything you need to enjoy in the Big Apple. The king size bed was very comfortable, the bathroom spotless, and had a kitchenette complete with cutlery and dishes. We received a call the evening we arrived from the front desk asking if there was anything they could do for us to make us more comfortable, and if so to please let them know. We also received a call the day before we left confirming our check-out time and also asking if there was anything we needed. Certainly one of the best hotels I've had the pleasure to stay in. We would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanQueen22
Reviews.Content: We travelled to NYC for a short 2 night girls weekend away. We arrived at the Eastgate Tower Suites and were amazed at how cute this hotel was. The lobby was decorated beautifully and the staff were very friendly. To our surprise they upgraded us the a bigger room. The room was clean and HUGE! It had a full Kitchen, dining room area, bedroom with 2 beds and pull out couch. There were 6 ladies all together and this room gave us plenty of room to get ready and sleep. The location was great. It is a short cab ride to Time Square, 5th Avenue, and all the shopping areas. We walked there as well and the walk was not too bad at all. It was also in a great location for all the hot Manhattan Night Clubs. Next time I visit NYC I will definitley be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem for downtown nyc”
Reviews.Author: incrediblepie
Reviews.Content: If i were to travel for any reason to NYC, this would be my first choice for accomodation. Its only 2 and half stars but thats only a number! The rooms are huge, the kitchenette basic but has fridge, sink, microwave, plates cups, microwave, coffee maker etc. The hotel is not shiney-new and there was no breakfast room but its on a par with hotels costing double in the area. The hotel clean, functional, big for NYC and v central. A couple of blocks from Chrysler and across the road from Hertz rental station, whihc can be hand for leaving the city. The staff were v friendly and discreet...dare I say even hands-off.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a large group or family”
Reviews.Author: Tanastalin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eastgate Tower at the end of June, and it was the perfect place for us. We booked two one bedroom suites for a total of 8 people and had more than enough room. We arrived on a red eye into JFK and showed up at the hotel at about 7 a.m. and they allowed us to get into one of the rooms (the other one wasn't ready yet), which allowed us to catch a couple hours of sleep before we headed out to explore the city. (We also had a late flight home and were more than happy to hold all our luggage until we left). We were pleasantly surprised that there was a full bath and a 1/2 bath (sink & toilet) in each room. We went to Gristedes and bought some groceries (there's one a couple blocks away) and ate breakfast in the room every morning. The kitchen only has the essentials (including a toaster) but everything was clean and in working order. We ordered in pizza one night and had plenty of room for 8 to sit (4 chairs at the dining table plus a desk and chair, and a chair in the living room and the sofa which turns into a bed). Our rooms were also on the 18th and 23rd floors and had views of the city (although the Empire State building was blocked by another building). The hotel itself is located in a mostly residential area (Murray Hill) and there aren't any hotels immediately adjacent to it, so it is fairly quiet. However, the closest subway station is at Grand Central, about a 10 min. walk, which doesn't seem bad until you have to walk back to the hotel from there after already walking around all day! Of course you can always catch a cab to avoid walking, but we are cheap and walking affords you to see more of the city anyways! If you are traveling to the city with a large number of people or a family, I would highly recommend you check into the Eastgate Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch!”
Reviews.Author: bglewandowski
Reviews.Content: Let me say the good things first: spacious room, attentive bellman, great valet parking, location close enough to Grand Central and subways. Okay now for the part I don't like to write about but this stay started off as a complete disaster. We arrived for the 3pm check-in time that the hotel stated. We were told it would be 20 minutes more as the room was not ready. The bellman took our luggage up to the room while we went and sat outside. We checked back 25 -30 minutes later and were told the room still wasn't ready. The front desk person asked housekeeping to call her when it was done. She explained that the previous party had stayed for a late checkout... not sure why we had to suffer though... We checked back bit after 4 pm after sitting outside on the table and chairs next to the abandoned restaurant that once occupied the hotel building. When we went in and asked, the front desk person still hadn't heard about the room. She called housekeeping and they said that they didn't know if it was done and that the front desk should send the bellman to check on it. The bellman was no where to be seen at this point so we had to wait until 4:30 when he went up and gave the okay. We received our key-cards and headed to the room. Arriving in the room we found it to be dated but fairly clean and very spacious with nice city views... room 17 G. However, even though we booked a "two queen beds and another queen bed suite", we got a "two queen bed with two twin bed suite." We even had Expedia call for us to verify that was what we would get but we didn't end up with it after all. The front desk explained that it can not guarantee a room type even though an Eastgate reservation person had guaranteed this to Expedia. We had to have a portable twin bed brought up so no one had to sleep in the living room. It was at this point we noted that the air conditioning in the twin bed room did not work, so we placed another call to the front desk and they said they would send up maintenance. They arrived within the half-hour and looked at the a/c unit. He determined it was a broken condenser and said the entire unit would be replaced but he had a new one. A short while later he returned with the massive unit and began to do the replacement. We were unable to unpack as this room was the scene of some major construction! About 30 minutes later he determined that the new unit was also bad and decided to try one more unit. The dinner hour was upon us and we were starving... but we had no idea if we would be keeping this room as it was partially un-airconditioned and it was 90 degrees outside. After waiting another 15 minutes or so, I went down to the front desk to discuss the general suckiness of our visit thus far and to speak with a manager. She arrived and her name I believe was Donna. She was very nice and helpful. She said she was willing to move us to another similar suite (2 queens, 2 twins) but it was on the 13th floor which was the smoking floor. We weren't too thrilled by that. She asked us to come see it and smell it with her as she felt most people don't smoke much anymore. We went her and it was nice and did not smell that much and had more up-to-date kitchen appliances. At that point, my cell phone rang... it was my wife and she informed me that the new a/c unit was in and working, so we went with Donna the manager to confirm. It worked great! Unfortunately it was now 7pm which was 4 hours from our scheduled check-in. After unpacking, we got to eat and proceeded on our late evening with the kids who were antsy and cranky now. Things seemed to be progressing... at least until I laid upon the most uncomfortable and squeaky twin bed I had laid upon since my childhood. Fortunately the days events had tired me and I slept well. The next morning, we all showered and tossed our towels on the floors in the bathrooms. We returned from a theatre matinee around 6 pm, ready to shower and go out to dinner at a nearby restaurant. Showers were put on hold because there was not one single towel in our room! So, of course, I called the front desk. They said they would tell housekeeping. 30 minutes later, no towels, so I called again. Again they said they would be right up. Another 30 minutes passed as I was about to reach for the phone again, the towels arrived... but there were only 3 of them... for 6 people. I asked the house keeping person why and they told me that they had run out of towels. Weird. They have tons of extra a/c units but lack towels? Well, some of us skipped showers and I went to the front desk on the way to dinner. I told them about how silly the towel situation and they promised more towels. When we returned from dinner, there were stacks of towels in both bathrooms and an extra big stack in the living room. I guess they bought more??? Anyway, After that our remaining three days were quiet and went smoothly. 2 of 4 nights/days were just fine.. is 50% okay for a visit that cost nearly $2k? I am not sure yet....

Reviews.Title: “BIg Room”
Reviews.Author: BillyPinky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and the whole stay was a pleasure. Staff were friendly and was allowed to book in early ( 11.30am). We had a 2 person studio on the 13th floor, the room was large and clean with a good a size bed ,small kitchen and a small but clean bathroom. Good base to see New York. Don’t really have a bad word to say about this hotel but as the reviewer before me said, if you don’t have the money for a hotel in Time Square, this is a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Bit dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: Calafort
Reviews.Content: We were on the top floor - 25E. It's a large "suite" - queen sized bed - in a large room with ensuite bath/shower & toilet. There is a kitchenette off the main room, and a sofa bed which makes up into a quite comfortable double bed. The hotel is showing its age! Carpets and general decor are grubby. When we were there (4th.to 8th. July) the restaurant was closed for renovations. Not a big problem for us as we intended eating out anyway. Located on East 39th Street, the location is quite good. Maybe a 15 minute walk to Time Square. Accommodation in NY is ridiculously expensive - so we paid 4 star prices for this 2 star accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye480
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay. I shopped around quite a while to find a hotel that was within our budget that appeared clean. This was the perfect place! Our room was spotless. Sure, the furniture was a little outdated, but who cares, it was clean! We traveled with our 13 year old son in a jr. suite and had more than enough room. The bellman brought our bags up and immediately asked if we needed to have the sofa bed made up for the evening. Within 5 minutes the doorbell rang (my son got the biggest kick out of the fact that our hotel had a doorbell) and housekeeping arrived with the bed linens. The entire staff, from the bellman to the front desk to the maids were all very friendly and helpful. They made us feel like we were staying in a 5 star hotel. Great little neighborhood that was close enough to walk to things, but yet just far enough away to be a little more quiet (if quiet is possible in NYC). We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it anyone.

Reviews.Title: “BRILLIANT CHOICE!”
Reviews.Author: fergul
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Eastgate Tower from 2nd June 08. We loved it. The best location, safe, even for walking out on an evening. Just around the corner from Grand Central Station! We stayed in a studio. Ok the funiture is a little dated but the room was spotless and clean towels, toiletries and coffee replaced as soon a we used them. Great to have little kitchen, table etc. Our only regret was not asking for a higher floor. We were on the 7th but better views from higher up. The reception staff were very helpful and welcoming. They gladly helped us with any information we required. Used internet in lobby. We would recommend it to anyone and would use it again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but worn”
Reviews.Author: cran
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio for 3 nights during the working days for about $300 a night. The location is in Midtown close to Grand Central Terminal, which is the closest subway station and about 6-9 minutes depending on the subway entrance. The UN is a few blocks away, and there are many restaruants and small markets nearby. Eastgate Tower is a 25 story tower with just 5 units on each floor. The lobby is cramped, but the staff is courteous, and we were able to get a nonsmoking room that we had previously requested. The elevators are small, but during our stay, waiting for elevators was not a serious problem. We stayed in a unit on the upper half of the tower in a unit with a view of the high rise next door that was about 20-25 feet away, so there was no view. The first thing you notice about the unit is that it is spacious but worn. Except for the bathroom and kitchen, it is a relatively large unit. However, the place seriously needs a new paint job inside, new carpeting, new vinyl in the kitchen, new tile in the bathroom and newer furnishings. Also the unit can use sound proofing from the 3 elevators in the center, and also use newer and quieter air conditioning units. Water pressure was good, the hot water was hot, the air conditioning and kitchen appliances worked. There were no bugs, but there was a strong pesticide odor in the kitchen cabinets. The rooms were cleaned everyday, but only as to what the eye could easily see. For example the inside of the refrigerator was relatively clean, but there was a thick layer of dust on top of the refrigerator. Same about the towel racks. The carpet was dark and likely hiding a lot of dirt, and we did not dare to look under the bed. Pros: Spacious, good water pressure, has kitchen appliances, and relatively safe neighborhood. Cons: Visibly worn interior, beds are sagging in the middle, noisy elevators and air conditioner. Was it worth the money? It depends on what you can get for $300 a night in midtown in June. It's likely a toss up.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, would definately go back”
Reviews.Author: Kaz_from_Manc
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in while in New York. The rooms are very spacious, which is unusual for one of the less expensive hotels in New York. The rooms are clean and have walk in closets!! The kitchen includes a fridge which is handy for hot NY weather, but we didn't use it to cook. The location is good, only 15 minutes walk from Times Square and 5 minutes from Grand Central subway station. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Nasty”
Reviews.Author: Moecamel
Reviews.Content: This review is for the hotel on 39th street. The staff was very nice and the service was great. The only thing I had a problem with was the rooms. The rooms were old and the furniture was from the 80's and the stove from the 60's...... seriously. There haven't been any renovations there since the 80's for sure. I would not recommend this hotel. The location isn't that great either. For the price, you're better off staying somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Eastgate Tower”
Reviews.Author: TravelDuoSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights. Took a $50 cab ride from JFK since it was night & didn't know where we were going. As we requested, we got a room on an upper floor, in a quiet corner. So our windows faced the adjacent classy condo building. We didn't mind, it was quiet! We had a junior suite and it was huge! King bed, 3 closets, sofa, chairs, desk, bureau, full kitchen, full bath with tub. A cousin from Queens said, "this is bigger than most Manhattan apartments". There were several local groceries within a few blocks to pick up supplies to have breakfast in our room. When we reported a burned out light bulb and a broken coffee maker, both were replaced by housekeeping immediately. The king sized bed was comfy and the entire unit was very clean. We were happy to find toiletries and hair dryer provided in the bath. The neighborhood felt friendly and calm, even at night, yet an easy 10 min walk to Grand Central terminal. The staff was friendly and helpful. It suited all our needs, we definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BeckyW2770
Reviews.Content: The Eastgate Tower is not plush, but it is very effective. We had a double suite, had two queen beds in one room, and twin beds in second bedroom. Two bathrooms, which was a very nice surprise. There were six of us staying for a week and it was PERFECT for us. With all the running around, the family room was nice to unwind before jetting out to dinner. The kitchen is small, but so what? Tons of takeout places in the neighborhood which we did a couple of nights b/c we were just too exhausted after taking in all the sites. Very close to Grand Central Terminal and bus routes take you anywhere! I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay - peaceful yet central location”
Reviews.Author: Borislondon
Reviews.Content: This is my fouth trip to New York and this is my favorite hotel by a long shot. I've stayed at more expensive places - but this place was just perfect. My studio was on the 21st floor with a fantastic view of the skyscrapers, and the coffee maker, coffee & fridge really was a great perk. Nice to have a relaxing morning coffee in your room before hitting the town. It was clean and very quiet in a nice leafy nieghborhood with lots of restaurants nearby and Grand Central a quick stroll away. I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cristyc63
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from a four night stay. I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. The concierge and front desk staff were very accomodating and helpful. There were many restaurants (mcdonalds, dunkin donuts, pub style restaurants, to higher end restaurants) within a short walking distance. the studio included a small microwave, small fridge with freezer, coffee maker with coffee....and small stovetop. The room was a good size, with two double beds, loads of closet space, and a decent sized bathroom. The room was clean and well supplied with clean towels/shampoo etc. The location was excellent, in murray hill. I truly don't have a single complaint about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: jimdrw
Reviews.Content: Eastgate Tower is only a 10 minute walk to Grand Central which gets you everywhere in the city. The hotel is surrounded by all kinds of restaurants, delis, and convenience stores. For the $$$, you may not find a better deal in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but perfect to see the city”
Reviews.Author: bull4titans
Reviews.Content: Took my wife to New York for a suprise birthday weekend in April. My only concern in getting a room in Manhattan at such a relatively great price is that it would not be clean, but I was way off and the place was spotless on the inside. Check in: The lobby was small but nicely decorated. We arrived at the hotel about 10 am and check in was not until 3. The front desk and bell staff was very helpful . They stored our bags while we hit the town and gave us some transportation tips to get around. We got back for check in at about 8 that night and once again, everyone was very friendly and efficient. The room: We booked a studio suite and it was exactly what we needed. It was larger than a normal hotel room anywhere else in the country and had a small kitchenette with table and four chairs. Once again, it was very clean. The furniture and the bathroom were a little outdated, but who cares. We were only in the room to sleep, shower, etc. . We were out spending the money that we saved by staying there. Noise was not a problem at all when the windows were closed. Getting around: We had a really easy time getting around. We did alot of walking but mostly by choice. Grand central station was only a 8-10 minute walk and there is, of course a bagel shop and starbucks on the way. We purchased a $7.50 one day fun pass for the subway and that was well worth it. To keep it simple, you can stay on the green line and be within reasonable walking distance to any major sites and shopping in manhattan. All in all, if you want a clean, convenient , and roomy place to stay but don't want to pay for the Hyatt, then this is a good place. We were very happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: jodonahue
Reviews.Content: Booked two junior suites from Princeline. When we arrived at the hotel they did not have our reservation due to difficulties with their system and Princline's. Therefore, they upgraded us to an executive suite. It was HUGE. It had two bedrooms, each two beds, two baths, full living room, dining room and full kitchen. It had an incredible amount of closet space. The furnishing were rather dated, but the rooms were very clean. We would definitely stay there again. It is about 5 blocks from the subway (Grand Central Station) which can be a hike after a day of shopping and loaded with packages, but it was not bad. Also enjoyed the neighbor, safe and had good restaurants. All around good experience.

Reviews.Title: “depends on your point of view”
Reviews.Author: Trev_Karen
Reviews.Content: I think this review could depend on your point of view. The price was reasonable.....for manhattan island, but for that price some could expect more. We stayed here as the last part of our honeymoon round the world trip and did so trying to get the best value for money for the remaining part of our budget. It was by far the most reasonably priced hotel in the district, the staff could not have been more helpful and the location was within easy walk of most that you would want to see or visit, and we did walk everywhere! (Although I would also recommend the city bus tour which enables you to cram all the necessary sightseeing in whenever time limits exist. On the minus side, the hotel room was very, very basic and very warm, what you would expect to find in a 2 star holiday in Crete for instance. There was no air conditionng and you couldn't open the window as the noise was 24hours a day. Would I go back...yes but I would still feel ripped off for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sparkling08
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at Eastgate towers because they were one of a few hotels I could get under $200 a night. How well my money was spent! We were luckily given an early check in after arriving from a red eye flight. Our room was clean, spacious and quiet. The hotel is situated in a quiet area, only 10 minute walk from Grand Central station. A good station to be near as it is easy to connect to most lines. There are plenty of restaurants nearby and also some supermarkets for self catering. As first time visitors to NY, we were out til late every night and felt totally safe walking back each night. Yes the room was a little outdated but as soon as they refurbish the price goes up and ultimately I care little about the colour of the walls when I'm asleep! Definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We'll never stay anywhere else again!”
Reviews.Author: AphroditeCt
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 4 yr old and I stayed at the Eastgate this past weekend, the hotel had been recommended by a friend. On our last trip to NYC we stayed at the Paramount, which was more expensive than Eastgate. Our room at the Paramount was so small that if one person had to move about the room, the others had to sit on the bed so there'd be a free path. We imagined they had to build the room around the bed, because there was no other way to get it i there. So imagine our delight to walk into our room at the Eastgate and find spaciousness, a kitchenette (including stove, oven, fridge, toaster, coffeemaker with coffee and tea, cupboards stocked with dishes, pans, etc, a normal sized bathroom, two huge closets, a huge comfy bed, table and chairs, TV, on and on. This is a place you could stay at for weeks if you needed to. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was good, in a quieter neighborhood. We certainly did not mind the extra five minute walk in exchange for such an excellent room at that price! We'll never stay anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “Eastgate Tower Is A Gem”
Reviews.Author: SydneyCarol
Reviews.Content: My husband and i spent a week in New York in April 2007.It was our first trip there. We had been told that New York rooms are very small, but this was not the case at EASTGATE TOWER. We had a huge suite, with the biggest bed, a sofa, dining table, kitchenette, and a decent bathroom. And the prices were great too. The hotel is not new, but it is clean and everything was 100% for us. We want to go back again soon. The location was fantastic. It was a good easy walk to Time Square and lots of great shopping even closer, and restaurants and food shops very close by. The staff were very helpful, and friendly. I can not find any fault with the hotel at all. We have travelled extensively in many countries, including USA, Australia and Europe and we have learnt that opulence does not always guarantee a good stay at a hotel. I have had some really bad experiences at very high class, expensive hotels, but the Eastgate Tower was charming, no problems, comfortable clean accomodation. I was impressed

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret on the east side!”
Reviews.Author: melbat
Reviews.Content: I was a bit reluctant to stay on the east side of NYC but man did I become enlightened....I don't know that I will ever stay in Times Square again! The Eastgate Tower was originally built in the early 1970's as a high rise apartment building with partial hotel service. This explains the size of the rooms and kitchenettes. Our family (2 adults and 2 teens) had a 1 bedroom suite, equipped with a full kitchen (including a dishwasher) and one and half baths.. The neighborhood (Murray Hill) is safe and residential with several grocery stores in the vicinity. No, the suite isn't posh like you would find at the W Times Square but it is clean, homey, and best of all...away from the crowded insanity that is Times Square. Oh yeah...I almost forgot...all for about $200 and some change a night! There is easy access to the theater district (or anywhere else for that matter) via Grand Central Station, about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Or you can simply walk (20 minutes to Time Square, 15 to Herald Square) We will absolutely stay there again...and again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Affinia-Eastgate Tower”
Reviews.Author: Manatee01
Reviews.Content: The majority of the staff, especially the day shift was helpful and really tried to be professional and assist us. The only request we had when we made our reservation was that we wanted two beds in our room, and the rooms to be non-smoking rooms. Neither of these requests happened. When we inquired if we could have another room, they informed us that they were full. Even after calling the hotel before arrival, where they promised us that there would be no problem getting two beds, it did not happen. I than was told that I could have a roll-away cot. Since the mattress on the cot and the bed was horrible, we requested a mattress cover. After three attempts, the bed received a cover, but not the cot. I tried one more time, but was told all beds had the cover on. I could not seem to get them to understand that the cot did not receive the mattress cover. I gave up in frustration. I also had to call for a pillow and a blanket. That took two calls to receive.The front desk in the evening was very forgetful and did not seem to really care about us. I was sad to experience the overall indifference of the night staff, especially since I had stayed in other Affinia properties in Europe and was very happy with the level of service. I will never stay in an Affinia hotel again. It was apparant that this hotel staff did not care about their guests, and Affinia had slipped in quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very large room!!”
Reviews.Author: Canion1
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed here for a few nights at the end of March 2008. As other reviews have noted, the room is quite large (see photos). We did not get the upgrade that many others mentioned but the one bedroom suite was sufficient for three girlfriends. The room and hotel showed some wear but were spotlessly cleaned. The staff was pleasant and helpful. As previously mentioned, the lobby is small but should not affect your enjoyment of the hotel. I noticed only one computer workstation in that same lobby which I believe required a fee. The hotel offers in room high speed internet access at $9.95 for 24 hours (which I declined to purchase). If you have wireless, there were several (very weak) unsecured connections in the area that I used for my daily internet fix. Be prepared for frequent dropped connections. I would stay here again and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: thechampishere
Reviews.Content: This is a great Budget Hotel, true, its not the grandest looking, but the rooms are clean, the staff are friendly, and its perfectly situated. You can walk to Times Square in 15 minutes, theres a subway stop just around the corner as well. NYC is an amazing city and this is a great place to stay, I was there with my girlfriend for 3 nights, and we were looked after very well. Definately recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beeben
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic stay at this hotel. From start to finish we have no complaints about the hotel worth noting. Sure, it could do with a bit of a freshen-up and the lifts were a bit slow but the size of the suite far surpassed my expectations of New York's infamous tiny rooms. We had a magical view from our window in 22C of the Manhattan skyline including a bit of the Empire State Building. Staff and cleanliness faultless-the staff were so obliging loaning us an umbrella and a mobile phone charger (old style US plugs in our room). The location was perfect for us being so close to GCS and far enough away from the madness of Times Square. The locality is heaving with bars and small restaurants. For breakfast we recommend Sarge's and Frontier on 3rd and for dinner nearby Patsy's pizzeria also on 3rd. Tony's sushi just around the corner on 2nd was fab. Two notes of caution. Margarita Murphy's bar on 3rd very near hotel left such a bad taste in our mouths on St. Patrick's Day for overcharging and rudeness ( 15 bucks for 2 beers before a tip!!!) that we passed their door for the remaining 6 nights of our stay. Also the Italian restaurant Il Fagioli (I think)that the hotel recommend as their restaurant is closed wasn't great and rude staff too. The New York rudeness is a myth, it's a fast town and some people are rude everywhere. Last tip-Coney Island-do it! Half hour on subway with Metrocard it's a toal nostalgia trip and the rides are not for the faint-hearted. Even the Wonder Wheel has a kick. Can't wait for our next trip and we will be booking Eastgate again and recommending it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “basic NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: nads_p
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending 4 nights at the Eastgate Towers. We had 2 double beds in our room which were very comfy. The room itself was quite large and had a basic kitchenette area with free coffee and tea provided for us every day. The cleaner even did our washing up for us which was a suprise; shame they didnt vacuum under the beds though. Although the room was cleaned every day it wasnt spotless as as you would expect it to be in suite hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. We found the location to be excellent, Grand Central was about a 10 min walk. We barely spent any time in the room so it fulfilled our needs adequately.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: ToonmanUK
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for a shock.This place used to be an apartment block so the size of the rooms reflects this, our room was the same size as the first flat I bought, more room than you'd ever need. The room itself had been a smokers room in the past and as a non smoker its a smell that never goes away, but after a quick spray of perfume the smell was forgotten. The reception area and staff were very helpful, theres a free safety deposit box available to all rooms and they'll cash travellers cheques($100 a day). Outside the hotel to the right theres a McD's and corner shop, to the left on the corner of 3rd you'll find the Frontier Diner, great for breakfast my little girl loved the pancakes with chocolate chips. Top places to visit, Top of the Rock, Times Square (Day and Night) and the downtown NYC Bus Tour.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: EGillespie
Reviews.Content: Eastgate Towers is in a good location, about 10-15 mins walk to Times Square, 5 mins to the Chrysler Building, 5 mins to Empire State etc. Seemed to be in a safe part of town. The room was huge (much bigger than necessary!) Smelled of cigarettes which wasn't great for 2 non-smokers, but it wasn't bad enough to complain. The room was clean enough although could do with redecorating and modernising. Was great to have a kitchen, and the basics were provided. We paid £364 (taxes inc) for 4 nights in early March. I guess for New York, this is as good a price as you can expect, so is worth the money in comparison to other places we looked at. i would recommend it for people on a budget, but just don't expect modern luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Eastgate Tower”
Reviews.Author: lucas48314
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from staying 4 nights at Eastgate Tower in Murray Hill and we had a fabulous time. LOCATION - Perfect - from dining on 39th at a place the hotel recommended called Euro Diner - outstanding food and reasonable. Also, great hot bagels at Daniels on 39th. To getting over to Grand Central - 10 minutes which takes you anywhere in Manhattan. To walking to Time Square which was an easy 20 minute walk. HOTEL - was very roomy and clean and we couldn't ask for more. It was also in a quiet area, we slept very sound. Even the views out of the windows were nice, have stayed at other high rise hotels where all you see is one other building This was the roomiest hotel I've ever stayed in and I was shocked that it was in NYC. Since this hotel has kitchens, I ordered some groceries on-line with Food Emporium, then checked with the hotel to see what a good delivery time would be and Donna said that I could have them dellivered a little before arriving, how amazing. I already knew I would love it there. Once we checked in and went upstairs we found out we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite and we already had food in the fridge, my six year old thought it was the greatest and still tells people how our room came with food. We enjoyed making breakfast and have some cold drinks when needed. With children, it is nice to have the flexibility of having the kitchen and more than one television was a definate plus. The time in NYC does go quickly, as there is a lot to see and even with the subways do plan on doing alot of walking, I regret we didn't do the double decker bus tour, we wanted to the last day of our trip but due to a heavy snowfall, they were not running. The Top of the Rock was amazing - we went right before sunset and we were able to get some great photos. I would definately stay at Eastgate Tower again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sparkledc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here a couple of times and it is a favorite of ours. The "small" suites are really very roomy, and the larger ones are huge. We got one of the large ones, having booked a small one on this last trip - I guess it was just available and they gave it to us. The square footage for the price - even for the small suites - is outstanding for NYC. There is a decent fitness center, and an okay business center in the lobby. The rooms themselves are clean and comfortable. Staff is friendly and helpful. The location is excellent (close to Grand Central station). Dollar for dollar I don't know of a better hotel in the city, and I go there a lot since it's my home town (but I don't live there anymore).

Reviews.Title: “eastgate”
Reviews.Author: bazzyT
Reviews.Content: The eastgate tower hotel is in a great location. it is about 10 mins walk from grand central station. we stayed in a junior suite which was very spacious. the room itself was quite basic but it was well kept and cleaned daily. we got a great deal here so it is great if you are budgeting and want accomodation in manhattan. it is close to the UN building also, and i would recommend the tour of the UN building. Also, the buses that come and go to all three NY airports arrive at and leave east 41st street which is very close to this hotel. The buses cost around $15 one way and take roughly an hour. The hotel's restaurant was closed during our stay due to refurbishment but there are plenty of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Stew_Dub
Reviews.Content: We (3 guys) satyed in the Eastgate last weekend for 3 nights. We had booked a one bedroom suite and specified that we needed 3 beds. We were met at the Front desk by Donna (an Angel), who upgraded us to a two bedroom suite. She, like all the staff, was so friendly and helpful, it really made our stay so much more enjoyable. The room was huge. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a huge living room and fully equiped a kitchen (the whole thing was bigger than my apartment in dublin...embarrassingly enough). The location is so perfect. We flew Continental to Newark and the Newark airport bus leaves you 2 blocks away from the Eastgate. It's ideal for everything in Manhattan. I'm heading back to NYC in April and will definitely be back to the Eastgate.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: tallulaEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 night stay at this pleasant hotel.We found the receptionists to be friendly and helpful and were informed the dining area was closed during our stay due to refurbishments so did not get to sample there dining area. The rooms were very large and spacious and came with two large double beds.Although we were a bit surprised that the rooms were nothing like the inrternet photo shows but were clean and spacious. I travelled with my friend so the room was suitable for what we required although it was a shock to find that the electricity wasn't strong enough to power my GHD hair straighteners or our hairdryer,but one was supplied in the room. The hotel wasn't far from all the hustle and bustle 5 mins in a cab or 15 mins walking. I would recommend this hotel to anybody who just wants the basics from there hotel as we did and provide a clean and friendly service.We thouroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “an ok stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: bleulibellule
Reviews.Content: Our first room was a real disappointment. We were given a second room on day 2 and it was better but not as nice as what we expected from the photos online. The staff was great and overall our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but a few warnings....”
Reviews.Author: justducks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Eastgate Towers with my family during the chilly month of January. When we pulled up to the hotel, it did not look too good and I was worried,but once we checked in, we were pleasantly surprised. It was spacious and clean. I have a few complaints and warnings I wish to give other potential guests. The first is the parking. There is valet parking next to the hotel and it is very expensive at $35.00 per day! To be clear, that is $35.00 + taxes + tip for the valet. There are plenty of parking lots around the area, but because there are so many one-ways, it gets confusing and you may be tempted to just park beside the hotel. Thats what I did and the car came back three days later with a huge scratch on the side. Because it is winter and there is lots of salt everywhere, we did not notice the scratch until later. So beware of the parking beside the Eastgate Towers, it is a rip off and your car will probably come back with some sort of damage! (Note that the hotel offers no discount at all, which is surprising because La Quinta, which is only a few blocks away gives you 50% off your total parking just for staying at the hotel. ) The second complaint deals with the reception of the hotel. There is one person at front desk and one or two "attendants" that stand around and open doors for people. If you have lots of luggage when coming in, the attendant will take your things and follow you up to your room. You will not be asked whether you actually want assistance, or desire to have a strange man follow you to your room, it will just happen. You will then be expected to provide a tip and the end of the encounter. This type of behaviour is quite strange for a budget hotel, so be prepared and have tip money handy. Lastly, regards the service. We went during restaurant week and we could not find one person at the front desk who could actually recommend a restaurant (and not simply read off the Zagat's survey). There is no concierge (i know it is a budget hotel), but a great alternative would have been to provide 5 or 10 minutes of free internet on the computer located in the entrance. Instead, they had some ludicrously expensive fees to surf the net even for a few minutes. So in conclusion, you will be comfortable inside your roomy hotel room at the Eastgate Towers, but do lots and lots of research before heading out, or else it will put a serious "ding" in your budget in more ways than one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travelingnewbie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for two nights over the MLK weekend. The Junior suite was extremely well priced--I think we paid around 120/night. The lobby was quite tight and we waited for bellmen coming and going. The staff were very nice and accommodating. The room was spacious albeit definitely worn, however, for the price and the proximity to the 6 subway line, a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all my expectations, a truly excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MarkG_1982
Reviews.Content: I've arrived back from New York this very day after staying at the Eastgate Tower for 4 nights. I've stayed in New york before and this is by far the best hotel i have found to date. The reason i'm writing this review so quickly is that i noticed the 2 star review below me and the fellow giving the hotel a hard time. After seeing the review's low rating i read it in full and was surprised by everything they were saying! The lobby is too small? What does that matter? Are you sleeping there?? For the record their experience was totally different to the one i have just had and it seems that i must have been passing them in the corridor everyday! This is truly a hotel to recommend to friends. NY is notorious for packing in as many hotel rooms into a building as possible, meaning the customer often recieves a dinky room ... After experiencing this previously, one of my main criteria was to book a hotel whos rooms didn't look like a broom cupboard and the Eastgate certainly didn't let me down. The Studio room that we got was absolutely huge compared the other hotels i have stayed at in NY. It had a walk in closet, nice bathroom, a small sectioned kitchen (gas hob/oven, fridge, toaster, microwave, coffee maker) and a large main room and i only booked the basic Studio room (room 2E if anyone is interested). As some other reviewers have said, a agree that the decor was slightly dated although it was kept really clean and house keeping did an excellent job of tidying up every day. The location is between 2nd and 3rd on 39th street, meaning the area and roads are rather quiet. I heard the occasional siren and honk of a horn but nothing that could be considered a nuisance. As for attractions, the Eastgate is slightly further than most, although (unlike the reviewers below me) if you come to NY you expect to walk a distance everyday. Time Square and the Empire state are wel within walking distance taking around 15/20 minutes, although i would say if you come to NY to catch the buses everywhere then get something a little closer. There are loads of places to eat from a nice posh restaurant round the corner to a McDonalds on the corner of 2nd/39th. A 24hr pharmacy is on the otherside of 2nd Avn and a Supermarket is one block north to fill your fridge with cookies and Dr Pepper. The staff are brilliant, everyone i talked to, whether asking directions or getting recommendations for a place to eat, i found to be helpful and friendly ... definately top marks there. Myself and the lady have already said that the next time we come to New York we are staying at the Eastgate, it simply is an excellent hotel to stay at. I would recommend it to anyone who doesn't mind walking an extra 5 minutes to attractions, and if your willing to make the sacrifice you get an oversized room, excellent value for money and a hotel that i will be visiting everytime i return. I hope this review helps :)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bklyngalinla
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with this hotel after reading glowing reviews on this site and having stayed before at Affinia's lovely Dumont. First impression at 11pm arrival was shock at the tiny, institutional looking lobby, and horror after transporting my own luggage upstairs (security guard/bellman had gone on break) at the depressing, shabby, filthy two double bed (despite request for one king) studio suite - located between the elevator, gym and compactor - that cost $400 for the first night. (Quikbook booking gave different rates for each night.) Was told there were no other rooms available until it was discovered that the door to this room did not lock. Was sent to another horrible studio for the night and the next morning given the choice to upgrade to a junior suite. Much larger, seemingly cleaner (NO ancient bedspreads but the floors were just as grimy.) New rate was slightly higher. I forgot to mention AAA membership at the time of the adjustment and was not allowed to apply it when I called Management the next day. I stayed at the hotel for 12 nights for about $4500. For the most part, staff were extremely polite and helpful. They assured me that renovations were "going to start any time" for as long as they'd been working there (20 years in once case). Door to the junior suite failed to lock half the time unless properly jiggled but it was still shocking to come home to a wide open door at 1 a.m. Beds hard as table tops but no bugs. Air conditioning effective. Laundry located in basement next to housekeeping. Many foreign guests seem to be a reflection of nearness to U.N., as are numbers of security personnel with big dogs. Nice scenic walk on First Avenue to UN and Tudor City. Express buses do not stop at 39th street. Don't know if I would stay here again. Would not recommend it to friends without many caveats. Sadly disappointing. Had high expectations which were not met. Probably families staying in larger suites have more modern accommodations. I did not see anything resembling the room pictured at the hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2007”
Reviews.Author: 122109b
Reviews.Content: We booked the eastgate tower for 7 nights over christmas based on the reviews on tripadvisor. We decided to walk from Grand Central to the Hotel with 2 large suitcases and we were reasonably surprised that it only took us 5 minutes. The hotel is in a great location and is ideal for walking to many of the sights in the city shuch as Grand Central, Rockefeller Centre, Times Square, Empire State Building etc. We walked to all of these places from the hotel and they were all really nice walks. Ok so it's not in the heart of it all but that is nice as it's much quieter. The reception staff, maids and bell boys were all really welcoming and friendly. The hotel feels really secure and in a nice neighbourhood. The Rooms are massive. I was amazed one very early morning how long it took me to walk from the bed to the bathroom! Ok so the decor is a little tired but it was spotlessley clean all week. The kitchen is fantastic aswell. We were there for Christmas and I was going to cook christmas dinner and I would have been able to in the kitchen, it had everything. It was seperate from the main room too and we were only in a studio suite. There are plenty of shops, restuarants, diners etc nearby on bothe 3rd and 2nd Avenues. All in all we loved the hotel. We are regulars to NYC (6 times so far) and we have stayed in much more expensive hotels and this is bar far up there with them. We would consider staying here again, if the price is right and can highly recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, great value!”
Reviews.Author: pese
Reviews.Content: We booked on hotels.com at a discounted price with low expectation but were really amazed of the high standards! The lobby was small but when entering the room it was huge and very nice, big and comfy bed, nice bathroom and a small kitchenette, very friendly and helpful staff! First night was really cold but it turned out we had missed to switch up the heat on the radiator… Close to grand central station where all the airport busses stop, a bit off from the best shopping and restaurants but it’s always close to taxis or subway. Restaurant was currently (Jan -08) under renovation so no breakfast available. Definitely great value for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Room!”
Reviews.Author: Coppercat
Reviews.Content: My husband, stepdaughter and I stayed in the Eastgate for one night in January 2008. When we got off the cramped elevator, we fully expected the room to be tiny because the hallway was so compact. Wrong! As soon as we opened the door, we collectively said "Wow!". The room was huge, even NOT by NYC standards. I've stayed in hundreds of hotel rooms, including suites, and this one was probaby one of the largest I've ever experienced. There was a big dining room with a family-size table, a huge living room with a sofa, chair and TV, a full kitchen (although small), a large separate bedroom with two queen beds and tons of closet space, and a small bathroom with tub. We could not believe how much space we had. You could easily have 6 or more people staying in there, comfortably (except for sharing the small bathroom). I'm assuming the building used to be apartments. I booked my room through Priceline. I think it was about $165, well below what you would expect to pay for such a big space in NYC. True, the furniture is dated and somewhat worn, but who cares? If they updated everything, you'd have to pay way more. How much time do you spend in the room in NYC anyway? The room was extremely clean and the front desk clerks were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is definitely in a convenient, relatively quiet and safe location - lots of restaurants, shops, businesses, etc. around. It was about a 15-20 minute walk to our Broadway show. We never heard any traffic noise from our room. We felt very safe walking around that area late at night. I would definitely stay at the Eastgate again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: newreviwer
Reviews.Content: This is the third year in a row that we've stayed at the Eastgate Tower, and we will continue to come back for many years to come. We take various family members to NYC every year in December to see the Christmas lights, and every year, we have a different configuration of family relationships with us necessitating various sleeping arrangements. The Eastgate has worked beautifully every year - they have so many options to choose from, room-wise. One bedrooms, two-bedrooms, studios - whatever your needs, they have a room that fits. For the last two years, we've had our baby with us on the trip, and both times, they've been able to provide a REAL crib (not a flimsy pack and play) for her to sleep in. This year we discovered that they also have high chairs for your room upon request, and they do stroller rental too, if needed. They seem to bend over backward to be family-friendly and accommodating. The hotel is tucked onto a quiet street between two busy avenues - quiet enough, but easy walking distance to the Grand Central subway stop, pharmacies, grocery stores and restaurants. The rooms themselves are HUGE by NYC standards - lots of room for a toddler to play after a long day in the stroller sight-seeing. The kitchenette is particularly useful when traveling with kids, as well. It is true that the place needs a renovation - it's getting a little shabby with scratched and dented furniture and threadbare carpeting, but it is kept immaculately clean by the very friendly housekeeping staff. I did not hesitate to let my two year old play on the floor - it was quite clean. I almost hate to write this review - I kinda want to keep the place a family secret. But the hotel deserves commendation - the staff are so friendly (seems to be the same people working there for three years in a row, so there doesn't seem to be much turn-over), and the price for the location (and for the square footage) is SUCH a bargain that I felt I needed to let others know. This is a true gem if you're taking a family vacation to the city - especially if you have kids!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious though not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: DJ139
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent four nights at the Eastgate Tower at the end of November 2007. He was in New York on business, and I tagged along for fun. We chose the Eastgate because a) it fit into his expense budget and b) it is located within walking distance of his company's Manhattan headquarters. The best thing about the Eastgate: a lavish amount of space at a reasonable price, both exceptional by New York standards. We had a large living/dining room with a tiny kitchen; a bedroom with attached bathroom; a separate powder room; and two closets. This allowed me the luxury of staying up as late as I wanted, reading or watching TV, without disturbing my partner who had to be at work early each morning. We also stocked the refrigerator with breakfast items, so that we could have quick and economical in-room breakfasts. The rooms were not at all luxurious or stylish; it looks like the place hasn't been redecorated since the mid-1980s. It's all a bit dated and worn, but nevertheless spotlessly clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and efficient; while the service is not up to the standards of a luxury hotel, it is perfectly adequate. The location is a bit out of the way, on the border of Midtown and Murray Hill, but is only a ten or fifteen minute walk to the transportation hub of Grand Central Station. And, being immediately adjacent to the Queens-Midtown Tunnel exit street, we did get our share of honking horns and traffic noise every morning, but it wasn't a problem since we weren't sleeping late. All in all, the Eastgate Tower provided the luxury of space at a bargain price; we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brokes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October for 5 nights with my partner and father who joined us mid stay. We were very happy with check in which was extremely fast, our room was not ready at the time but we had been given a complimentary upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite so were not concerned. To be fair the room was absolutely huge and was probably bigger than most apartments in New York. The decor was a little dated and lighting not enough in the lounge for the size of the room but it had 2 bathrooms which was really handy and 2 large bedrooms, one with 2 doubles and 1 with another double. The service was fantastic and what I liked was that it seemed like no tip was expected from the staff. Not too common in NY. Location for us was awesome, right in the middle, we were able to walk to most sites but grand central was a couple of blocks away and there are taxi's galore. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed when we were there also but the courtyard was lovely to sit in to relax after exploring New York for the day. Food wise, the italian restaurant just up 2nd Avenue is an absolute gem! We went to Smith and Wollenskys grill for a steak which was also amazing and would highly recommend, expensive but worth it. Deli's galore, Fluffy's is brilliant on 7th Ave close to carnegie hall for a casual normal priced good sandwich and salad and there is a McDonalds just downstairs if you're desperate. I believe that this is an excellent hotel for the money considering its central New York and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler0725
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel, with decent staff and rooms that feel like little apartments. Very quiet residential location, and there are tons of great places to eat and drink along 3rd Ave. Staff was all very pleasant. In my room there was a long narrow hallway that you entered through (probably all are like this). and the light in the hallway was out when I first got there. Very dark and disconcerting because you cannot see the room right away, just a dark hallway. On my way out in the morning, I told staff light was out and it was replaced when I came back. Rooms are not spectacular, but just pleasant and laid out in a way thay feels like a decent studio apartment I am on a long term assignment in NYC working in Midtown, and I have been searching for a place I can call home without bopping around from hotel to hotel. This is probably where I am going to end up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: stonelea20
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the Eastgate Tower Suite Hotel at the end of November 2007.
