Check in was flawless and we were pleased with the relatively quiet location just a couple of blocks from Grand Central (nearest subway) and a 15-20 minute walk to the Empire State Building. Our junior suite was very spacious and clean with good facilities. Servicing of rooms was excellent. Unfortunately the restaurant was closed for refurbishment so we used the in-room kitchen facilities for breakfast although there was room service. There were free secure deposit boxes. The staff were very helpful and organised transport back to Newark airport for us and storage for our luggage during the day after check out. We would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money...”
Reviews.Author: Magpiesnest
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eastgate at the end of November / beginning of December. Good location and very big room albeit a little dated. The bed was large and very comfortable. There was a sizeable sitting area for guests / fellow travellers. There was also a smallish bathroom and a basic kitchen. Please note this is not the smartest, most modern hotel in New York but the room was large, warm and comfortable. If you spend a lot of time in your room you are missing the point of visiting New York!! The Hotel was certainly not cheap but was mid-priced and I think good value for money especially if there are a couple of you in each room making a contribution. I’ve stayed in much more expensive NY hotels and they haven’t been much better. Please note at the moment the Hotel Restaurant is closed as its being updated although there was no sign of activity when we were there. We ate breakfast at the Frontier Restaurant about 100 yds away on 3rd and the food was quite good and reasonably priced. For other meals you would probably travel outside the hotel anyway and there are lots of restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff are helpful and friendly although a little busy at times, so occasionally there is a little wait for attention however it’s good when it arrives. Overall fairly satisfied with the Eastgate experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: JamJarLondon
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect when I booked this as a surprise trip to New York for my boyfriend. We had a 1 bedroom suite (some family came as well as part of the surprise) which consisted of a 2 double beds in the bedroom and a pull out sofa bed in the living room. We had a fully fitted kitchen which was brilliant for quick snacks and drinks. We found the staff to be very helpful and polite. I agree with a lot of the reviews the rooms are a little dated but we found them to be clean and spacious. The towels and bedding were changed every day and they even did the washing up? The Frontier Café on the corner of 39th St and 3rd Av is excellent for breakfast. They even delivered to our room when we had to be up and out for 08:00 in the morning. Docks on 40th and 3rd (I think) have great Sea food. The hotel is in a great location and within walking distance to Grand Central. It’s the ideal place to drop your bags, party, shop and sight see then crawl home in the early hours….

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagicFlute
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2 bedroom suite here, It really was huge, fantastic value. I don't have any negatives about the hotel, it suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElectricBIues
Reviews.Content: I previously stayed at the Eastgate towers in December of 2006 and had a follow up trip in October of 2007 and the hotel was just as great! This time we had three people going and had the Junior bedroom suite which came with one queen bed, a pull out sofa bed (which was VERY roomy and VERY comfortable!) and what a very spacious room is general! You definitley get great quality at the hotel. The staff are very helpful and the bags can be put on hold before checking in and after checking out so you can get the most out of the city. This is a perfect location because it is outside of all the hustle and bustle and is quiet and nice. Everything is in a reasonable amount of walking distance, Grand Central is particularly close. There are some good restaurants and eating locations just around the block, so no need to fear with the hotel restaurant under renovations. Anyway, highly recommended! AWESOME hotel, next time I go to NYC I will be staying yet again at Eastgate Towers.

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: MMoran
Reviews.Content: I've just literally come back from staying in the Eastgate Tower Hotel. We booked the 2 bedroom suite and stayed there for 4 nights. Although the hotel is not very modernly decorated it was perfect for what we needed. The hotel restaurant is currently under renovation but there was a perfectly adequate diner on the corner called Fontaine's I think. Our room could comfortably accommodate 6 people and as there were only 4 of us we had more than enough room. We did not used the kitchen as that was not what our trip was about but it would have perfect if needed. I would say thogh that there was no microwave. The staff were very very pleasant and helpful. Anything you needed they got for you and in a very nice manner. I would stay in it again and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: robk2468
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Midtown and is in walking distance of Grand Central, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, UN Building, 5th Avenue and Broadway. The room was massive, clean and what we had expected. We didnt use the kitchen but looked well equiped. Resturant was closed for 'renovation'. Staff were helpfull and we were able to leave our bags with Concierge on last day. We had nothing bad to say about the hotel. Seemed to be a quiet neighberhood. The black sheep (Irish) pub, (located on the same block) provided a nice meal and drinks one evening.

Reviews.Title: “Easy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JWestMpls
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like you are living in New York this is a great neighborhood. Hotel is worn but clean and rooms are good size. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Eastgate”
Reviews.Author: Algarvean
Reviews.Content: A good hotel in a great location. The previous reviews on the site are accurate, the rooms are massive but slightly dated. Having said that it did not cause us a problem and if it was renovated I guess the prices would increase accordingly. The rooms were clean and the kitchen facility was great as we did not have too eat out all the time. The one evening we were too tired to go out so ordered a Chinese takeaway via the reception, I guess most hotels would not be too keen on you doing this! The Frontier diner on the corner of the block is an ideal place to have breakfast to set you up for the day. There are several good restaurant close by, Cibo [--] (1 block up on 2nd street) is highly recommended. The area feels safe even at night and it is just a short walk to Grand Central station. All in all a great hotel and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: The_DocLeicester
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay in New York and stayed at Eastgate Tower at the start and end of the visit [Montauk for a few days in the middle]. Found Eastgate towers to be excellent accomodation. Centrally situated, and the 2 bedroom Suite we had was perfect accomodation for a family of x2 adults and x2 teenagers. The staff were helpful and knowledgable. The hotel was also prepared to let us leave some bags at the hotel for 48hrs [as we were coming back] so that we could travel light for our 2day Sea-side trip to Long Island. Only critical points? : 1] Contrary to Hotel details, the Ground floor Restaurant is closed for "renovation". No work going on, didn't look in a rush to re-open. 2] Decor, rather dated and in need of refreshing....On theother hand the price would take a hike if it was all "trendy boutique" in appearance.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. Very basic”
Reviews.Author: winter_turtle
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel. I had a junior room and it was very large, especially for NYC, though the bathroom somehow manages to remain NYC small. Location was good, for midtown Manhattan. Bathroom wasn't as clean as it could be. Not sure if I'd stay there again, especially if it's for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious, but really good all the same”
Reviews.Author: AnthonyMcNamee
Reviews.Content: Four of us spent the last four nights in September in a 2-bedroom suite and I'd give Eastgate Tower the thumbs up. The one precondition the other couple had for an NY hotel room was that it had to be bigger than the average shoebox and in fairness, the suite we got was huge. As other reviewers mention, it is not state of the art by any stretch. Don't get me wrong, it is not rundown and is certainly not uncomfortable...just a little old-fashioned in terms of furnishings. This isn't a hotel you'll be spending any time in apart from in your room. The lobby is small and serves a function to get you to your room as quickly as possible. Safety deposit boxes are available in the lobby too. The onsite restaurant was closed for renovations when we stayed. Nearby, there is a McDonalds, a pharmacy and a cornershop at one end of the street, and a couple of nice breakfast places at the other. Around the corner is a strip of 3 pubs, which all seemed to do a fair enough trade. Grand Central is only a 5 minute walk away (I don't see how anyone could describe it as further away... the entrance you need is more or less at the corner of 3rd and 42nd) and this means everything in the city is only a change of a train away. Fashion Avenue is about 20 minutes away, Times Square a few minutes more than that, and Central Park about 25 minutes (all walking distances). If you're in New York principally to go shopping, this probably isn't the best spot for you, given the long enough hike back and forward from any of the main shopping areas to drop off the bags and start again. But for any other visitor, the Eastgate is excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid choice!”
Reviews.Author: janthefan
Reviews.Content: The Eastgate Tower is a very good choice for anyone travelling on a budget. Actually we paid a fortune for it, on a business trip during the busiest week of the year, but I know that generally the hotel is good value. The reception staff were always cheerful and helpful. The rooms are HUGE. If you're sharing with friends, the 2 bedroom suites might be a good way to save money. I was upgraded to one ... it had 2 double beds, and another room with two single beds. Plus two bathrooms, a ktichen and a huge living room. So you can have your privacy (separate bedroom and bathroom) and meet up in the living room. Tons of storage space too in both bedrooms. I was on the 3rd floor, and there was some street noise in the bedroom facing the street. I wear earplugs, and was fine with it. The other bedroom, facing the back, was much quieter. All that said, I found the hotel totally lacked character - it was, well, your basic hotel. But it was clean, the TV worked, and the location is very good indeed. We were working at the UN, and it was within easy walking distance. For breakfast, we went along the road to the Frontier cafe, and really liked it. A real New York experience. British visitors will love it! Free coffee refills too. All in all, if you haven't been to New York before, and are looking for a good value base for exploring the city, you can't go wrong with the Eastgate Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Eastgate”
Reviews.Author: Penzgirl
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about the Eastgate. I was traveling with four friends, and when we arrived the desk clerk told us we had been upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite. The suite was huge, with two bathrooms and a sitting area where we gathered with our other friends to drink wine before going out on Friday night. We had a kitchen with a full-size refrigerator and a dishwasher. I am picky about cleanliness and found nothing to complain about. We paid $400 per night, which with taxes amounted to about $125 per person, per night-that's a great deal for a big room in New York in September. Everyone at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful, quickly checking our bags when we arrived early, and letting me use the health club bathroom after I checked out. There is internet access in the front lobby; if you're just printing out a boarding pass it's $3. We really enjoyed the neighborhood. Around the corner from the hotel is a supermarket, convenience store, neighborhood bars, a wine store and inexpensive eateries. It's a little bit of a hike to the nearest subway station, Grand Central, but hey, it's New York, you walk a lot. We had no problems walking to midtown, Central Park, etc. Yes, the furnishings are a bit threadbare. So what? I'd prefer they keep the rates at a reasonable cost. That minor quibble didn't take away from the great experience we had here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eastgate Tower, I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGame
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eastgate Tower with my mother and sister, the first visit to New York for all of us! I read the reviews carefully prior to deciding on the Eastgate, and the reviews were right on! This hotel is a great value, location was good, walking distance to just about everything that we wanted to see. The neighborhood felt safe, with lots of retuarants, little grocery stors, etc. While the hotel itself may need a bit of an update, it was very clean, well kept, quite and friendly! STAFF was GREAT! I will defintely bok the Eastgate Tower on my second trip to New York!

Reviews.Title: “What a joy!!”
Reviews.Author: Linus37
Reviews.Content: The Eastgate Tower is a really good value hotel, that is exceptionally clean with very friendly staff. The lobby and reception are small but functional and pleasantly decorated. I stayed for five nights with with four other friends and we were allocated two suites on the same floor. The suites were well equipped and very clean, though simple in furnishings - they had everything we required. The hotel is well located and in easy walking distance to UN Buildings, Grand Central Station and the Empire State Building, we also walked comfortably to Macy's, Times Square, Broadway and Fifth Avenue. We had a fantastic stay and would all go back to this hotel - the cleaniness, friendliness and location of this place make it exceptional value for money. Thanks to all the team at the Eastgate Tower, you made our trip memorable....you were really grand!! A very happy Yorkshire lass, from Sheffield England.

Reviews.Title: “I concur with the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: andrelee
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 yr old son and I stayed for three nights in a double bed suite with a kitchen. The room and the hotel decor is rather plain and dated for some tastes. The bathroom was plain and clean with a nice showerhead.There was enough space in the room for us all to run around. The kitchen has a stove, oven, microwave, small fridge, sink, cabinets with plates, pans, glasses, and utensils. We filled the fridge up with food from trader joes and whole foods at union square, the next stop on the number 4 express. The metro is 3 blocks away at grand central station The neighborhood seemed safer and quieter than the more busier tourist spots. There are tons of restos on third ave. Midtown tunnel is a few blocks away for trips to the Long Island, Laguardia and JFK and grand central is, again, three blocks away. The staff attended to all our needs and questions pleasantly and with concern. There was an excess charge for the internet on our bill but it was excised without hassle.The gym was small, tv epuipped with a treadmill, 2-3 stairmasters an older bike, a rack of 5,8,15,25 and 35 dumbbells.and a universlal gym, which is fine if you know what you're doing. We would definitely stay here again unless we found something else that was as convenient and well equipped for a lower price.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: VcrTraveller
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (3 kids ages 19-23) stayed here for a week in August. Huge 2 bedroom suite. The beds were comfortable. The rooms are clean. Having a fully equiped kitchen is a bonus. The location is good, many great restaurants nearby - we liked the restaurtant in the hotel. But if you like Italian try Rossini's, just a few blocks away. Or Maru Maru for Japanese, it's on 2nd. We were able to have a later check out and the hotel arranged airport transfers at a much more reasonable rate than if booking on the internet (if you pay cash). The rooms could use some cosmetic upates, but the price was right for the size and comfort level. We stayed at the Shellburne last year (same hotel chain), it's fancier, but you pay for that. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Pleased with the Eastgate Tower Hotel Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Regular-NYC-Visitor
Reviews.Content: We were doing a 3-city tour (NYC, Philly & Boston) and had stayed at other Affinia NYC properties (e.g. Kimberley Suites) last year. Being honest, we try and pick suites where they are available and reasonably priced, as some hotel rooms in NYC can be a bit pokey - and the One Bedroom suites for just the two of us here are massive! We had 4 nights at the Eastgate Tower. Gotta say we were more than pleasantly surprised when we got the key to our room (Suite 23C) with great views of the city and the room was massive! Dinner table seating for 6 easy (8 at a pinch); kitchen had everything you'd ever need for a suit-yourself-stay (microwave, 5-burner gas cooker, cutlery & crockery, huge fridge-freezer, sink, coffee machine with comp coffee, tea bags etc.) The separate living room/lounge was huge too - settee, arms chairs, writing desk with reasonably-priced WiFi Internet, large TV (with all manner of Web Access, Films on Demand, free channels etc.) with good Air Conditioning (as did the separate bedroom - comfy bed!). The room smelled clean and fresh and was maintained well throughout our stay. Check-in/Reception guys were bright and engaging (for that read genuinely helpful and polite) and the place itself is ideally situated Midtown for all most tourist walkabouts. NYC is a walker-friendly city and we just like to pootle about and shop and go and see things. We have fiends in the West Village, so getting there from our hotel was no problem. If you like a variety of eateries - you're spoiled for choice: Deli's, Diners, Restaurants etc. Would we go back? Yep - no question. Recommended as a value-for-money residence for when you're in NYC! Enjoy - we did! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Woul definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: meeshnips
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe just how large the rooms were! We didn't use the kitchen much, but there was everything you would need to make a meal if the NY cuisine was getting you down. I went with my family and we had 2 rooms. The A/C in my room worked extremely well and was quiet, however the one in my parent's room was a little noisier, but it by no means stopped them from sleeping. The bed was very comfortable and unlike a lot f hotels, the linen was of a good quality allowing you to ust sink into sleep after your flight, which was handy as ours had taken 28 hours rather than 7 with Delta but that's a different story. The concierge was very helpful and very friendly. He told us where to go to find the best cheesecake, pretzels and diner in the city when we wanted to sample some typical american food. He also arranged a private car to take us back to the airport which only cost around $60 with tip and tolls. This was a lot cheaper than a metered taxi would have been especially as we were leaving in rush hour. I would highly recommend this hotel for being safe, well located and quiet. It also comes attached to a very good italian restuarant that outdid an italian we went to in little italy!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful!”
Reviews.Author: CaliGirl89
Reviews.Content: First of all...when I made my reservation they charged my credit card on a refundable room. Then when I checked out, they charged it again. Then when they credited back for the first charge, they gave the credit to my sister's card instead of mine. When I called to straighten the situtation out, I was told "that if I can't get the money from your sister, I am not going to eat it". They took no blame for their mistake and have a very poor business practice. The GM was very rude and needs to take customer service classes. It was there mistake, and they could care less. I will never stay there again for that reason, and not to mention that it is very dirty!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good but noisy”
Reviews.Author: NYCFanBelgium
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights at the promotional rate of 295 + tax per night booked via their website for a junior suite. The junior suite comes with a queen bed, which is a bit on the small side for 2 adults. Rooms are clean and are cleaned daily. Bed linen is changed every 2 days. Bathroom linen changed daily when on floor (like most hotels these days). Large rooms with kitchen, dining area, sofa and TV area, bed and bathroom so this is quite large for NYC standards. Noise isolation can be better (needs updating). The air-conditioning is an older style "fan-in-the -wall-set-up" so a lot of city and traffic noise comes in through the fan. The fan itself is also very noisy. We rented bicycles. The parking/garage manager did not allow us to store the bikes in the garages (even though they valet park cars and motorcycles in there) so we had to bribe the assistant. So all in all a good stay in regards to the price but the rooms are in need of refurbishing. Let people park their bikes please! I have stayed at the Affinia Dumont before and chose the Eastgate Tower this time (also Affinia group) because it was somewhat cheaper but next time I'll pay extra for the Dumont which is a much cleaner, quieter and overall better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, old furnishings and decor”
Reviews.Author: sobie26
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with the other Affinia hotels and have always had a great experience. I was expecting the same level of rooms as the other hotels. Let me first say that the Eastgate Tower's staff was courteous, professional and extremely accomodating. The hotel itself is in a great neighborhood and very convenient to many sites. BUT The hotel is extremely outdated and its decor looks like it is from the 1980's. The beds were uncomfortable and the pull out sofa's mattress was almost nonexistent. We had to pile two sofa mattresses on top of each other for it to be decent. The rooms had a funky smell and the bathrooms were all white but looked yellow. I would rate our overall stay as just okay. I will not be returning until they update this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly large room”
Reviews.Author: OCJoy
Reviews.Content: The room was much larger than expected for New York with plenty of storage. The kitchenette was great! It had everything - fridge, microwave, toaster, stove, oven, dishes, etc. Bathroom had a large medicine chest for storage, and plenty of towel racks, which were much appreciated. Good water pressure in shower. The AC fan was loud, but it worked. TV was fine. Furniture, walls, etc. not new/modern, but in good condition and clean. There was a slight smoky smell one day in the bathroom -- I think it was coming through a vent from another room -- but it was very slight. The staff was friendly and helpful and the lobby is nice. They couldn't give us a later check-out time, but they did store our luggage in the meantime, and were very quick about getting it back for us and calling a cab. Maid service forgot to replenish the coffee and toiletries, but the front desk quickly solved it both times. The location is good -- not far from Grand Central Terminal, and a lot of good restaurants within a 10 block radius. Our window looked out over 39th street and was big (not like some tiny windows that open onto alleys that I've had before). The only thing we really didn't like was the attached restaurant, Il Sogno. We went there for after-dinner drinks and dessert one night and got possibly the worst, rudest service we've ever had. Plus, the outdoor seating isn't very nice, and it's overpriced. But no problem, there are plenty of other restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Yet in NYC.........”
Reviews.Author: DebbyParker
Reviews.Content: Our room was not ready when we arrived. It was a short walk to Grand Central Station. They called us within the hour to tell us our room was ready. When we returned we were upgraded to a Jr Suite. This was my 10th trip to New York City and the best stay yet. I would definitely stay at the Eastgate Tower Hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: libertyprincess
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, room huge and spotless, but couldn't turn the heating off so had to keep turning on the air con to cool it down and leave a window open at night but that did the trick. Was pleased overall and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, perfect for families”
Reviews.Author: chicagofamily2
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Eastgate, and were very pleased. The room was actually a mini suite - in that it had a large queen size bed, lots of closet space, small stove, sink, oven, plates, silverware, mini fridge, and microwave. It looks like the hotel was originally an appartment building, and they converted it to a hotel, thus the stove, etc. For our family it was perfect. The room was quite large, and tastefully decorated. This isn't the Hyatt, but it's also not the Hyatt prices. Most impressive were the staff who were very friendly. We took their suggestion of having dinner at Hudson resturant one block away. It was a super meal, reasonably priced. There is also another local eatery on the corner of 3rd and 39th i think, we went there for breakfast every morning, and had much more reasonable prices that anywhere else we had been. You are in a quiet part of town, close to United Nations. A short walk and you can be in Times Sq. To us, it seemed more of a residential area than a tourist area. If you look at the NY map with all the attractions, there aren't many by the hotel, but that was fine with us. The excellent price for the room, and the super staff was what we wanted. We will definately be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: nettraveller_7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews and were not disappointed. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Central Station and even if keen Times Square. The lobby is a little small but was never crowded when we were there, staff helpful with information, luggage and arranging cabs. We were on the 11th floor at the back of the hotel but still had interesting views. The hotel is on a fairly quiet road and we had no trouble with noise. The room was great with plenty of space although we hardly used the facilities (full size oven, microwave, fridge) it would be really handy if there for a longer stay. The decor was a little tierd but clean and comfortable and certainly good value. I would recommended the hotel as a good 2*+

Reviews.Title: “Huge, cheap but shabby”
Reviews.Author: Jess4510
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 visited NYC for a 3 day weekend. Saturday and Sunday we stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel down in the financial district. For about $216/night, we got a large bedroom and living room with sleeper sofa, free breakfast, etc. Fantastic deal although kind of an out of the way location. Price more than doubled for Monday night, so we switched to the Eastgate Hotel, more uptown, at 39th and 3rd. We'd booked a one bedroom suite but they gave us a free upgrade to a 2 bedroom. I think we paid about $265 before taxes, etc. We had two bedrooms, two full bathrooms, a full kitchen, dining area and HUGE living room with sleeper sofa. We could have fit about 20 people in this space. It was quite clean but everything very shabby, peeling wallpaper, old furniture, malfunctioning and NOISY window air conditioners, etc. Since we weren't in the hotel much, we didn't really care. Quiet street but a quick walk to Grand Central and subways. Had to pay through the nose to use the computer with internet in the teensy lobby; that was a pain. Would probably go back if we couldn't find a good price at a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise and delighted”
Reviews.Author: spence3787
Reviews.Content: For less than $200 a night incl all taxes and fees, this place was a steal. Very large rooms with full kitchens and lots of closets. We had a queen bed and a sofa bed opposite it. With the sofa open, we still had room for a dance floor in between. Bathroom was ok and clean, as was everything else. Not a suite in the separate bedroom and living room sense, but just a very large room with a full kitchen and dining area You don't have the restaurants nearby like the Upper West Side places but who cares since this place was a good $100 less than those places for similar furnishings. A good and safe area with decent options on 3rd and 2nd. Also a great jumping off place to Long Island since the Midtown tunnel and Long Island Expressway (I-495) is a block away. Staff was professional and friendly, plus the adjacent public garage takes the car from you right at the hotel entrance so no hassles dropping the luggage and finding a place to park for the nights

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Leen46911
Reviews.Content: We booked the Eastgate Tower based on previous stays at other Affinia hotels in New York, room rate and reviews. We were not disappointed. We took a cab from LaGuardia and once in Manhattan it was an easy drive to the Eastgate. The lobby is very small and can be claustrophobic when it's crowded. We arrived early - around 10:15 am - and though we were initially told our room was not ready, a manager stepped in, changed our room assignment, and we were in. Our room was a Junior Suite, which includes a small but complete kitchen, large sitting area with table & chairs, sofa-bed and armchair, a king-size bed and bath. The room had a large dresser, two nightstands and three(!) closets - plenty of storage for our clothing and luggage. The set-up was great for 2 adults and 2 kids. The bathroom was small and did not have much counter space, but there was storage under the sink and in mirrored cabinets above the sink. The room and furniture were clean and the bed was comfortable. The carpet could use a throrough cleaning, or should be replaced. It always felt somewhat damp. The bathroom wallpaper was pretty tired, but the bathroom was clean with plenty of hot water. We had a 24th floor room overlooking 39th Street, which isn't terribly busy so the room was quiet. There was a huge window, with smaller side windows that open - we had unseasonably cool weather during our stay so it was great to be able to enjoy fresh air. The neighborhood is safe, with small groceries and fast food options nearby. We grabbed coffee each a.m. at the Starbucks on Lexington and 40th and bagels at Bagels & More on 39th & 3rd Avenue. There isn't much in the way of restaurants or shopping in the immediate area, so you'll need to venture out for these. The walk to Grand Central was an easy one and we took the subway everywhere. Sites such as the Empire State Building and Times Square were easily walkable, as is shopping on 5th Avenue. If you're traveling with kids and need a cool break in the sightseeing frenzy, visit the St. Vartan's playground on 1st Avenue just a few blocks from the hotel. Our kids loved it and we enjoyed sitting in the shade and relaxing after a full day of walking. The Eastgate Tower isn't fancy, but it's a great value for NYC and was the perfect set-up for our family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DanielJW
Reviews.Content: Both myself and my other half stayed in this hotel mid-february (during the snow) for a long weekend. When booking, we took a bit of a risk going for the Eastgate Towers due to its low cost. However, all of our preconceptions were eliminated as soon as we were greeted by the hotel staff. They are by far the best and most helpful I have ever met! Yes, the hotel decor is a little dated, but functional and comfortable. Then there is the space, and believe me, there's loads of it. We had a one bedroom suite on the 21st floor (D) and it was huge, probably as big if not bigger than some apartments/flats. A lounge/diner with four seat table, sofa bed, 32 inch TV, kitchen with dishwasher, small bathroom and bedroom with two queen beds and 21 inch TV, plus lots of storage. Then there's the view. We had a great view of 39th street facing west bound and a side view of the Empire State. This is by far the best view I've ever had in any of the New York hotels I've stayed in. The hotel is centrally located and only 4 blocks (10 minutes walk) from Grand Central Station, 15 minutes walk to the Empire State and 20 minutes walk to Time Square. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable & affordable”
Reviews.Author: CSturgeo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent a long weekend at the Eastgate. I chose it because of the reviews and I was not disapponted. The14th floor studio suite was ready when we arrived at 11 AM and was very clean. The staff was accomodating and helpful. The bed was very comfy. The fact that the furniture was slightly dated seems VERY unimportant. My only suggestions are: Include the internet cost in the room rate. It is provided by an outside source and although accomodating I feel in this day and age it might be better to just up the rate $10 and include it AND access to the lobby internet with printer. I had to pay an extra $3.40 to print my airline boarding pass. It was $3 for 7 mon. and 20 cents per page to print. This was on top of the $9.95 for internet in my room. It was minimal but annoying. Also I would have liked a comfortable armchair. We had two desk/dining chairs and had to always sit on the bed to watch TV. The room was plenty large enough to accomodate at least a simple wood/upholstered seat armchair. I thought the location was great and we had easy access to transportation, a safe neighborhood, and a bit of relief from hub-bub in many parts of the city. We kept the window open and had a pleasant breeze and therefore never tested the AC.

Reviews.Title: “old, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: kxk
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Quickbook.com at a great price. After reading reviews, I picked this hotel based on price, nice staff, and thought I could handle an older room as long as it's clean. When we arrived, the staff was very nice. Our room had mold in the bathroom and the bedding/ furniture were out dated. The mattress on the bed was nothing but springs (room 16 c). We were moved to room 17 c, which was a little better. Again the staff was nice, location was ok. I think it's worth paying more for a smaller, up to date room, that's closer to everything. If you are on a very tight budget and can deal with an old room, maybe this will work for you.

Reviews.Title: “All around-can't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: daytripr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 5/23/07 to 5/25/07 - anniversary trip. We checked in (a few hours early), and were given our room key with no hassles. We stayed on the 7th floor. The only problem we had was the hallway right outside our door smelled moldy and was quite strong - it stunk!! Once we got into the toom though, there was no smell and we were very pleased. Clean, spacious, and far beyond what we expected! The kitchette was very clean and so was the bathroom, with plenty of towels and HOT WATER! When we told the staff about the smell as we left to look around the area, they sent someone up to check it out, and when we returned - it was taken care of. We were treated nicely at all times, and the doorman, Louis, is an awsome person. He gave us directions for everwhere we wanted to go. There are many places to eat and Grand Central Station is not far at all. Buy an all day Metro Pass, and go sightseeing every where on public transporation for 7.00. This hotel is great and we will be returning for our next trip to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great geat”
Reviews.Author: bobbyjo48
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. Never having been to NY before we didn't know what to expect but we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was great and the location superb, very safe and the staff were fab. Nothing too much trouble. The furnishings were a little dated but servicable, all very clean. A short walk to the subway and good places to eat locally. Would recommend to anyone looking for a reasonably priced place to stay as how much time do you want to spend inside in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Eastgreat Tower”
Reviews.Author: Mulkers
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel purely on other people's good reviews, and the location. Having arrived, we were promptly checked in and given our key. We found our room extremely spacious, and clean. The only thing i could complain about is the dated furniture/duvet cover etc, but thats being fussy. The location of the hotel is ideal (for the price paid) - its only a few minutes walk to Grand Central Station, the Empire State Building, Madison and 5th Avenue. If walking isnt for you - and i think the best way to see New York is by foot - then there are always taxi's driving by. When we checked out, a bell boy kindly stored our luggage for the day (we had an evening flight), and arranged for a taxi to the airport later that day, at a reasponable rate. All in all, we were very pleased with the sevice provided by this hotel, and wouldnt think twice about returning.

Reviews.Title: “Was OK, But Nothing Great”
Reviews.Author: drb753
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Eastgate Towers May 8-12, 2007. The room was very outdated. The furniture was extremely old. The easy chair's arms were worn away from years of use. The two dressers were from the 70's and were also worn and nicked up. Looked like garage sale material for a college dorm. The bed was comfortable but the blanket was full of cigarette burn holes. The carpet was old and worn away from foot traffic. Even the alarm clock was a decade old and didn't operate properly! The kitchenette was not used so I can't comment. The absolute worst part of the room was the bathroom. There was mold on the caulking all around the tub. The floor was old and worn away and the walls had old peeling wallpaper. You didnt want to walk in there barefoot! As for convenience, the subway is about a ten minute walk that I wouldn't want to make in the winter. Cabs pass by quite regularly and the bell hop was nice and helpful. The cleaning maids need to be retrained as they left gargabe next to the bed from the last guest and it remained throughout my stay (grape stems). Overall, I read alot of great reviews on TripAdvisor-thats why I stayed here. I must have got a bad room or the rest of you are liars!

Reviews.Title: “Who says New Yorkers are rude???”
Reviews.Author: mordrid
Reviews.Content: The employees were SO friendly, the rooms were HUGE and clean, and the maid service was great. You really cannot go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious for NYC but faded”
Reviews.Author: drlaz
Reviews.Content: The room was much larger than NYC standard, no claustrophobia. Fixtures were old but in fine shape, and I very much like having a mini-kitchen for breakfast and midnight snack. The bed itself was below average in comfort (also true when I stayed at the Beekman Hotel sister property). The location is several blocks from the nearest subway entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: missmisty
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights here on a weekend trip with my boyfriend and it was easily better than most 2 or 3 star hotels I've stayed in. We chose this hotel after reading all the good reviews on TripAdvisor and found an excellent deal on lastminute (£384 each for 3 nights and non-stop return flights from London.) We stayed in a 1 bed studio suite which was very spacious and clean with en-suite bathroom and a small kitchenette. Clean towels and flannels were provided daily along with some excellent toiletries from Judith Jackson Spa (shower gel, soap, facial soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, mouthwash) so no need to bring your own! The room was much bigger than we needed for our short stay and would be ideal for people staying more than a week. We were on the 17th floor so it was very quiet - no street noise and no noise from other rooms despite there being lots of children in the neighbouring rooms. The location is within easy walking distance from Grand Central station, giving good access to the rest of New York and is also very close to the Chrysler building and the UN. The area felt very safe to walk around at night. Also close by is the Frontier diner where you can get a decent breakfast (they'll also deliver breakfast to your room for no extra charge). But if you fancy more of a treat, try Pershing Square outside Grand Central. The pancakes were amazing and the waffles were huge. Probably a bit pricey by US standards ($12) but a bit cheaper compared to London, given the sheer size of the food. This was our first time in New York and we were surprised at the short opening hours of most shops and attractions at the weekends (10am - 5pm). This meant we struggled to do more than two things a day. I would definitely recommend going to the Top of the Rock at the Rockefeller Center. The views across the city are much better than from the Empire State building even though it is not as high up. New York didn't turn out to be the amazing city that everyone says it is but if I ever visited again, I would choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good if it's not hot”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysTravelinOn
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I visited the Eastgate this past May9-13th, 2007. We were on the 4th floor in a Queen suite- nothing fancy, but from what I hear, it was renovated recently. Spacious and it had a kitchen. We still had some old furniture and the TV volume faded in and out but I gotta tell ya- the location was great! We were very close to Grand Central Station and the Empire State Building. We spent a lot of time walking around and found tons of attractions nearby. The bed was very comfy and the shower was nice and hot. The staff was courteous and the only complaint I have is that the a/c unit did not work properly. The weather was nice while we were there so we didn't complain, and we spent little of our time in the room. Over all, I would do it again for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Touring NYC”
Reviews.Author: ccb9801
Reviews.Content: The rooms at Eastgate are clean, spacious, with a kitchenette, and very convenient to all there is to see in NYC. The help was very pleasant and efficient. If you are a light sleeper, I would recommend asking for a room on a higher floor (on the 23rd floor- west side- ) because we heard cars honking their horns from 6:30a.m. onward. The draperies were a bit worn in spots, but, not enough to impact your sleep. Overall, it was a nice hotel in a good location and I would recommmend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at Eastgate”
Reviews.Author: PK6
Reviews.Content: I took my 12-year old daughter and 13-year old niece to NYC for the weekend. We took the subway from JFK to the hotel which was interesting (only $2 each from JFK to Howard Beach to 42nd Street to Grand Central--5 minute walk from there to the hotel--JFK $5 connection was free that day for some reason). Cab ride would've been a $45 flat rate. Our first experience at the Hotel wasn't good...the front desk person wouldn't provide our room at 1:00 pm as it "wasn't ready". The bellman overheard and volunteered to check the room himself. I think he saw that I had planned to have the girls nap (had been up since 4:00 am) right on the lobby couches until the room was ready and smartly offered to get us in. Not sure why the front desk didn't check to see, but it helps to be persistent. Room was already made up and available. Housekeeping was then great with quickly providing extra linens and towels. The room was very large. We had a "1 bed suite" ($270 first night, $215 second night). It wasn't really a suite with a door to the bedroom, but it had a sitting area as well as a table with 4 chairs. Kitchen was adequate--just used the refrigerator and freezer. Furniture was a bit worn and dated. Blankets provided for the pull-out couch were filled with holes. Bathroom was tiny and not as clean as it could've been. The hairdryer was especially dirty, and there were several cracks in the mirror and tile. Bed was comfortable and the room was quiet on the 10th floor. The heat didn't seem to work very well, but we were still comfortable. We didn't spend much time in the hotel, so we weren't that fussy. We felt very safe. I had stayed at the Affinia Dumont also in the Murray Hill neighborhood--which was a much more upscale property but a further walk to Grand Central Station. However, prices there have increased significantly. I was very happy with the room and with our stay at Eastgate. The bellman arranged a town car for us back to JFK for a $50 flat rate. Nice driver; enjoyed much better than a cab ride. Kids loved it! The location of this hotel is great--walked to Grand Central Station, Empire State Building, all the great restaurants on 3rd Avenue, Times Square, Bryant Park, and even to Rockefeller Centre. Only took 3 cab rides in 3 days. The Gray Line double-decker bus tours are outstanding. You can get on and off at various parts throughout the city (buy tickets online for a $5 savings). Guides are very entertaining. You can start at Times Square and go from there. The girls loved the city, especially the tour of NBC. Our only regrets were not making it out to the Statue of Liberty and wasting time going up to the top of the Empire State Building--too long of a line and the girls were quickly bored. I recommend this hotel for families with kids. Great neighborhood, close to everything, very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellyship
Reviews.Content: Booked a junior suite through Scooch.com - £480.00 for 4 nights for 2 of us - bargain for what we got. Massive room, clean, great location, no noise, fast lifts, friendly staff, hot shower/bath- would go back, no question!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Los Altos, Ca and NYC, Ny
Reviews.Title: “Quality in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: VitaminTee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Eastgate for 2 weeks while my apartment was renovated and my experience was wonderful. I booked a full studio suite with living room, and it was clean, up to date and spacious. The Kitchen, which I only used for the freezer, fridge, and microwave, was awesome! it was like living in my apartment, but with maid service. The staff was wonderful and accomodated my requests. Only downside is the cost of internet service, $10 a day or $40ish dollars a week, for what I paid it should be an included amenity, imo. There are restaurants, bars, and stores conveniently located to the hotel, all are pretty good. Also, don't bother taking a cab, just walk to Grand Central (and visit the market!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family/Friends Affair!”
Reviews.Author: Sumfabgear
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leary when I saw the $230 price on a room for 4. You can't get anything that cheap, especially with a kitchen. Wow! Were we surprised! There was room for 6, easily. The rooms were clean and smoke-free. Nothing fancy, just clean and comfy. There were two toilets a dining table. I felt like I was at home in the room. The hotel is close enough to Grand Central to quickly get you anywhere in the city. There must be a half-dozen Irish pubs within a stone's throw!! This is the perfect place for a family/friend's getaway. The staff were friendly, warm, and helpful. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent suite hotel”
Reviews.Author: greyadventurer
Reviews.Content: Needed a place for 5 adults in central NY and this place hit the spot. This is a 25 storey, all-suite hotel (meaning all rooms have separate living/lounge area) in the Murray Hill part of town on East 39th st between 2nd + 3rd Avenue. We had a 2 bedroom suite (1 with 2 double beds + 1 with 2 singles) plus a queen size settee pull-out in the lounge. This lounge was 33ft by 14ft plus a separate fully equipped kitchenette at the end. TVs in all the rooms and a bathroom for each bedroom. Taking the recommendation of an earlier Tripadvisor, we went for an upper floor to escape some of the traffic noise, although, because it is between avenues there is much less traffic going past the hotel - something to bear in mind if you're looking at hotels on the busy Avenues in NY. The reception area is small but the staff were very helpful and there is a smart Italian restaurant next door which supplies room service if requested. It's within walking distance of UN building/Grand Central station and there are great places for breakfast such as Snappys or Frontier (eggs bendedict) on 40 th or the Diner on 45st between 2nd + 3rd. They also have room variations to cater for couples etc. Overall a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBicep
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel. Huge rooms, very clean and a very central location. I got an excellent price on Travelocity so booked a Queen Studio for a weekend. The purpose of the trip was to spend time in NYC and meet friends visiting from Australia. They booked the same Hotel and I was concerned that they might be unhappy with it and I would feel some responsibility. It was more important for them to be happy as they were spending 9 nights there. They had a one bedroon suite and were delighted with it. Huge living room with dining table, arm chairs and a pull out sleeper, bedroom with 2 queen beds, full size kitchen, and adequate bathroom. Closets and drawers galore! Both of us couldn't be more satisified and I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone who wants to visit NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Olathe1
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel through Quikbook in late April for an amazing New York rate of $160 a night for four nights. What a value. Large rooms, clean, good location near Grand Central Station. The staff is very helpful. I could go on but at current New York hotel rates this place is a terrific choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: lmnopEaganMN
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience here. I was a bit wary, considering the extremely affordable rate, but was pleasantly surprised. The room is not lush by any means, but it suited us fine. I had a couple of nit-picky issues with dust on the tv and closet shelves, but was satisfied with overall cleanliness. We were happy with the size of the room and the kitchenette was such a bonus for us. The downside of having a kitchenette is that our neighbors decided to cook curry one night and the smell was invasive...wish they would've invited us over :) We were happy with the location. Many restaurants nearby as well as a D'Agastino grocery just around the corner on 3rd Ave. It's just a few blocks to the subway at Grand Central so its easy to go anywhere in the city. And what a view of the Chrysler building as you head towards GC. Our only headache here was miscommunication between Orbitz and the hotel. We paid for 5 nights but Orbitz told Eastgate we were staying 4 nights. Reservations Manager Donna was extremely helpful and prompt in resolving the issue. Lucky for us our room was available for the last night. We give this hotel a thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “plenty of space”
Reviews.Author: kiershay
Reviews.Content: i agree with what others have said. large clean rooms with small kitchen useful for us to have cereal and toast in the morning.about a five minute walk to grand central subway.quiet location.plenty of bars and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: rltje
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for three days with my wife, two kids and an infant and had a great experience in every aspect. Service: We arrived from with the red eye from Ca so we were at the hotel at 7:00am. Not only did they let us into our room, they upgraded us to a junior suite free of charge. everybody was extra kind and helpful starting with the bell boy through the reception and the room service. every request was answered very quickly and efficiently (extra towels, making the sofabed, crib etc.). Room: we got a junior suite on the 18th floor. The room is huge not just in NY standards. it has a queen bed, and a sleeper sofa that even when open still leaves a huge space for the kids to play around. the kitchen is fully equipped and very helpful with the kids. the bath is a decent size with good pressure from the shower which is not always common in NY. the furniture and design is not philip stark, but everything looks clean and well maintained. The room has a very large window which brings in a lot of light and the view is quite nice (facing north). The room was very quiet. Location: The hotel is locatred on 39th street between 2nd and 3rd avenue. I personally think there are not that many bad locations in NY, and that goes for the eastgate as well. its convenient for getting in and out of the city (very close to the mid town tunnel), 5 minute walk to grand central and all the subway connections, 5-15 minute walk to 5th avenue and rockfellar centre, and the empire state building. 20-25 minute walk to times square and central park. btw - the japanese restaurant adjacent to the hotel has excellent sushi. Since this vacation was planned well in advance, we got all this at a really good price. Also, i will mention that i have stayed recently at the affinia manhattan on business and had a very good experience as well (although i prefer the eastgate location).

Reviews.Title: “Good location - plenty of space”
Reviews.Author: RPFLondon
Reviews.Content: Most positive aspect was size of rooms. We booked a room with 2 queen beds for adults + 2 children. It is the largest room I have ever had in NY (compared to Marriott, Sheraton, Waldorf) Room also had a small kitchen Very clean. Friendly staff Good location, not too noisy (on the 20th floor)

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Affinia standards, but not bad for NYC”
Reviews.Author: rackensack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eastgate Tower recently for two nights while on business in Midtown. Have stayed at other Affinia properties and was a bit worried about this one given the rate I got. It was about what I expected -- a little more shabby/run-down than other Affinia properties, but in the same mold as the Surrey: spacious room, full galley-style kitchen, and clean but somewhat dated-looking furnishings and decor. I would definitely consider it on future trips to this client, as it's convenient to them, and if I ever get a chance to bring the family to the city I might give it a shot -- not the most convenient location for being a tourist, but for space and value for money it might be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Plenty of Space, Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: ukwlb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in New York, staying at the Eastgate Tower. Excellent location on 39th and 3rd with easy access to all the sites and Grand Central Station. It felt very safe walking about at night, but we were only 2 blocks from the UN so that might have had something to do with it. We had a one bed apartment and as I travelled with my sister and didn't fancy sharing a bed with her, I slept on the double sofa bed - it was the most comfortable bed too! The room was very spacious, clean and had everything we needed. Definitely recommend having a kitchen so you can do your own thing instead of eating out all the time. There were plenty of "order in" options locally too. The decor was a bit 80s, but the furnishings weren't that old. View wasn't much but we didn't choose the hotel for its view. Lovely staff, if a bit slow. I had to ask 3 times for my sofa bed to be made up and 3 times for an extra blanket, but we got there in the end. It didn't detract from the stay at all. Would definitely stay here again. Lots of eateries within a block or two. Docks Seafood Bar on 3rd & 40th was expensive, but very good. Frontier Restaurant on the fcorner of 39th & 3rd was excellent low priced, wide choice - great breakfasts! Also, plenty of mini marts and grocery stores to stock up the kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY STAFF”
Reviews.Author: shan20
Reviews.Content: i booked a four day trip to New York for my husbands 50th brithday and found Eastgate Tower i checked on tripadvisor which was getting some good reviews. I was not disappointed, not one of the biggest named hotel in New York but probably the friendliest. The rooms were clean and spacious and was very surprised by how little noise you could hear. As it was my husbands birhtday, he took his birthday cards with him and put them up in the room, when we got back after a day out there was a note, saying that the maid had noticed the cards and please except a bottle of wine and chocolates as a pressent, we both felt this was a nice touch and will hopefully return to this hotel one day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 week in March. I was a bit nervous before I went as I didn't really know what to expect. My husband and 18month old baby were also with me. It turned out to be just perfect especially the facilities necessary for a baby. The suite was so spacious and bedroom was huge. Cot and high chair were supplied. Kitchen had all the facilities necessary but pots and pans were limited if you intend to cook and also there was no kettle. Other than that is was super, couldn't have asked for more. It was very clean and the room service was fantastic. There was room for 6 people to stay in our suite, 2 double beds and a pull out couch. Also iron and ironing board were supplied and hair dryer in bathroom. We were on the 18th floor and had a great view of the Empire State and the rest of the buildings around. 5 minutes walk to Grand Central Station, nice little places around to eat especially 'The Frontier' on the corner of 3rd ave and 39th st, great for breakfast or lunch. Staff were helpful and doorman v. friendly. Restaurant next door which we ordered in from one night, very handy if unable to go out for a meal. If you want to be in the heart of the city, I would highly recommend the East Gate. It is not luxurious but has all the facilities. Anne,Steve & Sean. IRELAND

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: T&NBristol
Reviews.Content: Could'nt fault the hotel, does exactly what it says 'on the tin'. We were looking for a quite place to sleep after being out all day,which it was perfect for. Location fine as again safe quiet area within walking (easy) distance of most places/transport points. Enjoyed early (7- 8am) breakfasts in local diners (Sarges and Murrey Hill Diner) which sets you up for a full days sightseeing. Special mention to the staff who were all very friendly and enjoyed talking about 'their' town and reccomending places to go. Would stay again- which says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cami1978
Reviews.Content: These are VERY large rooms -- clean and comfortable -- but not luxurious. The kitchens in the junior suites are fully stocked with microwave, stove, and full-size refrigerator. Some of the staff are very friendly, while others are rather rude. A GREAT bargain when I stayed ($150/night), but prices are higher in the summer. A little far from the subway. The elevator occasionally breaks down, leading to long waits on high floors. End rooms are fairly quiet. Individual rooms can control the heat and A/C. Windows open for fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Great for long stays”
Reviews.Author: jancal77
Reviews.Content: I was finding it very difficult to get a reasonable rate for any hotel in New York city for the weekend even though it was the middle of winter. I eventually booked a flight/hotel package through Orbitz (word of warning: you are pretty much guaranteed to get a middle seat on the plane!). The Eastgate was great value for money. The room was twice the size of an average New York city hotel and there was a small kitchenette (stove, oven, microwave, sink, toaster, mini fridge). There are a couple of convenience stores near the hotel. The wifi access is not free but cheap ($10 per day). I thought the bathroom was in need of an upgrade and the furnishings in the room are not the best quality, but in general our stay was peaceful and incident free. We arrived off a red eye flight and the staff were very accommodating in finding us a room as quickly as possible. The location of the hotel is not "ideal" but it is only a few blocks from grand central station and the bus on 34th street takes you right to the Javits convention center (travel time is about 20 minutes to Javits). There were plenty of cabs nearby and we never had a problem getting around. There were a group of students checking out when we arrived, and I think this hotel is popular for groups who are on a budget. I would recommend this hotel for families because it is in a safe area, the rooms are spacious and you have the option of self-catering.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar Experience!”
Reviews.Author: cameronknowles
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eastgate Tower Hotel from February 22-25 and it lived up to all the rave reviews. The rooms were a good size, very spacious and more amenities than we really needed. The kitchen came in handy for keeping the beers cold and warming up leftovers. The staff were incredibly helpful and almost too friendly. Anything we needed they were more than happy to help us out, whether it was fixing the running toilet or pointing us in the right direction for a good meal. The toilet did actually run, but when we brought it to the attention of the front desk someone was in our room within minutes to take care of it. Cant beat that! The location was great, and it was nice to be slightly off the beaten path. Great food right around the hotel - really enjoyed the egg sandwiches at the little European cafe on 2nd Ave. Killer pizza just down the street too. Everything was within walking distance. Grand Central was less than a ten minute walk away and from there everything is just a $2 subway ride away. We actually took the trains to the hotel from JFK and did the same on the way out, and for $7 each way it couldnt be beat. Overall, my girlfriend and I were very happy with our stay and wouldnt hesitate to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugMum
Reviews.Content: Family of four from UK. Reading other reviews we knew the rooms were large, but it still gave us a fantastic supprise to see how spacious the rooms were. We have 2 children aged 10 and 9 and they had the 2 queen size beds in the bedroom, with their own tv, and we had the sofa bed in the lounge with plenty of peace and quiet. We were on the 24th floor and had great views of the Empire State Building from the bedroom, kitchen and bathroom. What a way to start the day with a shower looking out at the Empire State Building! We had great fun when we visited the ESB spotting our hotel! The room was very clean and cleaned each day and although the furniture is dated it is clean and nothing was broken or tatty. We heard no noise from other rooms or the corridors and for New York felt even the traffic was quiet. The staff were extremly friendly and helpful and the place is in a great location with a short walk to Grand Central station to easily get around. We highly recommend the Frontier diner for breakfast and snacks. I've stayed many times in New York, normally near Times Square, and have heard all the traffic noise and hotel noise in tiny rooms. Never again, from now on we will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal!”
Reviews.Author: mammanyc
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel on the web and booked directly with the property: booking was easy and when we arrived the staff at the front desk was very helpful and corteous. We were 3 adults and two children (one of which only a few months old) and we stayed in the hotel for more than three weeks. Our stay was very pleasant and confortable, the room was spacious even for the kids who had to spend a lot of time inside, due to the bad weather conditions. The location is particularly good for people who have to do business but also for tourists. We had a great experience and I would recommend the hotel to anyone who has to stay in NYC, even those who are in for a longer stay or those who are relocating to the city and need a temporary place (which was our case).

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: bluetowel
Reviews.Content: We booked direct through Affinia and asked for a 2 bedroom suite(smoking) on high floor but when we arrived reception said we had been allocated a non-smoking room! I remonstrated politely and we were found a smoking room immediately on 11th floor. 11G was huge with a twin room and a room with 2 queens. 2 bathrooms, a massive lounge area with a dining table, sofa and 2 armchairs and a decent sized kitchen ( no kettle though, but we used a pan to boil water for our tea. (Take some tea bags as the americans seem to like very weak tea! ). Plenty of cupboard space and hangers.Hardly any traffic noise but I always use ear plugs on holiday.Great location. Only 10 minute walk to Grand Central. Get a metrocard for bus and subway $24 for 7 days, cheaper for a shorter stay. Subway better than buses. Frontier diner on corner of E.39th and 3rd is just ok. Pizza menu in room, free delivery to hotel is great.Order a small (6 pieces) and see if 2 of you can eat it all!!All the staff good but Jenniffer especially. She knows her stuff and is a gem.So helpful and friendly.Recommend Garage Restaurant 99 7th Ave. Jazz bar/restaurant. Great food and atmosphere and waitress Sarah C. a joy. Pacific Grill at South Street Sea Port. Everything half price when we went on Sat 20th Jan.Borgo Antico 22 E.13th St. fantastic Italian. Would definitely stay at Eastgate again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Eastgate Tower Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amh4959
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was super friendly, very helpful and accommodating. Everyone was wonderful...it seemed that everyone enjoyed their job and was very friendly to the guests. The Eastgate Tower is a very family-friendly hotel and we will definitely stay there again. The Eastgate will be the 1st hotel we check for availability the next time we are in NYC. Conveniently located...in a gorgeous neighborhood, restaurants are every where. We were so close to the Grand Central Station and the subway as well as easy to hail a cab. We so enjoyed our visit to the EASTGATE HOTEL. Nothing fancy but very CLEAN and COMFORTABLE.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: venividiboggli
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults and 4 kids) stayed in a one-bedroom superior suite. Fantastic value. Tons of space. Nearest subway is a good 10 minute walk away. But that is the ONLY prob. Alex at the front desk and Patrick the doorman were incredibly helpful! Will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: RTW_guy
Reviews.Content: Booked a non-smoking queen studio suite, but was placed in a dual queen suite. Wonderful amounts of space. The furniture is dated, but pleasant, clean, and not worn. Wireless internet access is an extra charge, and is acceptable speed but couldn't access my Afghanistan e-mail account. Good location for the business I had at the UN. A few very minor problems -- peeling paint on bathroom windowsill, cigarette burn in a chair, and putty needed by the sink. Like a previous reviewer I thought the curtain couldn't close, but then saw there was a vinyl curtain behnd it. This was very effective in blocking light. Noise wasn't bad on the 22nd floor. As other posters mentioned, I found the staff courteous and helpful. The size of the room completely covered any drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, but not most convenient”
Reviews.Author: b00mers00ner
Reviews.Content: I am giving this an average because this is NYC, if it were Dallas or Chicago it would be an okay. Very spacious rooms, we stayed at two hotels in NYC and would probably not stay here again. You are 4 blocks from Grand Central which to me was a major detriment. On the other hand, This is a place for traveler's who need space, are with family, or are planning on being in NYC for more than a few days and do not want to feel cramped. HUGE closet space, kitchenettes with fridge, and dishware. The linens were lacking in quality and the room had an underlayment of funk. For example, there was a chair that had a deep white stain, from what I have no Idea. However, the room was quite clean other than that. I know ,sounds oxymoronic, but it is hard to explain. I would relate this hotel to a Motel Six, still a good value for the money, just not for us. NOTE: the pics on trip advisor are much more reflective of the actual hotel rather than the travel websites. Benefits; huge rooms for NYC standards, kitchenette with fridge & coffeemaker, hot water, decent (not great) towels, good for people with kids or teenagers. actually had a view, friendly staff. Detriments: not the most convenient to metros, weird funk/feel, no ice on floor, had to go downstairs or order from housekeeping, elevators very busy, so we always took service elevator or stairs. bed linens not the best, only one nightstand (drove my wife nuts), curtains did not close.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 9 days -- wanted to stay longer”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Cyclist
Reviews.Content: We needed either two hotel rooms or a 1 bedroom suite. The EastGate's price in June 2006 was $239/night. A price I haven't seen on subsequent visits to NYC -- it is the first hotel I check. Having a kitchen and dining room table enabled us to eat breakfast in our room every day -- saving the cost and the hassle of getting everyone ready at the same time. The beds were comfortable. Room very quiet. Shower hot. (That about sums up my needs!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LorelaiLii
Reviews.Content: Post-Thanksgiving 2006, 3 days. We reserved a queen studio suite (which was plenty of room for what we needed) and were amazed to find that we had been upgraded to what has to be described as a home: a two bedroom, two bath suite with a fully-equipped kitchen, full dining area and large living room. We took full advantage of being in the most exciting city on earth during Holiday time--the tree lighting at Rockefeller Center, ice skating, shopping, and more; and, then we came "home" to the Affinia Eastgate Tower Suites Hotel. We were always pleasantly greeted by the doorman or front desk staff, and the parking attendant was courteous and efficient (and the parking rates are quite reasonable for NYC). We were delighted by the cleanliness of the property and our suite, nearly miraculous because the housekeeping staff was virtually invisible. Every detail was addressed before we even had to ask. When it was time to leave, we were able to print our boarding passes with the computer in the lobby for a nominal charge. The views are nice, the elevators are quick, and the location is superb! Our stay: Simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “1st visit to New York and this hotel and it won't be my last !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NYCG
Reviews.Content: 2nd Nov 2006 I stayed in a queen bed suite and it was a great room with everything I needed, I was throughly spoilt. Excellent value for the room and the wonderful service we got. I can recommend the Il Sorgno which is part of the hotel. The staff are very friendly and cannot do enough for you. Kay Lovell, London.UK

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Clean, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: amy417
Reviews.Content: The Eastgate Tower is perfect for anyone who wants a lot of space in New York and all the amenities of home. I stayed in a Junior Suite for 4 nights, and had more than enough room to eat, work and sleep. So different from my room at the W, where I could hardly walk around my bed! Bathroom is quite small, but the rest of the room makes up for that lack of space. Wireless internet at $9.95/day is reasonable too. It's not a luxury hotel by any means, and definitely feels more like an apartment building, but for those who are staying for a few nights or longer, and particularly for families, it is a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: 209taff
Reviews.Content: me and the wife stayed at this hotel march 06 this was the 3rd time to the city and found this a great hotel ok there was some bad points 1 only one lift was working so there was a bit of a Q to use it, we allways walked down the stairs when going out and the staff would let us use the service lift when lobby was busy. 2 The first room we was given was not cleaned ,bit of a mix up and was given a upgraded room. even with the two bad point the staff was so helpful it felt like home by the end of the week . rooms was largest we have stayed in for newyork and cleaned daily the kithen was great for making snacks / coffee The location was good if you wont to doo some shoping and a short walk away grandcentral staion and gate way to the city we are planing to go back to newyork next christmas and this is where we are going to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry about a thing”
Reviews.Author: Burnsie
Reviews.Content: My friend and I and our three daughters (14,16,20) stayed in room 22G (2 bedroom suite) at The Eastgate this half term (21st to 28th October). When we arrived we had dropped off various parties via the Shuttle bus from Newark airport. They all seemed to be staying at very glossy-fronted establishments and when we saw The Eastgate we thought "ordinary, nice-ish, passable but not glossy". However the minute we saw our suite we changed our minds. It VASTLY exceeded oue expectations! I snore, so took the smaller bedroom (big!) My girls were more than happy to share the huge lounge sofabed. My friend and her daughter took the bigger bedroom. We had loads of space-and that includes cupboards and hanging space. There were 2 little bathrooms each with a hairdryer (bath AND shower). The little kitchen was much used, and had everything we needed. The available space was fantastic. We enjoyed being together but not "confined". Location was great. Sadly my 20 year old's phone went unexplicably missing from her bedside( was using it as an alarm clock ). The verdict remains open on that one. The staff were as helpful as they could be in the circumstances. The view from front and back windows was excellent. The Trend Cafe is a great Deli opposite The Frontier Diner on the corner. Cleanliness was first class -I had to mop a flood in the bathroom and the white towel used did not register one speck of dirt! It was pristine after the mopping up! Everyone was nice and I would recommend this hotel. I had been to NY before but my hotel was not half as good- snooty beyond belief and my face didn't fit, along with crummy accommodation. This was so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Shakespeare_fan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. The hotel is clean and neat. It looks like a former apartment building that had been converted to a hotel. The room was large -- with a kitchen. Everything worked fine -- toilet, fridge, shower, A/C, etc. It lacks the niceties of the nearby Affinia properties -- no pillow menu, no fancy toiletries, no fresh fruit and juice in the lobby. Small, lobby -- can get crowded quickly if 3 or 4 people are there with baggage. Just a large, clean NY hotel room. It is in a good location near a lot of restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Price and size are right!”
Reviews.Author: Nonprofit_traveller
Reviews.Content: This is NOT one of NYC's most elegant hotels, but the rooms are spacious, the stafffriendly and helpful, the location is terrific, and the price is more reasonable than most. We just returned from a 3-night stay in a two bedroom suite. This is the second time in the last year that we have rented a 2-bedroom suite at the Eastgate Tower. The living room is huge, each bedroom has its own bathroom, and there is a basic but adequate kitchen, complete with dishes, silverware, dishwasher, stove, microwave, toaster, and full-sized refrigerator. They have wi-fi access in the rooms for $9.95 a day -- it worked well. I was in NYC on business, and shared the two bedroom suite with a work colleague, as it was cheaper than two rooms and you get more space. We shopped for breakfast foods in a great grocery store a block away, and ate a couple of lunches in a terrific American diner on the corner. The furniture is a bit shabby, and the beds could be more comfortable though are tolerable. But everything has been very clean, and the hotel staff very friendly and service-oriented. This hotel won't work for you if you require elegance and a touch of luxury, but if you want some space, clean bathrooms, and a kitchen in a safe neighborhood a short walk from Grand Central, it is a good and economical choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great at all!!”
Reviews.Author: mandicait7
Reviews.Content: My three girlfriends and I stayed here over labor day weekend. We picked this hotel because it would accomodate all of us comfortably. I will start with the good parts: The rooms are VERY spacious and the staff (well just one concierge in particular) was very helpful. Bad: although spacious, the rooms were dirty and majorly outdated. The carpet was grungy, the fridge smelled of rubbish, the television had white dots floating accross the screen, the dressers wouldn't open and the plastic coating was peeling off and dirty. Our view was of some poor people's apartment building next door(poor because of us feeling like we were constatly staring at them). The location is alright-not great. The hotel restaurant was closed indefinetly. I didn't want to walk the halls late at night for fear of what would be around the next corner. The gym is ill-equipped and outdated. They didn't give us pillows or sheets for the pullout couch and when we asked to have bedding brought up they brought two top sheets and no pillows. Then I called and asked to bring some extra pillows and we were brought ONE.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expections”
Reviews.Author: LMEHM
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! We had no idea what to expect, but relied on the reviews written on this site. We were more than pleasantly surprised that it exceeded all expectations. Three of us stayed in a 2-queen bed suite and had PLENTY of room. The location was great (very near Grand Central Station) and the staff was very helpful and friendly, going out of their way to make sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. I can't imagine staying anywhere else in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with teen”
Reviews.Author: willworkforvacation
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weeks stay at the Eastgate with my 13-year-old daughter. The location is perfect if you like to sleep soundly at night, and don't mind a one to two block walk to the bus.
