My daughter and I went non-stop day and night (late), and I always felt safe returning late. This summer had record highs in the city, but the lobby and room were always cool and comfortable. The staff, too, was really helpful with directions, and information that helped us get to the NJ airport safely on the last morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and space”
Reviews.Author: cwalton
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in New York, where we stayed at the Eastgate Tower Suite hotel. Having stayed in NY before, we were expecting small cramped accomodation. However, we were pleasantly surprised to find that the room (queen sized) was very large and spaceous. We were located on the 24th floor which afforded a nice view of the surrounding skyscrapers. The location was perfect for visiting the main tourist attractions in Manhattan on foot, e.g. Central Park, UN building, 5th Avenue, Empire State building, Grand Central Station etc. The hotel staff were pleasant and friendly and the rooms were clean and well featured, also the price was very reasonable for the area. The only downsides to the hotel are that the decor is slightly dated, and it is a few blocks from a subway station. However, given its great location and low price, we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Really disliked the Eastgate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trisha1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Eastgate Hotel NYC and the hotel was horrible. The location was okay but the clieanliness was poor and decore seemed to be from the 1960's and completely tacky. The lobby was nice but as soon as you go past this it all went downhill from there. There was only one lift working which caused caos when new guests arrived with luggage etc.. so we used the stairway for most of the four days there. We spent €650.00 for 3 nights accomodation which was one standard room with kitchentte. It reminded me more of a hostel than a hotel. I did go to reception and complain the first night but if I wanted a different type of room it would have cost another $140 per night and the only difference in the room is that the bedroom was seperate to kitchen. They did however change my room the next day to a standard room on a different floor which was cleaner. The hotel looked completely different than the pictures on their website and I really was disappointed. I really dont think this hotel is good value for money and unfortunitely there was no rooms available in any of the other hotels we tried the first night we arrived or we would have changed hotels and tried getting our money back afterwards. We did price some better hotels while there for our next trip and would not have paid much more if at all for them!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings......”
Reviews.Author: Foss4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last week. On arrival, I was very disappointed as I felt it did not really resemble photographs I had seen on their website and our room was nothing like the floor plan. The reception area/lounge was very small and the corridor felt dingy. I had requested a room on a high floor but, presumably, the studio appartments are all low down as we were given floor 5. I was disappointed as the room was smaller than I expected and tatty in places e.g. cupboard handles were missing Having said that, the room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable, so really that's what's most important. The reception staff were also very nice, but I did not like the bellboy, Louis, as he was most unhelpful whenever I asked him anything about transportation or using the phone. Location wise it was fairly good. We were able to walk a few blocks to Grand Central Station where we took the subway downtown, we were also able to walk to Macy's etc easily. I don't feel that our studio suite offered great value for money as it was essentially a standard hotel room with a sink, microwave, oven & fridge along one wall. The floor plan gave the impression that we would have a separate kitchen area and also some arm chairs. The other suites may be better but I don't know if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday inn type room in great location at relatively great price.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days with my wife for a brief New York vacation. The room was fine, but basically kind of old and in need of updating - needs new carpet, etc. This was like staying at an average holiday inn. We got a junior suite because it was only a few dollars more than a regular room, and it was very roomy, especially for New York. The price was great at about 200 per night when other hotels in the area were all well into the 300 and 400+ neighborhood. This place is great if you want an excellent midtown location and you don't plan on spending much time in the room and don't care about a fancy hotel and fancy room, and you want to save some cash. If you want to have a nice luxurious hotel experience, don't stay here, but plan on paying more - a lot more. I gave this 3 stars, because it is a very plain basic place and for that reason, doesn't deserve any more than that. However, if what you want out of your New York trip is to have a decent, though not great, hotel room in a great location at a great price, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: vvg
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Eastgate Tower. Having gone to school in NYC, I appreciated the nice size of our room - which I think was larger than some of my apartments in NYC. We choose the basic suite and had a queen bed, table for two, and fully functioning kitchen and nice bath. Cover of the bed was a little worn, but the room was very clean. We were on the 2nd floor so we did hear some street noise, but not enough to bother us. I stuck my head into the fitness room and it looked to be pretty nice as well. Staff both coming and leaving were warm and welcoming. We arrived late and decided to grab a bite to eat at the hotel's resaurant next to the lobby. We had an excellent dinner and the staff there was also great. Very attentive and accomodating to us and other diners there. All in all we had a great stay and I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Location to explore New York”
Reviews.Author: City Seasider
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eastgate Tower between 26 and 30 April 2006, and it was great. Two couples went, and we had one of the big two bedroom/two bathroom suites. It was clean, well equipped and quiet. We were on the 8th floor, so were most likely to get traffic noise if there was any, but the only thing we heard was the local fire engine going about its duties occasionally. The kitchen area, complete with dishwasher, was a real bonus. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, and I would certainly go to the Eastgate again. This was our first time in New York and I had wondered from other reviews of the Eastgate if we were going to be miles away from everything. We wern't. None of us are in our first flush of youth, but we walked almost everywhere safely day and night. Grand Central; Empire State; Times Square; United Nations; Central Park, and Macys were easily reached on foot. We did get a tour bus (well worth it) Downtown and broke the journey to "do" Brooklyn Bridge, etc. There was a 90 minute wait for the ferry to land on the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island, so we went on the free Staten Island Ferry which passes close by - a much better option, and the views of Downtown on the way back are stunning. One thing we British are used to at home is easily accessible loos when we are out and about. I had read there were none in New York, but they are there if you look in all the places named above. Eating wasn't a problem, and the Townhouse Diner at 2nd Ave and 38th Street can be highly recommended. The flight to/from Gatwick/Newark was good, and the Supershuttle from the airport was a free tour of New York. As there were four of us we took a taxi back to Newark which cost the same as going by train from Penn Central. We had a splendid short break; the people of New York were friendly and I would certainly go again - and to the Eastgate.

Reviews.Title: “A little worn but large rooms”
Reviews.Author: odie1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for two nights. The hotel is a little worn, furniture in the room was a bit outdated and the bedding also not newer but the room (1 bedroom suite) was very large, had two bathrooms (one of which definitely needed some help), and the full kitchen. The room was clean and service was very helpful. Location is not too bad, easily within walking distance to Grand Central which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; great room”
Reviews.Author: charrisdc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute because another hotel that I'd booked using hotels.com looked like it was going out of business (long story). We wanted a suite since we have three teenagers and wanted to be in mid-town and walking distance to Times Square, Grand Central, etc. This little gem worked out beautifully for us! The room was huge and clean and bright and wondderful. Since we were only there two days and one night there wasn't need for the kithcen but I can imagine it would have been useful for a longer stay. We had to wait several hours before checking in so we were able to leave our bags with the bell captain and went out and explored. We were on the 20th (?) floor and the kids loved the view! Two huge bedrooms (one with double/double and the other with two twins), two bathrooms, a HUGE living room with dining area, sleeper sofa, TV and desk, and a good sized kitchen. Great value. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a 2 1/2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DisneyOrBust1
Reviews.Content: Our March 2006 3 night stay at the Eastgate was overall pretty good for a 2 1/2 star. We were a family of 8 and stayed in their 2 bedroom suite. First off, I have to stay at a clean hotel room, especially because we travel with very young kids. Although the rooms are a little outdated, it was clean and cleaned each day. The room attendant even did our dishes. I was happy with the hotel. There was plenty of space. My kids were able to run around like they do at home. The living room and dining room were one room. They even brought us a rollaway bed free of charge. The staff was very friendly. The elevator was a little small...but no problems with serving it's purpose. Shortly after we checked into our room, the lady at the front desk phoned to make sure we were happy with our room. The kitchen was a little small but functional. The airconditioner worked fine. The hotel is off a main road so noise is not too bad. Although, be sure to ask for a room NOT facing the fire station if your are a light sleeper. The hotel is walking distance to many attractions. Just to give you an idea of distance...Our kids are ages 5 and 1...my 5 year old walked everywhere with us. Although this hotel was no Ritz Carlton and can not compare, the Eastgate was clean and a great value. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for first time visitors to New York City”
Reviews.Author: ozbev
Reviews.Content: Stayed here summer of 2005. Read stacks of reviews for other hotels in similar price range but this seemed the most suitable. Yes room was a little dated, but comfortable and considering we were not terribly high up the noise level was bearable unless you wished to sleep in after 9am and then traffic horns were considerable. Small kitchenette but quite satisfactory for our needs for breakfast/lunches. We considered it to be quite centrally located and reception staff very helpful, particularly with booking a helicopter flight. Would recommend and also return to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic<Fantastic<Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mo617
Reviews.Content: After having a HORRIBLE experience in booking a room at WooGo Lincoln Apartments, I immediately booked a room with Eastgate Towers. From the moment I arrived the experience was WONDERFUL!!! The manager George Drepaul was an absolute pleasure and the staff upgraded me to a EXTREMELY SPACIOUS 2 bedroom, 2 Bathroom unit. I felt right at home in this hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting the city. The location is great. The staff is great. The rooms, or should I say suites, are FANTASTIC and the most spacious I have ever experienced in New York. Full kitchens, extremely large bedrooms and full living room/dining room area. I wouldnt stay anywhere else after this wonderful experience. The Italian restaurant downstairs was VERY good as well. Eastgate Towers is my new favorite place to stay in New York and I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Well located Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dking2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in March 2006. The hotel room was somewhat dated and not luxurious but this is reflected in the price you pay which offers great value for money. We had a twin room (two doubles) with small kitchen area and single bathroom. Room was far larger than other hotels I have stayed in in NY (despite having paid more for others). Hotel was well situated being an easy walk from both Grand Central and the Empire State Building. Also good bus links on 3rd Ave but very busy on weekdays means walking is quicker for short journeys. Neighbourhood was quiet which meant despite only being 2 floors up could sleep through without traffic noise disturbances I have experienced when staying in busier parts of the city. Good selection of restaurants within easy walking distance (Akane Japanese just across from hotel was simple but well priced and good quality). Also great deli / bagel cafe just along road by jct 3rd Ave and 38th Street. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the main sights in NYC whilst having a peaceful haven to return to for a good nights rest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during the cold spell in February 2006. The room (Junior Deluxe suite)was always cleaned every day, and extremely comfortable. The staff were exceedingly friendly and helpful, and the location is perfect for the visitor who requires a peaceful area to return to whilst still being within walking distance of the main areas of interest. I will be returning to this hotel when next in New York, and would recommend this establishment to any visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Value - Close Enough to Almost Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Juna
Reviews.Content: We're a family of 5 (2 adults, 3 teenagers) and we recently stayed at the Eastgate Towers in Murray Hill. That was a great choice for us! Thank you Tripadvisor for the great tip! We requested a high floor 1 bedroom suite with a view of the Empire State Building (if possible). I booked our travel directly with [--------](found their booking engine to be friendlier for a family of 5 compared to the travel websites which add a surcharge for the 5th person). Much to my surprise, when we checked in...they granted our wish! The view of Empire State was kinda obstructed, but no complaints here! First of all, we were just happy to have lots of windows with views! The last time I was in NYC with my daughter, we stayed in a cramped bedroom with a window that looked out to a brick wall! The staff were very helpful...and very courteous. We flew in via Newark and decided to be adventurous and took the Newark Airtran connection to Penn Station and took a cab from there. For a family of 5, the train ride and cab ride to the hotel cost us $78. On our way to La Guardia on our return trip we asked the hotel concierge to reserve a cab for us...and since there were 5 of us, the concierge said we would need a van. Of course, the taxi-minivans were the only ones that we could get around in. Again, to our pleasant surprise, a shiny, black Lincoln Navigator was waiting for us promptly in front of the hotel during our day of departure. BTW, this ride for a family of 5 was very reasonable compared to our train/cab adventure (albeit La Guardia is closer than Newark)...this "limo" ride cost $50 + toll + tip. OVerall, our stay at the Eastgate Towers was a great experience. For the price, cannot beat the fact that we were able to stay together in one suite, "family style". We had 2 queen beds, a sofa bed, a well-equipped kitchen (with microwave, stove, dishwasher, toaster, coffee maker), dining room, and 2 TVs! It was nice to have room to spread out and relax, and have some late night snack when we felt the munchies! That, plus we had views! The neighborhood was safe...and very accessible to major tourist spots. One can catch the bus to downtown on 5th avenue or the subway from Grand Central Station...leisurely walks both. Ming's, the Chicken Place on 3rd Ave were decent eats. We did not care too much for Frontier Diner which also delivers to the hotel. There's also a McDonald's on 39th and 2nd for those fastfood cravings. Highly recommended....more centrally located than Embassy Suites. Will definitely stay there again next time we're in NYC. Check out Eastgate's sister hotels owned by [----------]!

Reviews.Title: “One good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Girish
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We had a 1 bed suite for a week. The prices are very reasonable and the service is good. We had A LOT OF SPACE. Location is great and takes less than 10 mins to walk to Times Square or even lesser to Grand Central. You also get cabs right outside the hotel. Staff is courteous. Its obviously not the waldorf but as I didn't pay for it, I don't expect it to be. Please see room pics attached. (Not as outdated as brought out by other reviews.)

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price - considering it's New York!”
Reviews.Author: Semi-Backpacker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eastgate Tower with a few friends on January 14th. We initially booked a one-bedroom, but were upgraded to a two-bedroom suite which was extremely spacious! I agree that it was outdated, but not bad at all given the price. It was nice having a kitchen and two bathrooms! Space is a luxury in New York, so we were definitely pleased and the free upgrade was a nice bonus!

Reviews.Title: “a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i was disapionted with the eastgate tower, the suite i stayed in was spacious but VERY outdated, the lobby was very nice, but small, also the fitness center had minimal offerings and needless to say was very small, i would not recommend this hotel unless you are on a tight budget and need to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, informal hotel for great price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Eastgate Towers in Jan 2006 for a weekend. The cost was comparable to budget hotels in the city, but our room was a very spacious suite, which included a kitchenette. This is not a posh hotel by any means, but it is clean, affordable and (unusual in New York) not an overpriced rip=off. There is also an internet terminal in the lobby with a very reasonable cost to use. The hotel is easily accessible to subways and buses and taxicabs, and very close to many different restaurants, including one that provides room service. Overall a very satisfying experience, there will be no surprises with this place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: AstridCB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 4 nights at the Eastgate Tower Hotel and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone who is visiting New York and wants a central hotel without paying huge prices. Yes, it's a basic hotel and yes, the lifts leave a lot to be desired (one was not working while we were there and being on the 23rd floor meant a long wait at times), however, it's location (just 5/10 minutes easy walk to Grand Central Station and about 10/15 minutes to the Empire State Building) and the friendliness of the staff make it a hotel I would certainly recommend and stay in again. Our room was large with a kitchen area and wonderful views and there were plenty of bars and restaurants in the near vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lizar20
Reviews.Content: I used to live in New York 10 years ago when I was in my 20s and loved it. But now I dread visiting NY because I've stayed in so many awful hotels! Eastgate Towers has fixed that. The rooms are exactly like my old studio apartment - clean, spacious and functional. The neighbourhood is relatively central, with the subway only a few blocks away, and useful shops and restaurants on 3rd avenue. The kitchen has everything you need. The staff were helpful and courteous. If you want to know what its like to live in NY, this is the place to stay!

HotelInfo.Name: Eastgate Tower
HotelInfo.Address: 222 East 39th Street, New York City, NY 10016
